job_description:
100% remote job

Senior Product Manager | Outliant | Chile

Company Overview:
We are a leading technology consulting and product development firm that empowers businesses to thrive in the digital age. Our team of talented professionals collaborates with clients from diverse industries to deliver innovative solutions, build cutting-edge products, and optimize their technology landscape. As we continue to expand our services and grow our client base, we are seeking a dynamic and passionate Senior Product Manager to join our team.

Position Overview:

As a Senior Product Manager at Outliant, you will play a pivotal role in leading the end-to-end product lifecycle, from conceptualization and planning to execution and launch. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, designers, business analysts, and clients, to define product roadmaps and drive the successful delivery of high-quality solutions. Your expertise in understanding both business and technology will be essential in shaping products that align with client objectives and market demands.

Key Responsibilities:
• Product Strategy and Planning: Collaborate with stakeholders to define product visions, goals, and strategies. Conduct market research, competitor analysis, and customer interviews to identify opportunities and user needs. Translate findings into clear product requirements and roadmaps.
• Project Management: Oversee the product development lifecycle, ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget. Use project management tools to track progress and mitigate risks. Regularly communicate project status to stakeholders.
• Requirement Elicitation and Documentation: Gather detailed requirements from clients, translating business objectives into actionable product features and specifications. Document and maintain product backlogs, user stories, and acceptance criteria for development teams.
• User Experience (UX) and Design: Collaborate with UX designers to create intuitive and user-friendly interfaces. Provide input on wireframes and prototypes to ensure the final product meets user expectations and business goals.
• Technical Liaison: Serve as a bridge between technical teams and clients. Facilitate communication, answer technical queries, and manage expectations regarding product development and delivery.
• Quality Assurance and Testing: Work closely with QA teams to define testing strategies and ensure products meet quality standards. Conduct thorough testing and validation to guarantee the product's functionality and performance.
• Release Management: Plan and coordinate product releases, including versioning, deployment, and post-launch monitoring. Address any issues or bugs post-launch and drive continuous improvement.
• Client Relationship Management: Build strong and trusting relationships with clients, becoming a trusted advisor on product-related matters. Understand their needs and provide valuable insights to drive product success.
• Market and Industry Research: Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and market demands. Utilize this knowledge to identify new business opportunities and potential product enhancements.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field.
• Proven experience 10 years as a Product Manager or similar role in technology consulting and product development environments.
• Demonstrated success in delivering software products or solutions that meet business objectives and customer expectations.
• Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills to interact with diverse stakeholders effectively.
• Solid understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc.) and product management tools (e.g., Jira, Trello).
• Technical acumen to comprehend complex technical concepts and communicate effectively with development teams.
• Analytical mindset, data-driven decision-making abilities, and a passion for solving problems.
• A strategic thinker with a creative approach to product innovation and a strong customer-centric mindset.

Our Core Values:
• Pursuit of Excellence: We are extremely competitive, ambitious, and driven to be exceptional. There is no standard high enough and we will never settle. We aspire to attract, retain, and empower the very best people.
• Startup Mentality: Outliant began with 5 startup founders, and startup culture is deep in our DNA. It's a critical advantage that allows us to move faster, be more resourceful, and empower our team at all levels. We are in the early chapters of our journey.
• World-Class Remote Collaboration: Outliant is (and always has been) a 100% remote company – we have no offices and our teams are distributed around the world. Given the freedom and autonomy this provides, we require that our people excel in this remote structure.

Join Our Team:

If you are a driven and forward-thinking Senior Product Manager with a passion for technology, product development, and helping clients succeed, we welcome you to apply. Become a part of our collaborative and innovative team, and together, let's shape the future of technology solutions and drive transformative business outcomes for our clients.

Why You Should Work with Us:

As a member of our team, you'll enjoy:
• Flexible hours – work whenever you choose
• Work from home
• Unlimited PTO
• Non-working holidays per country of residence
• 13th-month bonus
• Salary increases
• Financial support for online courses
• Mental health and well-being programs
• Fun and casual work environment
• Employee engagement activities and virtual gatherings
• We are a diverse, global team
#J-18808-Ljbffr

job_description:
1 Vacante Finaliza en 42 días Jornada Completa Subgerente de Área Región Metropolitana de Santiago Las Condes

Importante empresa relacionada al retail busca un Subgerente de Proyectos TI para ERP y E-Commerce.

Objetivos Generales:

Elaborar los planes y liderar el desarrollo integral de los proyectos, controlando que sean diseñados, construidos e implementados de acuerdo a las normas, procedimientos, objetivos y requerimientos del negocio.

Asegurar la eficiente utilización de los recursos y la calidad de los proyectos desarrollados.

Liderar a su equipo, asignando las tareas que desempeñará cada cual a fin que la detección de necesidades del usuario sea correctamente transformada en definiciones y guías que utilizará el equipo de trabajo.

Principales Funciones:

1. Levantar, Administrar y Controlar una cartera de proyectos de negocio en relación con sus aspectos tecnológicos, funcionales y generales, cautelando que se cumplan los requerimientos planteados, dentro del plazo y los costos establecidos, para lograr la satisfacción del cliente.

2. Administrar la relación con la cartera de procesos y/o usuarios asignada, dirigiendo el levantamiento de requerimientos, análisis preliminar, diseño de posibles soluciones, preparando y presentando nuevos proyectos con sus respectivos casos de negocio que vengan a resolver necesidades de sus procesos y/o usuarios asignados.

3. Mantener y gestionar la relación con los proveedores externos que apoyen la realización de su cartera de proyectos, exigiendo el cumplimiento de los compromisos contraídos.

4. Controlar la formalización y documentación de los proyectos, así como la formalización de contratos con proveedores externos, contratación de servicios o de personal.

Perfil deseado

Conocimientos de Oracle y/o ERP World Class

Implementación proyecto E-Commerce para retail

Seguridad tecnológica

Bases de Datos MS SQL Server y PostgreSQL

Sistemas Operativos Windows y Linux

Estudios de Ingeniería Civil Informática

Alrededor de 10 años de experiencia

job_description:
We are ODILO: a fast-growing edtech company with a mission to democratize access to high-quality education and provide educational technology solutions to help our users reach their full potential.

Through our solutions, we provide access to millions of digital content items from the world's best providers and, using educational technology and Artificial Intelligence, enabling any organization to create its own unlimited learning ecosystem.

Currently, more than 4,500 institutions (governments, schools, libraries, universities, companies, and startups) place their trust in Odilo, providing access to their unlimited learning platforms to more than 149 million users in over 50 countries.

Our team is truly international (19+ nationalities) with the best talent across the education, media, content, and technology sectors.

As the Country Manager Education, you will have a Director role reporting to the VP of Sales, and you will be fully responsible for our direct sales business in the Chile market, and will become a key part of Odilo´s Education Vertical responsible for redefining Education institutions with the Unlimited Learning Category that Odilo is pioneering,

You will own our commercial efforts by leading our go-to-market, new sales, and account management teams while strongly contributing to our marketing and product strategy for the Chile Market in the Education Vertical.

To succeed in this role you will need to have strong leadership skills, a strong understanding of both managing complex deals with large private and public entities; and transactional deals with small organizations, multi-stakeholder management, communications, and leadership skills, and adapt easily to new scenarios as well as having a results-driven mentality.

We are working on achieving a critical mission: Creating equality in education by making the highest quality digital content seamless, accessible, and affordable to all.

Help everyone reach their full potential by providing personalized and intelligent unlimited learning experiences during their whole life.

What you will do at ODILO:
• Hire, coach, and professionally develop our Sales team in the Education Vertical (KAM, Account Managers) in Chile
• Develop a very ambitious plan to quickly amplify our sales coverage (double size in one year) and hire the best local talent in Chile and establish the commercial launch activities.
• Support your sales team in closing business in the education, smart cities, cultural spaces, and education and digital transformation organizations.
• Work towards surpassing our revenue plans.
• Analyze regional market dynamics and geo-political risks in an effort to maximize existing successes and create new sales growth opportunities.
• Directly contribute to the most relevant deals (+100K $) while creating and maintaining excellent relationships with our best customers and partners.
• As a Country Manager in the Education Vertical, you will become the biggest advocate of your market, working closely with Sales Operations, Sales Strategy, and Sales Enablement teams to define the customer segmentation and overall strategy and progress of your market and with the Marketing teams to define and execute the Marketing plan (lead generation, conferences, partnerships, etc)

The ideal candidate will bring:
• At least +12 years of total sales experience
• At least 1 year of experience selling large-volume deals directly
• Experience training and leading teams with different profiles (hunters and farmers)
• Experience selling software (SaaS) or learning programs or technology or complex products with a strong technology component (Saas, Integrators of Technology, LMS systems, ERP, CRMs, Customized Technology development, etc)
• Experience selling deals in the education business and comfortable working on a regular basis with C_level individuals for large education institutions
• Expertise in selling deals that require a multi-phase approach adapted to the needs of the customer
• At least +2 years of proven experience leading a team of 3-4 KAMs that sell at least 100K each.
• People you've managed still consider you a mentor and have gone on to do big things; many of them would work with you again in a heartbeat
• Experience creating a consultative selling approach with customer success at the forefront (i.e. The Challenger Customer), creating specific offers for each project
• You can demonstrate previous success adapting the sales playbook to manage a complex sales structure with different processes and sales cycles to accommodate different customer segmentations.
• Proven success executing go-to-market initiatives with a strong focus on outbound Sales and Account Based Sales.
• Ability to get involved in complex scenarios, with complex deals architecture, and work directly with prospects and customers when needed.
• Native Spanish Speaker and Intermediate level in English.
• Diligent in keeping sales pipeline information accurate and up to date in company CRM.
• Willing to build an open and transparent culture in the team.
• Review CRM information daily to gain new insights
• Coach the team and build along with them a better approach.
• Brings both hunter and farmer mentality to the team. Well-organized and prepared.
• Able to work towards clear deadlines with a strong work ethic.
• Truly passionate about education and lifelong learning. A clear vision of how to create a strong proactive learning culture will be a key factor for every organization's success.

What would make us happy:
• Previous experience leading a sales organization working in multiple countries.
• Previous experience working in the education or SaaS industries.
• Experience working with big organizations or with the most important education institutions.

Why ODILO?

Working at Odilo is about being part of a lifelong learning culture, where everyone has the possibility to take on challenges and participate in the growth of the company.

But we also offer:
• A unique and challenging job within an international, creative, and ambitious work environment
• A salary commensurate with a track record and experience
• Real opportunities for internal professional development

…And more!

Does this sound like a mission made for you? Then we need to talk!

job_description:
Job Category:
Business Value Services Group

Job Details:

Introduction

This is a unique opportunity to join a team, representing a blend of frontline commercial execution and long-term strategic thinking.

Salesforce Business Value Services (BVS) is closely aligned with the North America Sales organization, directly supporting sales pursuits within our top Healthcare & Life Sciences accounts.

Your primary focus will be to directly engage with customer executive teams, helping articulate the strategic and financial impact that our platform can deliver to their organizations.

Ultimately, you will develop C-level account strategies, value propositions and success metrics, investment justifications, deal structures and commercial proposals for our most strategic customers.

You will also act as a trusted advisor to your regional sales management, providing guidance on account and negotiation strategies, helping prioritize sales pursuits and identify new opportunities.

We are looking for highly passionate, driven and inquisitive individuals who can effectively communicate how our solutions can help our customers transform their businesses and support their strategic objectives.

Responsibilities

Customer Success:
Support Healthcare & Life Sciences accounts across all steps in the customer lifecycle, from strategic alignment, project justification, and commercial proposals to measuring the realized value of targeted business outcomes

Sales Partnership:
Work closely with internal sales teams and other functions to help define account strategies and prioritize sales initiatives, based on value creation potential and opportunity size

Orchestration:
Facilitate internal and external workshops to discover customers' _current _and _future _business capabilities with the goal of identifying, prioritizing and measuring key business value drivers (metrics)

Value Selling:
Build compelling business case presentations and ROI (Return on Investment) analyses aimed at accelerating, justifying, and/or expanding sales opportunities

Deal Negotiation:
Assist in the development and delivery of commercial proposals and deal structures, and share insights with senior sales management to help develop and execute negotiation strategies

Thought Leadership:
Provide thought leadership, training, and consultative partnering with internal sales and other teams throughout and beyond the sales cycle

Minimum Qualifications:
• 10+ years of professional experience, ideally in consultative and strategic customerfacing roles
• Resultsoriented, strategic thinker that enjoys helping customers "cross the chasm" from current state to future state
• Strong analytical and problem solving skills, including the ability to derive actionable insights from large amounts of information and clearly communicate complex ideas to customer senior executives, while handling questions and objections
• Experience with quantitative analysis and financial modeling
• Mix of business and technical acumen with ability to engage and add value in discussions involving both technology and business strategy
• Creative, highenergy, selfstarter comfortable leading and executing initiatives and handling conflicting demands creatively and quickly
• Thrive in working collaboratively and crossfunctionally, particularly with Sales, Solution Engineering, Pricing, Industry teams and other key partners
• MBA preferred

Preferred Qualifications:
• Familiarity with technology and/or enterprise software preferred
• Experience in the Healthcare & Life Sciences preferred (in particular Healthcare Payer's)
• Experience in account strategy support, and development and execution of value hypotheses, business cases, and commercial proposals preferred

About Salesforce:
• Founded in 1999, Salesforce is the global leader in Customer Relationship Management (CRM). Companies of every size and industry are using Salesforce to transform their businesses, across sales, service, marketing, commerce, and more by connecting with customers in a whole new way. We harness technologies that can revolutionize companies, careers, and, hopefully, our world.
_Salesforce is built on a set of four core values:
Trust, Customer Success, Innovation, and Equality. By making technology more accessible, we're helping create a future with greater opportunity and equality for all.

This has taken our company to great heights, including being named one of the FORTUNE "100 Best Companies to Work For" 2020 — 12 years in a row.- There are those who choose to work with the best and brightest.
And then, there are those who want to do more than just a job. They are the ones improving lives, not only their careers. Having an impact now instead of later. Doing something that's so much bigger than themselves, an industry, and their company.
• We believe everyone can be a Trailblazer. Join Salesforce and discover a future of new opportunities.
Posting Statement

Buscamos profesionales movidos por la excelencia y el logro, dinámicos, orientados al cliente, con capacidad de planificación y organización, a su vez que posea experiencia en liderazgo de equipos.
¿Cuál es el desafío que tenemos para ti?: Liderar, controlar y dirigir todo el portafolio de proyectos del área, gestionando al equipo a cargo y la detección de mejoras de procesos y herramientas que promuevan la innovación de la compañía, así como también, el alcance de los estándares de calidad definidos para nuestros clientes.

¿A quiénes buscamos?
-Profesionales con estudios en Ingeniería Informática y/o Ingeniería Civil.
-Con 3 ó 4 años liderando procesos y proyectos de tecnología desde el levantamiento de información y puesta en marcha.
-Conocimientos y experiencia en metodologías ágiles, SCRUM y/o PMI. Inglés Intermedio. Deseable: SAP.

-Requerimientos- Educación mínima: Técnico
10 años de experiencia
Palabras clave: lider, jefe, gerente, manager, director, chief, lead, jefatura, regente, system

job_description:
About Beat:

Beat is one of the most exciting and fastest-growing companies to ever come out of the ride-hailing space. Today we are part of the international FREE NOW Group owned by BMW and Daimler. But we are more than an app that takes you from A to B.

Our mission is to develop seamless mobility for a safe and sustainable urban life, by making transportation affordable, efficient and reliable for everyone.

We invest in the development of business model innovations, such as Beat Tesla and Beat Zero, and are the first to introduce revolutionary mobility solutions that fully own the customer experience through control of our own all-electric fleet.
Beat is currently available in Greece, Peru, Chile, Colombia, Mexico, Argentina.

Our headquarters is located in Greece (Athens), with our Tech Innovation and Engineering Hubs being split between Athens, Amsterdam and Mexico City.

We are proud to see Beat leading the FREE NOW Group in growth and we have ambitious plans for 2022.
But we need you to help us get closer to our vision:
a connected Latin America where the only question is "Where Next?"

About the role:

Beat is looking for an experienced professional to lead Chile's operation in our company as the General Manager.

You will have P&L accountability and will be responsible for ensuring the efficiency of business operations as well as setting strategic goals for the future.

As a General Manager of Chile you will:
• Manage and own entire P&L for Chile operation
• Ensure daytoday and endtoend administration of the service and business in Chile
• Create a high performing culture according to the company's values.
• Execute and define a winning strategy

About you:

What you need to have:
• Minimum 10 years relevant functional experience
• Proven experience of managing teams of over 50 employees (Minimum of 6years)
• Experience building and managing highperformance teams
• Wellversed in all matters business
• Track record of setting strategic goals and creating business plans to promote the attainment of the business key priorities

Key Competencies:
• Stakeholder management
• Strategic Vision
• Team Management
• Emotional Intelligence
• Decisionmaking

What's in it for you:
• Competitive fulltime salary
• Flexible working hours, top line tools
• Working in a hypergrowth environment, you will enjoy numerous learning and career development opportunities
• Training Benefit for online courses or attending conferences
• Commuter Benefit Program
• A great opportunity to grow and work with the most amazing people in the industry
• Being part of an environment that offers challenging goals, autonomy and mentoring, which creates incredible opportunities, both for you and the company

Please submit your resume in English
Diversity fuels the spirit and innovation at Beat.

Our commitment to inclusion without regard for race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, disability, age, religion, LGBTQ+ and experience drives us forward everyday.

DATOS DE CONTACTO:

Empresa:

Laboratorio Bagó

Actividad económica:

Fabricación de productos farmacéuticos, sustancias químicas medicinales y productos botánicos

DESCRIPCIÓN:

Hola amigos y amigas En Bagó Chile estamos en la búsqueda de Gerente (a) de TI Responsable de desarrollar y liderar la estrategia y los procesos de soporte operacional para los sistemas tecnológicos de la empresa, con el fin de garantizar su correcto funcionamiento y la continuidad operacional del negocio, de acuerdo a los estándares de servicios y presupuestos asignados.
Encargado (a) de incorporar y desarrollar procesos de Transformación Digital e Inteligencia Artificial, maximizando la posición de la compañía.

Requisitos:

Formación Base:
Ingeniero(a) Civil en Informática o Ingeniero(a) Civil Industrial

Conocimientos Específicos:
Gestión de proyectos estratégicos y tecnológicos, Magíster o Diplomado en Transformación Digital

Experiência Laboral Específica:
7 años en cargos similares. Experiência en implementación de proyectos transversales (SAP u otros).
• Metropolitana, Santiago
• 20/01/2023 2.100.00 9.999.

999- Jornada Completa
REQUISITOS SOLICITADOS:

Nível educacional:

Experiência:

7 años
CARACTERÍSTICAS:

Tipo de contrato:

Contrato indefinido
Nível de Cargo ofrecido:

Directivos o gerentes
Origen de la Oferta:

WEB
Oferta de tipo práctica profesional:
No

Apto para los siguientes grupos de empleo:

Personas en situación de discapacidad
Personas con pensión de invalidez
• Indígenas
Migrantes
Adultos mayores
Jóvenes

Mujeres
:
• Realizar tareas de pie
No se necesita que el trabajador permanezca de pie toda la jornada
• Realizar tareas sentado
Se necesita que el trabajador pueda permanecer sentado entre un 20% y un 70% de la jornada laboral, aunque puede realizar cambios posturales con cierta frecuencia (como una secretaria)
• Desplazarse para realizar las tareas
Se necesita que el trabajador pueda desplazarse constantemente caminando con o sin ayuda técnica (bastón, prótesis), durante la jornada laboral, en terreno irregular, en trayectos largos y/o con carga, dentro y fuera del edificio en que se encuentra el puesto de trabajo (como un cartero)
• Realizar actividades en diferentes níveles (pisos)
Se necesita que el trabajador pueda trasladarse constantemente de un piso a otro. Si bien lo puede realizar con ayuda de pasamanos y/o bastones, exige hacerlo con agilidad y rapidez (como un auxiliar de aseo que limpia diferentes níveles de un edificio sin ascensor)
• Alcanzar y coger objetos en diferentes alturas
Se necesita que el trabajador logre alcanzar y coger objetos hasta el nível de su hombro, sentado o de pie
• Uso herramientas/ objetos pequeños
Se necesita que el trabajador logre realizar actividades con herramientas/objetos muy pequeños, como un relojero usa las pinzas con alta precisió
• Tareas que demandan visión del trabajador para la ejecución
Se permiten trabajadores con visión parcial, pero que puedan realizar actividades con el uso de visión a corta y/o larga distancia (como para dibujar, utilizar instrumentos de precisión, etc)
• Capacidad auditiva
Se permiten trabajadores con buena percepción y discriminación de sonidos en cualquier ambiente sonoro, como la necesaria para seguir una conversación en medio de ambiente ruidoso
• Comunicarse en el trabajo
Se necesita trabajador que se comunique en forma verbal, de manera fluida (como un operador telefónico)
• Leer y escribir para el desarrollo de tareas
Se necesita Lecto-escritura de alto nível, comprende instrucciones o formularios y entrega información por medio escrito, incluyendo leer y escribir desde el computador para informarse y elaborar documentos, correos electrónicos u otros afines
• Flexibilidad
Se necesitan trabajadores que no presenten problemas de flexibilidad
• Trabajo colaborativo
Se requiere de un trabajador que acostumbre a trabajar en equipos para conseguir resultados y le sea fácil relacionarse con otros integrantes en su lugar de trabajo
• Manejo de tensiones y conflictos
Se requieren trabajadores que estén preparados para asumir alta responsabilidad, tener trabajadorees a su cargo, tomar decisiones frecuentes en el manejo de situaciones complejas y resolver problemas
• Resolución de problemas
Se requieren trabajadores que puedan valorar situaciones imprevistas (conocidas y desconocidas) y adoptar acciones que respondan asertivamente a las exigencias del cargo que desempeñe
• Desarrollo de tareas estresantes
Se requieren trabajadores que puedan manejar constantemente (día a día) situaciones estresantes asociadas al desempeño de sus funciones (como un ejecutivo telefónico de cobranzas)

Cancelar

job_description:
Who we are
Together, we're on a mission to make good health more affordable and accessible, to help millions around the world enjoy healthier lives. It's a mission that bonds our people across nearly 60 countries and a rich, diverse variety of nationalities and backgrounds. Working here means working with the world's leading manufacturer of generic medicines, and the proud producer of many of the products on the World Health Organization's Essential Medicines List. Today, at least 200 million people around the world take one of our medicines every single day. An amazing number, but we're always looking for new ways to continue making a difference, and new people to make a difference with.

The opportunity

Provides country HR oversight on all local HR aspects. Oversee Long Range HR strategy implementation at Country level ensuring that in line with overall country/regional strategy.

Manages overall HR employment requirements (legal & compliance) responsibility at a country level, ensuring consistency of approach within country/region.

Partners with HRBPs at the regional/BU level, CoE's and HROS to implement the HR strategy of the country. Works with HRBPs to understand global business context and to solve specific local requirements and ensure country alignment.

Support leaders to manage employee relations within a specific country, to ensure that business risk is minimized and Teva's reputation is maintained.

Serve as a specific country advocate to regional and Global HR; Similarly, acts as HR advocate at the country level.

Responsible for alignment of Teva Global HR policies and procedures within a specific country; Implementation of HR processes in line with HR standards and local regulations.

How you'll spend your day

Manages HR related projects across Business Units.

Position Teva as Employer of Choice in the labor market.

Value proposition for Teva staff – ensure local consistency across business unit and/or functions.

Manage country resource plans to ensure high caliber employees are hired in collaboration with COE.

Ensure consistency in all people processes, Internal Teva branding and employee communication.

Oversee Talent/Performance Management, Career & Succession planning processes within the Country.

Standardizing and streamlining documentation and process workflows with-in country in alignment with regulations.

Leads team of qualified HR Managers

Partner with people managers to drive people strategy in the Country.

Support delivery of the training programs on country level.

Accountable for Country HR Budget and AOP. Ensure efficient use of HR resources.

Your experience and qualifications

Education: University degree in applicable discipline; Graduate / Advanced Degree Preferred

Minimum 10 years applicable experience(HR Manager roles)

Experience in global (matrix) organization

Experience leading a country (large scale) initiative, change management or other significant project.

Mastery of specific professional HR disciplines such as: talent acquisition, leadership and employee development, Total rewards, union relationship experience

People leadership experience

Business acumen- pharma not necessary

Strong communication and collaboration/influencing skills

Significant working knowledge of country employment legislation

Strong HR vision and ability to apply in a pragmatic way

Strategic thinking and execution focus

job_description:
Empresa líder de consumo masivo se
encuentra en busqueda de un Subgerente de Mercadeo.

La misión de esta posición
consistirá en liderar, dirigir y controlar la gestión del área de Mercadeo.
Desarrollo e implementación de la estrategia de marca para los diferentes
canales bajo una visión integrada con el área comercial, empoderando a los
colaboradores a su cargo en cada uno de sus roles asegurando las ventas, rentabilidad,
participación de mercado y resultados de la compañía en línea con su planeación
estratégica.

Funciones:

1. Dirigir y controlar el
diseño e implementación de la estrategia de las marcas, presupuestando la
inversión en conjunto con su segunda línea de jefaturas, así como realizar
seguimiento y análisis de las campañas de lanzamiento de productos.

2. Dirigir y controlar el
cumplimiento de los objetivos de rentabilidad de cada marca, analizando
márgenes, costos de productos y velando por el correcto cumplimiento de las
estrategias de precios.

3. Preparación del Presupuesto
de mercado.

4. Colaboración con el Equipo
Corporativo de Chile.

5. Analizar oportunidades de
mercado que se puedan transformar en nuevos negocios para los canales y sus
marcas.

6. Desarrollo de estrategias y
campañas de Marketing para los diferentes canales de ventas.

7. Supervisión de las coordinaciones
con la Agencia de BTL y promotoras en todo lo que se refiere a la ejecución de
la Marca al PDV, cumpliendo con los parámetros definidos por los Clientes y la
Sub Gerencia de Marketing.

8. Informes y Presentaciones en el
Comité de Gerencia.

9. Relaciones Públicas.

10. Desarrollo del Talento a su
cargo.

Requisitos:

Ingeniero Industrial, Administrador de Empresas, Marketing o carrera afín con 07 años de experiencia liderando procesos asociados a Mercadeo y experiencia anterior indispensable en Ventas en empresas de Consumo Masivo / Retail. Conocimiento en Trade Marketing / Retail Marketing. Inglés nivel intermedio.

job_description:
ENGIE, a global company, leader in power generation and with the purpose of accelerating the transition to a carbon neutral economy is looking for aPhotovoltaic Technical Project Manager.
If you are a talent that can join us in our commitment to lead the energy transformation of Chile, apply here

Mission:

Control and coordinate the standardization of design, planning and construction of the project or projects assigned with the different areas, in order to ensure the implementation of the action guidelines, facilitating the management of activities, managing the internal resources defined for the engineering area, contributing to the generation of savings both in economic resources and work time, minimizing deviations, due to lack of information or knowledge of the processes, promoting a participatory work culture and continuous improvement in the generation of actions, according to quality standards, KPI's, management, policies, procedures and defined budgets.

Functions:

Generate the WBS of the project, generating also the mobilization plan for acquiring/outsourcing the right resources on due time according to the general project plan, aiming to achieve project ́s objectives.

Ensure the delivery of all technical packages of the project, coordinating all ENGIE relevant internal stakeholders (our teams, other ENGIE entities) as well as external stakeholders.

Coordinate and follow up the tendering process for all the technical related matters, taking also the leadership of the C&P workshops to define the right strategy for the project.
Control technical contractors from engineering studies to execution works.
Coordinate and follow up the execution of all the engineering studies related to corresponding stream.
Coordinate with the other TPMs all the necessary actions to efficiently integrate the different streams.

Analyze and identify the critical interfaces between streams, proposing new activities, way of construction or changes in design to mitigate the risks.

In conjunction with PMO, elaborate and then monitor the project ́s base line (schedule, budget and scope) as well as the quality in order to take the necessary action to keep the project on schedule and under the budget , mapping the risk and controlling the action plans of the stream.
Generate the project technical reports of the corresponding defined stream as defined in the PMP.
Develop and delivery timely the Project Management Plan with all its elements, in accordance with ENGIE ́s procedures.
Participate of the corresponding peer reviews and other IND1 and particular GBU requirements.

What you bring:

Academic Background:
Mechanical, Electrical or Civil Engineering

Technical Competences:
You have a proven track record in managing projects
Project management activities in the fields of hydrogen or natural gas, from technical studies to execution works.
English spoken and written advanced level

Between 8 and 10 years in the project areas, and more than 5 years in management of related projects (wind, PV, Tx, thermal, industries, etc.) with mechanical, electrical, instrumentation and control, civil and related disciplines.
We are an inclusive company

All our job opportunities are under the framework of Law 21.015, which encourages the inclusion of people with disabilities in the labor market.
Join our team and together let's lead Chile's energy transition #ActWithENGIE

Division:
Thermal SOUTHAM - EECL - Chile #J-18808-Ljbffr

¿Eres amante de la venta, tecnología y creación de equipos de alto rendimiento?

¡Esta oferta laboral es para ti!

Importante compañía del rubro de Telecomunicaciones, se encuentra en búsqueda de un Subgerente Comercial con importantes conocimientos en la industria TI.

Requisitos:

- Ingeniería Comercial o Civil Industrial

100% remote job
General Manager | Ascendis Pharma | Chile

Are you passionate about bringing new pharmaceutical products to market? Do you have extensive experience within establishing, growing and managing affiliates, and are you driven to bring products to patients? If so, now is your chance to join Ascendis Pharma as our new General Manager, Italy & Greece.
Ascendis Pharma is a fast-growing biopharmaceutical company with locations in Denmark, Germany, and the United States.

We are applying our TransCon technology to build a leading, fully integrated biopharmaceutical company with an independent pipeline of long-acting prodrug therapies that address unmet patient needs.

We have successfully launched our first innovative product in the US and are on the brink of expansion into Europe.

You have the opportunity to establish and build our Ascendis Pharma affiliate within Italy & Greece, drive successful launches of our endocrinology pipeline and contribute significantly to our Commercial expansion.

As our new General Manager, Italy & Greece, you will join a rapidly expanding global commercial organization responsible for driving success in the rare disease endocrinology field.
The global commercial team is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, with commercial offices currently in the US and Germany. We are in process of expanding throughout Europe. You will report directly to, VP, Head of Europe 2.
You will be responsible for:

Leadership and P&L accountability for building an organization from scratch, leading our Ascendis Pharma affiliate, and delivering the financial results.

Develop a comprehensive business case (order of launch, manpower and budget requirements etc) of our products within Italy & Greece.

Develop the launch plan with European Senior Launch Director, drive and ensure market access, drive customer engagement, build external awareness and advocacy, and execute the launch of our endocrinology products.

Engage with external stakeholders and media to launch both Ascendis as an emerging leader in Endocrinology Rare Diseases and our products as a best-in-class treatment across Italy & Greece.
Identify and recruit an experienced, hands-on, high-quality team for key positions in accordance with the agreed launch plan.

Develop and execute a pre-launch awareness strategy and deliver a commercially savvy Italy & Greece launch plan engaging relevant stakeholders.

Work closely with the European and Global resources to integrate the Italy & Greece commercial organization with the Ascendis global commercial organization.

Establish and strengthen the reputation of Ascendis and our technology platform with KOLs, regulators, payors, patient organizations and other relevant stakeholders.
Your key internal stakeholders will be:
Executive Management
Global Commercial Management
Strategic Support Functions

Your Profile You hold a relevant academic degree – preferably a master's degree in Business Administration, Health Policy, or Health Economics – and possess 10-15 years of experience within Market Access, Pricing/reimbursement, Marketing, or Sales.

Furthermore, you bring:
Deep understanding of what it takes to be successful in rare disease within Italy & Greece.
Experience working across multiple geographies and market access environments.

Solid track record of working with customers, patient organizations and stakeholders at all levels internally and externally, to influence, define and implement market access strategies and plans.
Demonstrated ability to distill down and synthesize complex information from various resources into insights and actions.
Experience successfully leading cross functional matrix teams and working with country teams.
Solid track record of prior country management and P&L responsibility.
Also, you are proficient in English at a professional level, both written and spoken. Language skills supporting other countries within Europe is a plus. As a person, you are a strong team player, proactive in nature and have a can-do, self-starter attitude.

As we are taking new steps towards developing best-in-class therapeutics for patients with rare diseases we are looking for people who possess an entrepreneurial mindset who can handle ambiguity, create clarity and desires to be part of an organization where everything isn't set in stone.
We rely on you to help us shape the cement.

The person we are looking for thrives in a dynamic environment, short lines of communication and an open and informal working atmosphere.

Travel:
as required

Place of work:
Ascendis Pharma will be establishing an office in Italy.

For more details about the position or the company, please contact Camilla Harder Hartvig, EVP, Global Chief Commercial Officer on M Ver el número de teléfono en or Ver el correo electrónico en or visit out website All applications must be submitted in English and are treated confidentially.
Applications will be evaluated when received, so please apply as soon as possible.

job_description:
OMT Importante Empresa de Tecnología en Telecomunicaciones en expansión que presta Servicio a rubros de Minería, Industrial y Gubernamental con más de 17 años de trayectoria, se encuentra en búsqueda de Subgerente de Ingeniería, con al menos 3 años de experiencia Liderando el área y Administrando varios proyectos de Minería a la vez, estudios superiores de Ingeniería Civil o Informática, trabajo presencial en Providencia con disponibilidad para viajes regulares a Faenas (Norte de Chile), manejo del idioma Inglés, y reportando al Gerente de Ingeniería.

Funciones Principales:

- Liderar el departamento de ingeniería en cuanto a Preventa e Ingeniería de desarrollo de proyectos.
- Velar por que el departamento de ingeniería a cargo de que ingenieros y técnicos entreguen los resultados y servicios en diseño, modalidad y tiempos comprometidos
- Ofrecer servicios profesionales de tecnología en telecomunicaciones
- Medir por medio de KPIs el desempeño del área.
- Velar por el plan de capacitación de su área
- Liderar el Diseño y desarrollo de distintas soluciones de negocio y/o nuevos productos.
- Liderar la elaboración del diseño conceptual y básico para la pre venta.
- Dirigir y elaborar documentación de ingeniería.
- Supervisar directamente a los Ingenieros de Preventas y personal de ingeniería.
- Se relaciona con el área comercial para evaluar y realizar propuestas económicas, con la Subgerencia de Proyectos para estudiar la factibilidad de la solución creada, y con la Subgerencia de continuidad operacional para dar soporte a los distintos contratos a nivel de ingeniería especializada.
- Recopilar información respecto a la solicitud del cliente.
- Diseñar una solución técnica y operacional en base a lo que requiere el cliente, incluyendo aspectos económicos.
- Evaluar en costos y tiempo todos los insumos que se requieren para la implementación del diseño, incluido la infraestructura, equipos, mano de obra, etc.
- Supervisar la realización de las propuestas técnicas, el diseño de ingeniería de proyectos, el diseño de productos internos, desarrollando los alcances del proyecto y así dar respuesta a los requerimientos de los clientes.
- Realizar junto con el área comercial la propuesta económica.
- Velar por el cumplimiento de Política de Calidad, Medioambiente, Seguridad, Salud Ocupacional.

Conocimientos y requisitos necesarios:

- Al menos 3 años de experiencia como Subgerente de Ingeniería liderando equipo de Ingenieros Pre Ventas en Minería.
- Experiencia ofreciendo servicios profesionales y liderando el desarrollo de varios proyectos de Minería en paralelo.
- Experiencia en trabajo de terreno en Faenas Mineras y Deseable en Telecomunicaciones
- Experiencia en mediciones de KPIs
- Estudios Profesionales en Ingeniería Civil, eléctrico, electrónico, informática o similar.
- Disponibilidad para viajes a Faenas Mineras y Salud compatible con el trabajo en altura geográfica
- Conocimientos en Metodologías de proyectos
- Conocimientos en Sistemas Comunicacionales Inalámbrico
- Manejo de Idioma inglés intermedio avanzado
- Residencia Santiago

job_description: cumplir y ejecutar en tiempo forma y presupuesto el plan de iniciativas en proceso trabajar en linea directa con gerencia y lideres de otras areas ademas

Uber is redefining the future of grocery & retail! A company that started by transporting people from place to place, now transports nearly anything a customer could want or need, on-demand. The Grocery Engineering Team is responsible for ensuring that as we move to transport more than just people & restaurant food, our platform evolves to provide an outstanding experience for customers, earners and brands. Today this team is focused on grocery, but will continue to flex into a longer tail of categories in the future.

What You'll Do
• You will manage a team of software engineers to deliver world-class safety solutions
• Partner with customer teams, help see opportunities, gather requirements, and lead a technology roadmap and vision for the team
• Recruit, encourage, and grow a top notch engineering team
• Develop systems and software to bring world class safety to global Uber

What You'll Need
• Strong experience developing software as an engineer
• Strong experience leading engineering teams
• Significant experience building and operating critical high-scale systems
• Phenomenal management and team development skills: ability to set roadmap and goals for a team and every one of its members, delegate intelligently, mentor engineers, deliver frequent and transparent feedback, help team members grow in their careers, and deliver results
• Expertise and curiosity about growing teams: interviewing junior and senior engineers, collaborating with a recruiting team, efficiently onboarding new team members
• Good software engineering methodology: meaningful and deeply-rooted opinions about testing and code quality, ability to make sound quality/speed trade-offs
• Outstanding technical skills in backend or mobile engineering: Uber managers can lead from the front when the situation calls for it
• Proficient in English

About the Team

Our team uses real-time telematics and motion sensing technologies along with multi-faceted machine learning algorithms and user-facing mobile products to reduce and prevent unsafe driving and behavior on the Uber platform. The team is building low-latency data streaming infrastructure that ingests terabytes of data daily before applying statistical modeling and signal processing algorithm, NLP auditing as well as facial biometrics recognition solutions. Our work touches all parts of the Uber experience from dispatch to on-trip and post-trip, as well as Uber's entire ecosystem ranging from our rides business to other newer Uber marketplaces, and ventures.

Uber takes your privacy seriously. Please visit our Candidate Privacy Notice for information regarding how we collect and use your data when you apply for employment with Uber, and your rights regarding your data.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.

Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber's cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. Please speak with your recruiter to better understand in-office expectations for this role.
• Accommodations may be available based on religious and/or medical conditions, or as required by applicable law. To request an accommodation, please reach out to accommodations@uber.com.

job_description:
Uno de nuestros clientes, una importante empresa de retail con presencia en LATAM, se encuentra en búsqueda de un Gerente de Arquitectura quien desempeñará un papel esencial en la definición y supervisión de la arquitectura tecnológica de la empresa. Será responsable de liderar la estrategia de arquitectura de TI, garantizando que las soluciones tecnológicas e infraestructuras sean coherentes, escalables, seguras y alineadas con los objetivos de negocio.

Requirements

Main Responsibilities:
• Definir y comunicar la estrategia de arquitectura de TI, asegurando su alineación con la estrategia empresarial.
• Evaluar y seleccionar las tecnologías y plataformas adecuadas para respaldar la infraestructura y las aplicaciones de TI.
• Colaborar con los equipos de desarrollo y otros departamentos para diseñar soluciones tecnológicas coherentes y escalables.
• Supervisar la creación de planos y diagramas arquitectónicos para garantizar la comprensión y la implementación eficiente de la arquitectura.
• Establecer y hacer cumplir estándares de seguridad de TI para proteger la infraestructura y los datos de la empresa.
• Asegurar el cumplimiento de las regulaciones y políticas de seguridad de datos.
• Gestionar los recursos de infraestructura de TI de manera eficiente, optimizando costos y recursos.
• Identificar oportunidades de consolidación y virtualización para mejorar la eficiencia operativa.
• Supervisar y desarrollar un equipo de arquitectos de TI.
• Colaborar con otros líderes de TI para asegurar una alineación eficaz de los proyectos y las iniciativas de arquitectura.

Professional Skills
• Ingeniería Civil, informática, comercial o carreras afines
• Tener al menos 10 años de experiencia laboral.
• Conocimiento profundo de tecnologías y prácticas de arquitectura empresarial.
• Familiaridad con metodologías de desarrollo ágil y gestión de proyectos.
• Habilidades de liderazgo, comunicación efectiva y toma de decisiones estratégicas.

Soft Skills:
• Liderazgo
• Visión Estratégica
• Habilidades de Comunicación
• Comprensión del Mercado
• Enfoque al Cliente
• Autonomía

Reporting Manager Title

:

51,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.

We’re not just engineers. We’re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers, and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals, and resources get one step closer to solving our planet’s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?

Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com

Purpose

Directs, establishes, maintains, and plans the overall policies and goals for a one or more sectors. Responsible for accounts with major customers. Develops and maintains client relationships. Identifies potential business partners and negotiates agreements. Works with other departments to ensure alignment of company goals, as set by senior management. Ensures business growth strategies are met. Creates functional strategies and specific objectives for the sector and develops budgets/policies/procedures to support the functional infrastructure. Deep knowledge of the managed sector is required.

Responsibilities
• Operational leaders implementing strategies within a single functional area or department within a function, defined location or project.
• May be expected to drive and execute work beyond scope of individual function through cross-functional or special project teams.
• May manage work directly or through others.
• Creates a purpose or vision for their own area/department that aligns with organizational goals.
• Develops and oversees objectives, policies and procedures for current and following year. is required.
• Makes independent decisions and recommendations in the course of managing multiple functional disciplines, one larger functional discipline, or a significant size project.
• Decisions are for long-range planning, coordination, and technical decisions that can be either specific and/or far-reaching.
• Develops and oversees the implementation of strategic programs and policies for their groups, which may impact the region, location, or large project.
• Ability to manage multiple complex projects through others; Works frequently with location and regional management on significant matters influencing the business results.
• ️ Mandatory requirements:

University Degree, or equivalent, in related field or applicable discipline, or equivalent relevant experience.

20+ years relevant experience related to the position, having been Manager or Director in said functions
• Strategic knowledge of energy transition material
• Experience in global coordination with different stakeholders in the Americas.
• Solid verbal and written communication skills in English and Spanish,

Assets
• Experience in business data mining.

Base or Place of Work: Santiago, Chile (Hybrid)

What we offer you

Providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.

Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.

If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it's time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.

• This vacancy is open to international transfer, not an expatriation opportunity. If you have doubts about this, contact the Talent Acquisition Advisor responsible for this position.

• You must upload your CV in English.

job_description:
En HRGROWIN consultora especializada en selección y atracción de talentos, nos encontramos liderando la búsqueda de un Subgerente de Sistemas, para empresa líder en el sector de comercialización y distribución industrial, ubicada en sector ENEA.

Si eres Ingeniero Civil en informática o cuentas con formación universitaria similar y tienes experiência en liderar áreas de desarrollo de sistemas, esta oportunidad es para ti.

¿Cuáles serán tus principales responsabilidades?
• Serás responsable de la continuidad operativa de los sistemas de la compañía, acompañando al Gerente de tecnología, en lo táctico y lo operacional, apalancando el plan estratégico de la compañía, para entregar valor en las iniciativas que debe impulsar o innovar.
• Liderar la gestión de proyectos de sistemas y desarrollarlos, entregando soporte, efectuando mejoras y correcciones cuando corresponda.
• Gestionar las capacidades del equipo humano de sistemas, para lograr el óptimo desempeño en actividades designadas al área, coordinando además a los distintos proveedores externos o internos para el cumplimiento de los objetivos planteados.
• Gestionar indicadores del área, según sistemas de ticket para optimizar la respuesta que se entrega a los usuarios.
• Desarrollar RFP (Request for Proposal) para licitación de servicios externos

REQUISITOS Estudios mínimos:

Universitaria Carreras:
Ingeniería Civil en Computación e Informática, Ingeniería Computación Informática y Comunicaciones, Ingeniería de Sistemas de Información Empresarial y Control de Gestión, Ingeniería en Computación e Informática, Ingeniería en Gestión e Informática, Ingeniería en Información y Control de Gestión, Ingeniería en Informática /

Sistemas Requisitos Minimos:
• Profesional Universitario, Civil Informática o similar.
• Experiência laboral de al menos 5 años en roles similares.
• Experiência con Gestión de proveedores y contratos.
• Deseable experiência previa en proyectos y/o procesos que involucran manejo del cambio dentro de la organización.
• Conocimiento y experiência en liderar áreas/funciones de IT, y en particular el área de desarrollo de sistemas.
• Conocimiento de módulos y funcionalidades de SAP.
• Conocimiento de análisis y diseño de procesos, procedimientos y sistemas de negocio.
• Conocimiento de metodologías de administración de proyectos.
• Será un plus contar con conocimientos de ITIL (IT Information Library).
• Inglés será un plus.

CONTRATO Tipo de contrato:

Jornada Completa Duracion:

job_description:
Como Subgerente de Operaciones TI, tendrás la emocionante oportunidad de liderar la transformación tecnológica de nuestra organización al mismo tiempo que aseguras la continuidad operacional de nuestros servicios de tecnología, información y comunicaciones (TIC).

Tu visión estratégica y experiência en liderar equipos técnicos serán fundamentales para dirigir la migración a una infraestructura en la nube, fortalecer la operación de la plataforma SAP y desarrollar estrategias de seguridad informática sólidas.

Responsabilidades Clave:

Migración a la Nube:

Liderarás el apasionante proceso de transformación al migrar nuestras operaciones actuales a un modelo de infraestructura en la nube.
Tu experiência en este ámbito será fundamental para garantizar una transición fluida y exitosa.

Estrategia y Comunicación Empresarial:
Definirás y ejecutarás estrategias de comunicación efectivas que resalten la propuesta de valor tecnológica de la empresa. Impulsarás la continuidad del negocio al ofrecer servicios de datos, voz, internet y WiFi a través de modelos redundantes.

Innovación en la Nube:

Diseñarás y desarrollarás estrategias basadas en la tecnología en la nube, proporcionando soluciones innovadoras de infraestructura, servicios y plataformas de desarrollo para impulsar la eficiencia y la agilidad empresarial.

Excelencia en SAP:
Supervisarás el óptimo funcionamiento de la plataforma SAP, asegurando tanto la operación del sistema como la infraestructura subyacente. Garantizarás la conformidad con las licencias contratadas para cada producto.

Liderazgo de Equipos:

Utilizarás tu experiência para liderar y guiar a equipos técnicos, proporcionando orientación, capacitación y dirección para lograr los objetivos y el crecimiento profesional de los miembros del equipo.

Seguridad Informática TI:

Evaluarás y establecerás estrategias sólidas de seguridad informática para proteger los activos tecnológicos y los datos de la empresa, garantizando la confidencialidad, integridad y disponibilidad.

Requisitos:

Requisitos:

5 años de experiência demostrada como Jefe de Operaciones TI o Subgerente de Operaciones TI, con un historial exitoso en liderar proyectos tecnológicos complejos.
Experiência en la administración y operación de plataformas SAP, demostrando un profundo conocimiento de su funcionamiento.
Experiência directa en migraciones exitosas desde entornos on premise a plataformas en la nube.
Habilidad para liderar y formar equipos técnicos, inspirando un alto rendimiento y un compromiso continuo.
Comunicador excepcional con la capacidad de definir y ejecutar estrategias de comunicación efectivas.
Conocimiento profundo de estrategias y mejores prácticas de seguridad informática en el entorno empresarial.
Titulación en Tecnología de la Información, Ingeniería en Computación o campos relacionados (postgrado es una ventaja).

Ofrecemos:

Un rol clave en la evolución tecnológica y la continuidad operacional de una organización líder en su industria.
Oportunidades para liderar proyectos de transformación tecnológica y desarrollar soluciones innovadoras.
Un entorno de trabajo colaborativo y estimulante que fomenta el crecimiento y el desarrollo profesional.

Si estás listo para liderar una era de innovación tecnológica y asegurar la continuidad operacional en un entorno en constante cambio, te invitamos a unirte a nuestro equipo como Subgerente de Operaciones TI y hacer una diferencia significativa en el futuro de nuestra organización.

job_description:
We are hiring a persistent Jefe de Proyecto TI to join our awesome team at AMARIS CONSULTING SPA in Santiago.

Growing your career as a Full Time Jefe de Proyecto TI is a promising opportunity to develop vital skills.
If you are strong in emotional intelligence, time management and have the right vision for the job, then apply for the position of Jefe de Proyecto TI at AMARIS CONSULTING SPA today
Buscamos consultores dinámicos para hacer crecer nuestro equipo de Sistemas de Información y Digital en Chile. Tu experiencia, conocimiento y compromiso nos ayudarán a afrontar los retos de nuestros clientes.
Estarás apoyando diferentes proyectos a través de tu experiencia como Jefe de Proyecto.

Sus principales responsabilidades:
Definir, planificar y dirigir la ejecución de los proyectos de integración asignados para nuestros clientes de TI partes interesadas comerciales y afiliadas al tiempo que se equilibran las exigencias contrapuestas de alcance, tiempo, coste, calidad, recursos y riesgo para obtener un producto de alta calidad
Garantizar que los objetivos/requisitos del proyecto sean claros y estén acordados por todas las partes interesadas
Facilitar las actividades de gestión de proyectos en toda la metodología de gestión de proyectos: garantizar la finalización satisfactoria y oportuna de los productos, hacer un seguimiento del progreso con respecto al calendario de referencia, gestionar las prioridades del proyecto y garantizar el cumplimiento del alcance acordado
Llevar a cabo de forma proactiva la planificación, la identificación, el análisis y el seguimiento de la gestión de riesgos y problemas en los proyectos formular estrategias de mitigación de riesgos y problemas, y recomendar y aplicar soluciones

Requisitos:
Al menos 4 años de experiencia como Jefe de Proyecto proyectos de implementación
Conocimiento de las metodologías Waterfall y Ágil
Muy buenos conocimientos de Jira o Kanban
Experiencia en la gestión de riesgos y partes interesadas
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación en español e inglés
Actitud práctica. Sentido de la urgencia y capacidad de priorización

job_description:
Misión:

Descripción:
Nuestros clientes y colaboradores cambiaron y obviamente queremos seguir ofreciéndoles lo mejor. Súmate a esta gran misión y tendrás la oportunidad de explotar todo tu potencial y ser protagonista de grandes transformaciones.

El team de Gerencia Omnichannel Supply Chain está buscando a su próximo Cargo Subgerente/a QA para marcar la diferencia en nuestro equipo. Si te consideras disruptivo y valiente, ¡Prepárate! porque esto se pone bueno.

Tus desafíos serán:

• Definir el modelo de auditoria e inventario, junto con definición y control de planes de brecha anuales.

• Incorporar Innovación y Tecnología para hacer más eficiente el Control de Proceso y Control de Inventario, asegurando el cumplimiento de los planes de auditoria e inventario.

• Generar ambiente de control en los procesos utilizando y mejorando herramientas mediante capacitación continua, gestión con Operaciones y Stakeholders relevantes y controles a la calidad de los procesos.

• Establecer metodología de trabajo para cierre financiero potenciando automatización en extracción, registro y análisis de información.

• Gestionar la disponibilidad, integridad, uso, diseño y seguridad de los datos, para todos los procesos relacionados al rol de QA.

• Definir cartera de proyectos para impulsar nuevas formas trabajo y gestión, incorporando mejora continua a los procesos existentes y generando Innovación para implementación de nuevos procesos.

job_description:
Importante empresa dedicada al consumo masivo se encuentra en la búsqueda de un Gerente de servicios TI quien será el encargado(a) de fortalecer nuestro equipo de TI en LATAM. Tendrá estrecha colaboración con líderes funcionales sénior y partes interesadas del negocio. Deberá entregar soluciones analíticas relevantes con un enfoque claro en el resultado comercial y el ROI tangible.

Responsabilidades:
• Comprometerse con las partes interesadas claves del negocio para comprender el mercado y asesorar en base a los productos ADI (Analytics, Data and Integration) existentes.
• Actuar como el principal embajador de los productos ADI para el mercado chileno
• Asegúrese de que el nivel de soporte adecuado esté en su lugar para las soluciones, en línea con su impacto en el negocio.
• Comprometerse con los líderes técnicos regionales y arquitectos de soluciones de ADI para mantener el conocimiento de cada hoja de ruta del producto
• Comprometerse con las comunidades locales, regionales y globales de ADI para garantizar que los miembros de la comunidad local que participen activamente en las comunidades relevantes
• Captar la demanda de funcionalidades del producto y asegurar que sean evaluadas y consideradas con la debida relevancia, actuando como embajador de estas mejoras hasta que sean incorporadas en la hoja de ruta del producto
• Negociar el despliegue de la hoja de ruta de productos ADI con las partes interesadas relevantes en sus países de poder, asegurando que la hoja de ruta se entregue a tiempo con calidad dentro del marco maestro de la hoja de ruta del producto
• Coordinar la gestión de crisis y la comunicación en caso de interrupciones importantes causadas por problemas en cualquier producto ADI
• Asegurar que se implementen acciones adecuadas de análisis y mitigación de causas raíz para incidentes importantes relacionados con la ADI.

Requisitos:
• Licenciado en informática, Ingeniería civil, Ingeniería comercial o carrera a fin.
• Desde 10 años en roles relacionados con datos y análisis
• Liderazgo de pensamiento impulsado por la transformación de procesos y toma de decisiones con Analytics, especialmente en los dominios de finanzas, comercial y suministro de productos.
• Trayectoria como asesor práctico de análisis de negocios de líderes empresariales senior y comités ejecutivos.
• Ideal experiencia en ventas o gestión de productos con responsabilidad de pérdidas y ganancias en la industria de bienes de consumo.
• Conocimientos en: Implementación y soporte de grandes sistemas ERP; Informes empresariales; Analytics Tools and technologies; Agile development y Design Thinking
• Experiencia en gestión de proyectos
• Conocimientos en Azure
• Fluidez en inglés y español hablado y escrito
• Metodologías de desarrollo de software
• Experiencia trabajando en un entorno global y con equipos virtuales

Si estás interesado postular por el portal

¡Mucho éxito!

job_description:
WHAT DOES A BRAND MANAGER DO?

As a Brand Manager, you are an extension of the Brand Team and you will be accountable for delivering impactful consumer facing activities and taking our great portfolio of brands to the next level in Chile. You will be responsible for planning and execution of such consumer programs outlined in the “Jobs to be Done” of the brands Integrated Activity Planning (IAP). You will be accountable for delivering brand performance targets and the increase of brand value share.

Responsibilities
• Lead all in-market brand Integrated Activity Plans (IAP) of consumer-facing activities collaborating with multiple stakeholders such as Customer Marketing, Advocacy, Commercial, and external partners/agencies to deliver with excellence.
• Partner with Consumer and Commercial Insights team to understand target local consumers and situation assessments for the brand to customize local activities and develop new strategies and tactics that provide the brand with a competitive advantage, specifically winning in the On-Premise and Innovation.
• Support the Brand Integrated Activity Plan (IAP) strategic planning process by providing brand performance analysis, analytical assessments of impact of activities, robust program plans, and strong assets to drive brand equity.
• Lead the development and execution of brand partnerships/sponsorships & experiential programming across multiple channels and agencies and working with local commercial and distributor teams to deliver in-market.
• Manage and optimize an A&P budget assigned to you and placing bold bets on activities that minimizes costs but optimizes return on investments working closely with Consumer Insights to ensure we M&E the performance of brand activities.

Skills and Experience
• University degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or Industrial Engineering.
• 8+ years of marketing experience in consumer goods and/or spirits (preferred)
• Demonstrated understanding of consumer marketing fundamentals; brand management experience; leading or supporting brand strategy development, as well as experience in promotions, digital, events, media, brief writing, etc.
• Proven experience in developing advertising campaigns and consumer programs built upon local consumer insights.
• Digitally savvy. Ability to see & understand digital content, channel, and Social Media dynamics. Early adopter of technology.
• Adaptable and resilient to changes. Comfortable working under pressure and deal with ambiguity.
• Great commercial acumen and the ability to translate great brand strategies into a tangible commercial advantage with a strong understanding of: Channel, price, promotional activity and through-the-line activation.
• Analyze available information (e.g. Nielsen data) including the comprehension of the competition and category for the purposes of preparing reports, presentations, providing insights, recommendations and solving problems to grow the brands.
• Experience managing P&Ls.
• Strong verbal, presentation & written skills. Confidence to influence at all levels in an organization.
• Fluent command of English and Spanish.

Our culture

We share the passion and entrepreneurial flair of our founder and are guided by our three culture pillars - Fearless, Family and Founders, they inspire our Primos to be the best they can be and drive us forward in all we do. But what does this mean?
• Being Fearless; means adopting an agile mindset, being comfortable trying new things and taking risks. We are empowered to question, challenge and innovate.
• Family; We treat each other, and our communities, like Family. Always.
• Founders; The spirit of entrepreneurship is at the heart of everything we do. We see the business as if it’s our own. We do the right thing for the business and we all take accountability for our work.

When you join Bacardi, you become part of our family and gain more than just a job.

Disclaimer: Bacardi is an equal opportunity employer that values workforce diversity. Diversity is core to our business: by embedding diversity into all aspects of our culture, we maximize the opportunity to achieve sustainable business success and growth. The duties and responsibilities described in the role profile might not be a comprehensive list.

U.S. applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws.

job_description:
Publicada hace 9 días por

Adagio Teas

Jornada Completa

Subgerente de Área

Región Metropolitana de Santiago

Vitacura

¡Únete a nuestros equipos!
Adagio Teas es una marca de té premium traído de diferentes lugares del mundo, elaborado con hojas frescas, cosechadas a mano. Para Adagio Teas la felicidad es riqueza, la paz interior es éxito y la salud es poder. Es por esto que buscamos educar sobre variedades, uso y beneficios del té y de nuestras infusiones.

¿Qué buscamos?
A nuestro/a Subgerente de Recursos Humanos quien será responsable de desarrollar e implementar iniciativas alineadas con la estrategia de las empresa.

¿Qué harías?
Legislación laboral:
• Velar por el cumplimiento de la legislación laboral vigente siendo un asesor constante de las gerencias y jefaturas.
• Controlar la correcta aplicación de la normativa vigente (libros de remuneraciones electrónicos, informe movimientos personal en la dirección del trabajo, protocolos exigidos por ley en situaciones especiales, cambios en normativas legales, etc..).
• Ejecutar acciones derivadas de procedimientos legales como preparar comparendos, cartas de aviso, reclamar las multas, asistir a fiscalizaciones, investigaciones internas en caso de denuncias, entre otros.

Gestión de personas y remuneraciones:
• Formular políticas e informar sobre los procedimientos para el buen funcionamiento de los procesos de Recursos Humanos (reglamentos, manuales de procedimientos).
• Mantener actualizado y asegurar el conocimiento por parte de todos los colaboradores del Reglamento Interno de las empresas.
• Supervisar los procesos de administración de personal (vacaciones, permisos, licencias, documentación laboral, ingresos, desvinculaciones, contratos).
• Optimizar los procesos de RRHH en la plataforma BUK, crear plantillas, configurar bonos, ajustar sueldos, revisar descripciones de cargo, mantener documentación al día, entre otros.
• Proponer, presentar e implementar acciones y proyectos de mejora continua del área RRHH.
• Supervisar los procedimientos y protocolos de prevención de riesgos para asegurar las medidas adecuadas que resguarden la integridad de los trabajadores.

Algunos beneficios de trabajar con nosotros son:
• Permisos por días administrativos
• Día libre por tú cumpleaños
• Descuento 40% en nuestros productos
• Aguinaldo de Fiestas Patrias y Navidad

¡Y mucho más!

Si estás listo/a para sumergirte en una experiencia laboral desafiante y llena de oportunidades, este es el lugar perfecto para ti.

Perfil deseado
• Ingeniero Comercial (con especialización en RRHH), Ingeniero en recursos humanos.
• Mínimo 4 años en cargos similares, idealmente mas de 8 años de experiencias laboral.
• Manejo del proceso completo de remuneraciones (excluyente).
• Conocimientos de legislación laboral (excluyente).
• Excel Nivel Intermedio.
• Capacidad de análisis, seguimiento de procesos, toma de decisiones.

Experiencia desde 6 años

Estudios mínimos: Universitaria

Graduado

Ingeniería Comercial

Ingeniería en Recursos Humanos
