job_description:
The chance to take the big leap in your professional career is here

Conquering new horizons and balance between a successful career and family life
Who is our client a nd your future employer?

This company owns and operates one of the largest integrated oil refinery and petrochemicals complex in the world, based in Rabigh, Saudi Arabia.

Using crude oil, ethane and butene as feedstocks, our client produces Polymers, Monomers and Refined Products. It hosts one of the world's largest high olefins fluid catalytic cracker (HOFCC) units and a world-scale ethane cracker to produce and market more than 2.4 millions of MT per year of ethylene and propylene derivative products and 18 millions MT per year of crude oil distillated products.

While being so highly committed to the nation ́s economic and technological growth, they need to have the best multicultural talent in order to reach their objectives and give them the chance to develop professionally and personally across new frontiers.

And you can be one of the selected profiles

LHR GLOBAL

The job opportunity you have long waited for. LHR Global recruit people around the world to work in Saudi Arabia.

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

We are looking for Project Director to lead the execution of Mega Projects

LHR Americas will go with you at every stage of the process

REQUIREMENTS
• Bachelor's degree in relevant field and preferably a masters degree and a minimum of 25 years of relevant experience including successfully managing and delivering mega and/or super mega projects with a budget over 2 billion USD.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
• Sets priorities, obtains commitments, and engages required resources through collaboration with Group Directors, Department Managers and/or Section Managers to staff projects according to the project Work Plan.
• Develops and nurtures key client relationships and is the primary company contact on assigned projects. Communicates effectively with clients to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutions and strategies.
• Responsible for financial performance on projects. Proactive management of cash, budget, schedule and project scope to ensure adherence to project goals and completion to the client's satisfaction.
• Collaborates with office and division leadership in solving challenges and ensuring business objectives are met.
• Supervises and mentors' team to achieve overall project objectives. Where appropriate, oversees the project's Project Manager(s). Responsible for/oversees project staffing, including, but not limited to; recruitment, hiring, development, retention and succession of project staff; development of plan for project staff reporting; and support for performance and compensation reviews.
• Leads pursuits of mega projects and/or actively involved as part of the pursuit team for super mega projects. Works closely with other company functions to develop long term strategies to identify and pursue additional business opportunities with key clients and with pursuit champions on efforts for mega and super mega projects in accordance with Petro Rabigh Policy and Approved Standard and Procedures.
• Works with the project team to prepare appropriate proposal and presentation materials. Leads interviews and proposal presentations to the Project Steering Committee, BOD, and upper management.
• Performs other duties as assigned.

REWARDS & BENEFITS OVERVIEW

Our client offers excellent compensation and industry-leading benefits and other programs designed to meet the diverse needs of their employees and their families.

Salary - commensurate with experience and individual qualifications.

Salary packages can include expatriate premiums & supplemental benefits plans

Annual bonus

Housing: housing allowance

Healthcare: Access to top-notch healthcare is an important part of working as an expatriate for our client.

Dependent Education: High School allowance

Annual vacation: 22 days of vacation leave per year. In addition to annual vacations days, employees also receive 11 paid company holidays each year.

Repatriation allowance: Annually round trip to your home country.

THE STAGES OF THIS PROCESS ARE:
• 1. Resume Evaluation:

A member of our recruitment team will evaluate that your resume matches the client's job description requirement.

Use the job description requirements to highlight your relevant experience and skills.

Be specific and describe the significance of your work, keyword alignment is important. Emphasize the impact of the work you've contributed to HR areas and tasks. Use your professional profile/resume to focus on major accomplishments and qualifications that match the job.

If your resume evaluation is suitable for this position, the recruitment team will invite you to a preliminary phone/video interview in 2-3 days.

If your resume evaluation is not suitable, you will be receiving an e-mail notification in 2-3 days.
• 2. Interviews stage

2.1 LHR Americas preliminary phone/video interview: A member of the Talent Acquisition team from LHR Americas will first schedule a call with you to discuss the details of the position, your interests, and qualifications. Furthermore, your English level will be evaluated at this stage, ONLY native or advanced speakers will approve this evaluation.

If this preliminary phone/video interview is successful, your resume will be submitted to our client.

If your preliminary phone/video interview is not successful our Talent Acquisition consultant will inform you.

2.2 Client phone/video interview: This interview will happen only if your resume is approved by our client, we cannot guarantee the time our Client will take to approve your resume, but it should take less than a week.

If your resume is approved a member of the Talent Acquisition Team from our client will schedule a call with you to evaluate your qualifications.

The client interview contains technical questions that help assess your familiarity with problem-solving in your given field and may include a behavioral evaluation. Be prepared to explain how you approach problems and produce solutions.

If your phone interview is successful, the hiring team will further evaluate your resume, and they will invite you to a video interview when hiring managers are available.

If your resume is not approved, LHR Americas will inform you.

2.3 Video interviews with hiring managers: which may also contain technical questions that help us assess your familiarity with problem-solving in your given field.

3. Conditional Offer

A successful interview may result in a conditional offer of employment.

Conditions for employment include but are not limited to: medical examinations, and permission to secure a visa to work and reside in-country.
• Relocation process

After your offer is accepted and all conditions for employment are met, you will be assigned a relocation advisor from LHR Americas. This advisor is your go-to resource for the transition, providing helpful advice on everything from when to give notice to your current employer to visa services.

job_description:
¿Te atreves a ser protagonista y hacer las cosas de forma diferente?

¡En Itaú Chile seguimos creciendo! Somos parte de Itaú Unibanco, el mayor banco privado de América Latina, contamos con más de 150 Sucursales físicas, más de 10 Sucursales Digitales de atención remota y con un equipo de más de 5200 itubers.

¿Nuestra visión? Ser el banco líder en performance sustentable y satisfacción de clientes. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre itubers, diversidad e inclusión de los equipos, aprendizaje continuo para innovar constantemente en búsqueda de resultados ambiciosos.

Aquí tenemos un mundo de oportunidades hechas para ti, las que te invitamos a descubrir, en nuestro ambiente meritocrático y de constantes desafíos, donde creemos en el potencial de cada uno.

¿Quieres ser parte del equipo itubers? Postula cómo Subgerente Prevención de Fraudes para la Gerencia de Riesgo, donde tus principales responsabilidades serán:
• Asegurar la reducción de la probabilidad de ocurrencia de fraude y maximizar la posibilidad de detección
• Desarrollar políticas y procedimientos que mitiguen los riesgos de fraude que se presenten en las distintas unidades del Banco y Filiales
• Controlar el monitoreo de operaciones y actividades realizadas en la red de sucursales
• Promover, orientar y proponer metodologías de análisis de información e identificación del origen del fraude
• Asegurar la gestión de crisis y aplicación de soluciones, acorde con los lineamientos corporativos y la normativa vigente
• Mantener una alta cultura de riesgos que permita la gestión preventiva, minimizando los impactos financieros para el Banco y difundiendo, concientizando y capacitando en materia de seguridad de la información, continuidad y prevención de fraudes.

Conoce los requisitos:
• Formación profesional en carreras como Ingeniería Comercial, Auditoria o carrera afín.
• Experiencia en cargos similares de mínimo 5 años.
• Conocimientos de procesos de detección de fraudes, normativas aplicables al proceso y plataformas Computacionales.
• Experiencia liderando equipos.
• Conocimiento en áreas de riesgo operacional en la banca.

¡Ofrecemos una propuesta de beneficios integrales para ti, enfocados en tu tiempo, familia, salud, desarrollo de carrera, momentos especiales, y mucho más!

En Itaú la diversidad e inclusión es parte de nuestra cultura, transformándonos en un lugar mejor, es por esto que buscamos la equidad de oportunidades y creemos en el talento, más allá del género, situación de discapacidad, orientación sexual y la etnia, entre otros.

¡Postula y se parte del cambio!

job_description:
Importante empresa dedicada al consumo masivo se encuentra en la búsqueda de un Gerente de integración TI Global LATAM quien será el encargado(a) es responsable de la entrega de servicios de TI E2E para los mercados de Chile y Perú en un entorno de servicio compartido que tiene un equipo directo que le reporta. El objetivo principal de esta función es ofrecer servicios de TI E2E y actuar como asesor de TI para la LGO de la empresa operadora asignada con respecto a las próximas iniciativas de TI que deberán implementarse en el Mercado; además de ser el asesor de la Gestión de GTS con respecto a las próximas necesidades comerciales del mercado (por ejemplo, adquisiciones de negocios, nuevos sitios que necesitan servicios de infraestructura). Esta posición también actúa como un punto de escalamiento para violaciones del servicio o problemas donde fallan los procesos estándar.

Responsabilidades:
• Asegurar que los servicios requeridos y acordados con los mercados se cumplan de la manera requerida por los mercados.
• Entrenar y desarrollar a las personas como individuos y como equipo, incluida la planificación de la carrera y la sucesión
• Desarrollar y mantener las competencias requeridas dentro del equipo, asegurando un flujo de personas
• Administrar eficazmente el presupuesto y los recursos de la unidad y los programas complejos. Identificar y reportar oportunidades de ahorro de costos; Gestionar la auditoría de facturas de telecomunicaciones; Planificar, presentar a MANCOM para su aprobación y ejecutar el CAPEX de TI
• Mantener relaciones efectivas y confiables entre LGO, Market, AMS GTS, equipos de Global GTS y otras partes interesadas importantes
• Asegurar que las prioridades y metas estén alineadas con las de los Servicios Compartidos de GTS siguiendo los Objetivos Funcionales de GTS (EUS, NUCS, PPM, etc.), los LGO latinoamericanos y el Programa GLOBE
• Supervisa, a través de los equipos de GTS, los servicios de mercado de Colombia, Ecuador y Venezuela en las áreas de infraestructura de TI, que incluyen soporte de servidores, operaciones de centros de datos locales, redes y comunicaciones unificadas, seguridad de aplicaciones y soporte al usuario final y adquisición de SI / TI
• Monitorear la prestación de servicios de GTS a través de la revisión de "Revisiones de calidad de TI" y "Revisiones de calidad de servicio" de GTS
• Gestionar tareas y planes de acción para todos los equipos locales para alcanzar los objetivos definidos en KPI de Seguridad de la Información y Cumplimiento y despliegue de GLOBE Stardands
• Gestionar la cartera de proyectos de TI (planificación de demanda y capacidad) para el mercado mencionado anteriormente siguiendo la metodología GLOBE en la alineación con los equipos de la cartera de proyectos
• Gestionar el proceso de adquisición de SI / TI dentro del Mercado, asegurando el cumplimiento del 100% en los contratos con los proveedores, así como el cumplimiento de las mejores prácticas de acuerdo con las pautas de adquisición.
• Prioriza los proyectos latinoamericanos en OpCos y gestiona las comunicaciones y expectativas de las partes interesadas de GTS y OpCo

Requisitos:
• Licenciado en informática, Ingeniería civil, Ingeniería comercial o carrera a fin.
• Desde 6 años en roles relacionados con datos y análisis
• Historial comprobado en la ejecución exitosa de actividades complejas
• Historial comprobado en la entrega de proyectos complejos
• Sólida experiencia con equipos multidisciplinarios de organización y proyectos comerciales o proyectos estratégicos de gestión del cambio
• Experiencia con una organización de servicios administrada globalmente basada en ITIL y gestión de incidentes importantes
• Experiencia en la conducción de proveedores
• Habilidades de liderazgo en el área funcional respectiva
• Experiencia en SI/TI, incluido el desarrollo, la implementación y el mantenimiento de sistemas ERP integrados a gran escala
• Historial de impulsar la mejora continua

Si estás interesado postular por el portal

¡Mucho éxito!

job_description:
We are looking to hire an energetic Marketing Manager to join our high calibre team at Warner Media, LLC.
in Santiago.
Growing your career as a Full Time Marketing Manager is a great opportunity to develop useful skills.

If you are strong in cooperation, teamwork and have the right personality for the job, then apply for the position of Marketing Manager at Warner Media, LLC.
today
Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.
Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery... the stuff dreams are made of.
Who We Are...

When we say, "the stuff dreams are made of," we're not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth.

Behind WBD's vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are thestorytellersbringing our characters to life, thecreatorsbringing them to your living rooms and thedreamerscreating what's next...

From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves.
Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

The professionalwill be responsible forimplementation and optimization of all the media efforts at a local level,includingEarnedmedia,OwnedMedia andPaidMedia to optimize all marketing investments in order to Integrate all efforts as a one integrated media plan in the region.
Execute local deals, to amplify marketing power and localreach + relevance.
Evaluate and oversee local strategic direction of Digital, Advertising and PR, agencies to ensure consistency, impact and effectiveness.
The Daily – Major Activities
Proven experience developing brand strategy and crafting a meaningful 360 campaign brief that delivers upon the larger brand, audience, and channel strategies
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills with a strong sense of storytelling and a talent for writing inspiring briefs, communication plans, and program recaps that improve campaigns year on year
Outstanding cross-functional collaboration skills - this person should steer the campaigns throughout the entire organization ensuring partners are on board and provided approvals along the way
Evaluate media efforts results and prepare measures of success.
Develop detailed understanding of media measurement as well as evaluation standards.
Supervise media marketplace to remain updated on latest media trends.
Identify opportunities and evolving issues and interpret new technologies along with consumer reaction.
Ensure approval of payment invoices and advertising billing.
Interact with agencies plus outside suppliers for billing issues plus dispute resolution.

job_description:
Before jumping in on all the information about the role and what you can bring to the table, let us introduce ourselves real quick.

About us

Hi there! We are Insider, a B2B SaaS company that drives growth for its clients around the world. How are we achieving this? We are connecting data across channels, predicting future behavior with AI, and individualizing experiences from a single platform with the fastest time to value.

We announced that we unlocked our unicorn status after our Series D round. We are backed by top-notch investors including Sequoia Capital, QIA, Riverwood, Endeavor Catalyst and trusted by 1000+ brands from high-growth startups to the most prestigious Fortune 500 companies such as Singapore Airlines, Virgin, Nestle, Nissan, Samsung, Lenovo, Puma, MediaMarkt, IKEA, Allianz, Santander, Dominos, Avon, CNN, and the list goes on.

We are the #1 Leader everywhere! We are recognized as a leader in The Forrester Wave™ for Cross-Channel Campaign Management in Q3, 2021. We are also named a leader in 2021 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Personalization Engines. But wait, there is more. For 21 quarters in a row, we’ve been ranked as a leader in G2 Mobile Marketing, Personalization, Customer Data Platform, and Customer Journey Analytics Grids.

We are also proud to become one of the very few female-led B2B SaaS unicorns in the world.

Behind all these achievements, there is an exceptionally talented and passionate team across 28 countries that moves fast and agile, creates cutting-edge products, and focuses on making an impact. If you want to join us in this journey, just keep reading.

As an Account Manager, you will be responsible for renewals and stakeholder management.

You will work in coordination with Customer Success Managers, and you will be the primary contact of the executives. Your primary responsibility will be to drive renewal, create expansion and MRR Raise opportunities, contract terms including price negotiations, and manage high-level stakeholders through all account bases. Your daily responsibilities will include sponsor nurturing, discovering all stakeholders and their needs to be matched with Insider product suites, Business Reviews, renewal processes, contract negotiations.

Job Description
• Participating in meetings with key stakeholders starting from onboarding kick-off and Business Review meetings
• Discovering strategic needs and direction of the customers, setting goals and objectives with a customer that will enable the teams to drive business impact
• Analyzing stakeholder mapping and setting overall strategy to capture right frequency in touchpoints
• Taking ownership of renewal success and strategy to achieve key commercial/contractual targets
• Assisting sales for upselling and initiating opportunities with the right product and right contact
• Owning commercial targets regarding gross margin, collection package raise, and service level adjustments in existing customer portfolio
• Ensuring Customer Success realization achieved and recognized across key stakeholders and reaching NPS targets ensuring best customer experience and success recognition
• Achieving customer advocacy goals with the marketing team with success stories, testimonials, and so on
• Monitoring market trends and industry analysis to nurture key stakeholders aligned with Insider Product and Strategic Roadmap execution

Requirements
• A university degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, or related fields
• 5+ years experience in Customer Success Management, Account Management, or Sales, ideally in SaaS
• Strong communication skills in both writing and speaking (English & Native Language)
• High sense of responsibility and accountability
• Strategic thinking with excellent project management skills
• Competency in sales methodologies such as Value Selling, Challenger Selling or Spin Selling is a plus
• Proven track record of using sales & persuasive skills
• Experience in negotiating and navigating contracts and legal discussions
• Adaptability to a fast-paced, high growth, rapidly changing environment
• Proven track record of driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts, and ensuring follow-through with verbal and written communication.
• Strong presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with large and small audiences and various levels of management (Senior Executives, IT management, Database administrators, and Data Scientist).
• Proven track record of building relationships and need discovery with senior customer executives in enterprise or highly strategic accounts.
• Experience in managing various stakeholder relationships to get consensus on solutions/engagements required.

Hold on! Life’s a two-way road! Here’s what you’ll enjoy while spending time with us (perks, anyone?)
• We offer many hard and soft skills training to help you improve and challenge yourself. You’ll have access to 16,000+ online courses taught by real-world professionals on the LinkedIn Learning platform to satisfy your hunger for knowledge.
• You’ll have space to share your skills through training and workshops if you wish. Sharing is caring!
• We’ll provide you with a paid Spotify account subscription, so you can cozy up in your headsets cocoon whenever you want.
• You’ll have a chance to work in an international, diverse, and inclusive environment.
• You’ll be part of an industry that’s shaping the future of customer experiences.
• Don’t believe us? Just ask Google.

Was this position made for you?

So let’s talk! We’re curious bugs and can’t wait to get to know you.

We provide equal opportunity in a zero-discrimination workplace and not just welcome but also embrace everyone without regard to sex, race, color, nationality, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, citizenship, or marital status.

Please follow Insider on LinkedIn, Instagram, Youtube, and Medium!

job_description:
Why Kyndryl
Kyndryl is a market leader that thinks and acts like a start-up. We design, build, manage, and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl?

We are always moving forward - always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers, and our communities.

We invest heavily in you - not only through learning, training, and career development, but also through the flexible working practices and stellar benefits that help you grow and progress long-term.

And we give back - from planting 90,000 trees in our first 3 months as part of our One Tree Planted initiative to the Corporate Social Responsibility and Environment, Social and Governance practices embedded within everything we do, we are committed to powering human progress in an ethical, sustainable way.

Your Role and Responsibilities

Technical Specialists at Kyndryl enjoy an empowering culture, a wide spectrum of opportunities, and a chance to move up in the career path that fits them best.

Here you'll work with and support the biggest companies across all industries and learn new, cutting-edge tech in real time, all the time and get paid to upskill.
You can reinvent yourself and your career with multiple paths at one company, and still find great work/life balance. You'll also get the chance to network and promote yourself to leaders and specialists in your field

This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you - and everyone next to you - the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture.
That's the Kyndryl Way.

job_description:
We are a fast-growing, Mexican fintechstartup with the mission to become the bridge to people's financialfreedom through technology.

We areproviding microloans to people in financial need through a fast andefficient process, always treating them with the respect anddignity they deserve.

Our long-term vision is bethe most inclusive digital bank in LATAM with morethan 2.5 millionclients.

Rolemission

As a Senior BackendEngineer, you'll be instrumental in shaping the future of ourproduct, making sure it's reliable, secure, and scalable. You'llhave the chance to work on projects that directly impact thesuccess of our business and ourcustomers.

Outcomes
• Design,develop, test, and maintain highly scalable, high-performing, androbust backend systems andservices

Day toDay
• Work closely withthe frontend team, product managers, and designers to definefeature specifications and build the next generation of ourproducts.
• Participate in all phases of thedevelopment cycle – concept, design, development, testing, andrelease.
• Optimize applications for maximumspeed, scalability, and reliability.
• Ensure allsystems are designed and coded for security, privacy, and adherenceto SOLID principles.
• Proactively identify andresolve software inefficiencies and potentialissues.
• Contribute to the entire softwaredevelopment lifecycle including design, development, documentation,testing, and operations.
• Provide technicalleadership and mentorship to juniorengineers.
• Regularly review and refine ourbackend engineering practices, ensuring high-quality softwareconstruction in accordance with SOLIDprinciples.

What YouBring to theTeam
• Bachelor's orMaster's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or arelated field, or equivalent experience.
• 7+years of experience in backenddevelopment.
• Deep understanding and practicalexperience in applying SOLID principles.
• Strongexperience with data storage technologies such as MySQL and cachingdatabases.
• Familiarity with cloud computingplatforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, orAzure.
• Strong understanding of API design andRESTful principles.
• Excellent understanding ofdata structures, algorithms, and software designprinciples
• Strong problem-solving abilities andexcellent communication skills.
• Familiaritywith Agile methodologies, Unit testing, Continuous Integration(CI), and Continuous Delivery (CD)practices.
• Great communication skills, andability to explain how software is working to a non-technicalaudience.

DesirableSkills
• Experience inimplementing security and data protectionmeasures.
• Knowledge of DevOps practices andtools.
• Experience in a high-growth techenvironment or startup.
• Experience in leadingtechnical projects or teams.
• Experience withperformance tuning and system loadtesting.
• Proficiency in using PHP and Pythonfor backend development.
• Experience in workingwith Docker for creating containers and managingmicroservices.
• Strong familiarity with Linuxenvironment, and experience in Linux server management andscripting.

Yourskills
• Clearand transparent communication. You are able to able toexpress your thoughts clearly, concisely and to the point. You canopenly discuss any blockers you have, and constructively point outareas for improvement.
• Relentlesslyresourceful at execution and problem solving. You makethings happen, no matter what. You are disciplined, organized andsystematically follow through on your work. Instead of gettingstuck thinking "well, this doesn't work", you look for creative /innovative / outside-of-the-box solutions to fix the issue and moveon.
• Sense of urgency. Youoperate with a constant sense of urgency (as if there was a large,hungry wolf chasing you), constantly looking for ways to move aheadand push everything around you to get to your desired outcome inthe most efficient and productive way. You don't wait around andmake things happen.
• Flexibility /adaptability / resilience. You ****can maintain yourcomposure and focus despite the constantly changing environment,and adequately adapt to new conditions. You can swiftly change thecourse of action when needed, and you don't get easilydemotivated.
• Being self-driven/committed. You require very little guidance andintervention from your leader to move ahead. You can correctly readwhat the situation requires, and take the necessary actionaccordingly. If your leader were to disappear, you can still moveahead and make relevant things happen. You act because you want to,and not because someone else is telling you that youshould.
• Strategic thinking / seeingthe bigger picture. You can see further than just yourimmediate "doorstep". You can correctly assess the deeperimplications of certain decisions that might materialise in thefuture, and take decisions accordingly. You often use data orprevious research to inform your recommendations anddecisions.
• Critical / analyticalthinking. You can correctly analyse the root causes of aproblem, without getting side-tracked by irrelevant, minor details.You can come to the right conclusion and propose a clear, logicalplan of action. You don't stay on the surface ofthings.
• Helping others succeed /strong stakeholder focus. While tackling theresponsibilities on your plate, you are constantly thinking "Howwill this impact the other party? Am I doing the absolute best Ican to offer excellent support / service? What more could I do tohelp the other side achieve their goal or grow? Am I optimising formyself, or for the commongood?"

job_description:
The Opportunity: Area Head of L&S Products

Manage an Area Local Services team in charge of developing local products, setting local rates and providing product expertise to other Area teams. Local Services cover e.g. , WnD, Air, CHB, LCL, CCL, depots, intercontinental rail, and cargo insurance, and bring these to desired stage.

Who we are

A.P. Moller-Maersk is an integrated container logistics company working to connect and simplify our customers’ supply chains. As the global leader in shipping services, we operate in 130 countries and employ more than 100,000 people. With a simple end-to-end offering of products and digital services, seamless customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, we enable our customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere- all over the world.

Key responsibilities:

Area Local services
• Develop Area Strategy and Pricing for Local Services
• Develop Area strategy, matching Global product strategic guidelines [Translation of the Global/Regional strategy into a local plan to facilitate product growth and meet customer needs]
• Ensure Area pricing process comply with Global governance
• Make hay/local innovation
• Develop local products and P&L for these are owned by the APM
• Develop and monitor Area product targets (to be signed by Area MD)
• Support sales management in the establishing of value proposition and sales channel target setting
• Manage product performance in Area & ensure targets are met
• Manage Area product development and local investment cases
• In conjunction with procurement as required, establish contracts with key 3rd party vendors e.g. trucking and rail
• Optimize local products through day-to-day asset and 3rd party management
• Develop local products both in terms of corridors and product features
• Facilitate Global / Regional solutions in Area by providing / developing relevant Local Services products upon request
• Establish business cases for asset investments supporting the local and global L&S strategy as well as accountable/measured on realization of the benefits of such business cases

Liaise with Delivery
• Grow L&S bring products to the desired stage
• Ensure close collaboration with Delivery so that CL, Depots (and potentially CCL) delivers on targets, NPS and that necessary controls are in place for the execution of that business (both financially, operationally and in terms of HSSE)

Balance Sheet
• The APM is together with the Area Finance Manager accountable for managing the balance sheets for assets owned in the Area

Establish team with Local Services expertise at Area level
• Build and develop team with strong logistics capabilities and product expertise
• Act as SMEs and support the Area Sales teams in large scale pursuits including customer visits as required
• Share best practices with Region and Global team

Accountable for:
• Area LS strategy, P&L and pricing (to comply with Global governance)
• Area LS product development (major investments signed off by Global Local Services)
• Staffing of Area product team
• Long-term account planning

We are looking for:
• Local Services expertise and understanding of Local customer needs for Local Services (incl. vertical specifications)
• Strategic mindset and strong execution skills
• Strong P&L experience, anticipates future product performance delivery and factors this into overall pricing strategy decisions
• Ability to identify Customer pain points using qualitative and quantitate data
• Strong analytical and data driven
• Customer focused with excellent attention to detail and drive to serve customers
• mindset
• Motivational leadership
• Solid planning skills
• Ability to communicate clearly and set focus/direction
• Stakeholder management
• Proven leadership skills

We value diversity and we urge all, who consider themselves qualified, to apply irrespective of gender, nationality, age etc. We are looking for a person, who comes with passion, drive and energy as well as share our company values (Employees, Humbleness, Our Name, Uprightness and Constant Care). The person does not necessarily need to know it all or fulfil all requirements but has a natural curiosity and desire to learn and develop as our employees are supported through personal coaching, training, and development.

We offer

At Maersk we go the extra mile to service our customers in the best possible way. We work hard to build and strengthen relationships with customers, making sure we understand their business drivers so we can continuously improve co-operation, processes, and outcomes. We provide end-to-end transportation to almost anywhere in the world. We combine our global network with local expertise to increase the reliability of your deliveries, whether they travel by sea or over land so if you have what it takes to be successful come and work with us! Find out more:

https://www.maersk.com

Notice to Applicants

Maersk is committed to equal employment opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. We value diversity and prohibit the discrimination of any applicant on the basis of race, color, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible.

Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential.
Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a

culture of inclusion

for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences.

We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team - one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Title and Summary

Director, Products and Solutions - Digital Consumer

Overview
• Acts as a business owner and manages longterm and shortterm strategic initiatives for a Digital Consumer Products for Argentina, Chile, Uruguay, Paraguay, Peru and Bolivia.
• Roles in this family oversee product evolution, establish gotomarket strategy, optimize products and resources, implement incremental improvements within the product's life cycle, conduct ongoing care and maintenance, and manage P&L

Responsibilities:
• Drive tangible datadriven business outcomes at the product level, manage to a quantified scorecard continuously monitoring and analyzing key performance indicators and optimizing product performance
• Demonstrate awareness of Mastercard's broader Product offering and the ability to leverage Products from other business areas to augment Product capabilities
• Leverage data to quickly identify Product performance challenges, creating proactive plans to drive usage and revenues. Use datadriven analysis to prioritize resources to deliver against the plan
• Ensure that the broader Mastercard organization is enabled to sell focus Products by creating compelling communications & marketing content in partnership with Marketing
• Lead crossfunctional teams (e.g. Product, Product Management-Technical, CX&D) in the development of business requirements to achieve Product objectives
• Provide regular coaching and feedback to direct reports and partners to grow individual functional skills, experience and leadership capabilities
• Demonstrate a commitment to continuous learning by leveraging the learning & development curriculum to augment existing knowledge, skills and experiences
• Develop talent and provide timely feedback, coaching in the moment, and mentoring
• Demonstrate and drive Mastercard Way behaviours through their behaviour, recognitions, coaching, and employee engagement.
Experiences
• Proven ability to lead in a matrix environment
• Can deliver high quality products/services in a high growth environment where priorities shift rapidly
• Ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases
• Demonstrated ability to operate with complete independence and autonomy
• Extensive experience building and launching products
• Comprehensive experience in Agile delivery methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)
• Can communicate to executives, peers, and staff with impact, eloquence, and authenticity
• Demonstrated experience building relationships, partnering with and influencing executive leadership while commanding the respect of the individual product teams across the organization

• The role of the Deal Desk Senior Manager is to help drive and increase long term value within the new business environment. Working collaboratively across Sales, Legal, Finance and License compliance management teams the Deal Desk Analyst will drive the deal review process and ensure pricing and structure is market competitive. The Deal Desk Senior Manager will act as a trusted advisor to the Regional Sales VP, Sales Directors and sales managers and provide education to the Sales and around competitive environment, guidance on discount management and pricing negotiation strategy and deal structure.

• Oversee management of deals through the deal review process to ensure quality assurance, business, operational and SLA compliance and optimal deal structure and pricing response. Review deal financials, pricing and business risk while maximizing value to Veritas. job_description:
Descripción empresa:

Somos más de 90 mil personas que, día a día, dedicamos nuestra pasión y energía a cumplir nuestro Propósito de “Simplificar y Disfrutar Más la Vida”. Propósito que hoy vive a través de nuestro ecosistema físico y digital en todas nuestras empresas (Falabella Retail, Sodimac, IKEA, Tottus, Mallplaza, Falabella Inmobiliario, Falabella.com, Linio, Falabella Financiero, Banco Falabella, Falabella Soriana, Seguros Falabella, Fazil, Fpay y Falabella Corporativo) y países (Argentina, Brasil, Chile, China, Colombia, India, México, Perú y Uruguay).

Valoramos las distintas miradas porque entendemos que la diversidad es la clave de nuestra innovación. Queremos ir más allá de cualquier límite, desafiarnos constantemente, divertirnos haciendo lo que nos gusta y dejar huella en lo que hacemos. Y sabemos que existe una forma de hacerlo: como UN SOLO EQUIPO.

Conoce más oportunidades para vivir la #ExperienciaFalabella en https://muevete.falabella.com/

Misión del cargo:

Supervisar el área de operaciones regional, garantizando el cumplimiento de los procesos y la mejora continua de los mismos.

Funciones del cargo:

¡Seguro que esto no lo sabías! Creamos productos y servicios 100% enfocados en cuidar lo que más quieres. Ven a innovar, desafiarte y crear las mejores soluciones digitales para simplificar la vida de nuestros clientes en #SegurosFalabella, un equipo de y para #Gennials, y en todos los negocios de #FalabellaFinanciero donde somos parte.

Si te gusta lo simple, andar liviano y ser digital, ¡este equipo para ti!

Nos gusta innovar, trabajamos desde donde queremos estar, respetamos y valoramos la diversidad, incluimos a todas las personas y derribamos barreras porque acá las diferencias suman.

Disfrutamos y lo pasamos bien trabajando en equipo, aceptando las diferencias por nuestra identidad de género, orientación sexual, creencias religiosas, discapacidad, edad o nacionalidad, compartimos experiencias entre negocios, vibramos con los desafíos del mundo físico y digital.

Somos más de 100 mil personas en 9 países distintos que cada día trabajamos como un equipo por simplificar y disfrutar más la vida.

¿Te animas a ser parte de Seguros Falabella? Para nosotros cada día es diferente, trabajamos con compromiso, innovación y en equipo. Si eres alguien que se apasiona por el trabajo dinámico y desafíos, ¡Esta es tu oportunidad de hacer que las cosas pasen!

Para la Gerencia de Operaciones nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un Subgerente de Operaciones, con el desafío de Supervisar el área de operaciones regional, garantizando el cumplimiento de los procesos y la mejora continua de los mismos.

Además, tendrás las siguientes responsabilidades:

Control y seguimiento a procesos garantizando el cumplimiento de indicadores, generación de estrategias de mejora continua con el foco en la excelencia operacional, impulsar la transformación digital.
• Si eres parte del ecosistema Falabella, ¡recuerda que solo debes postular a través de la plataforma Muévete, haciendo click en Oportunidades para Colaboradores!

Requisitos:

Formación en áreas de administración, finanzas, industrial o similar

Experiencia previa liderando equipos de más de 15 personas

Al menos 5 años trabajando en áreas de backoffice

Deseable conocimientos de seguros

Condiciones oferta:
Beneficios:
• Seguro médico
• Descuentos en productos
• Subsidio educativo

Who's behind Deel?

We're a global team that loves to build and solve problems, especially when it comes to the world of remote work.
Made up of self-driven people spanning 150+ countries, Deel's unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and improving.

Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we're building the tools to make that a reality.
Our market-leading tech, expertise, and, most importantly, the team are crucial. As a whole, we find fulfillment in working together towards our shared mission.

So, why now?
A significant shift has occurred within today's workforce, and with it, business as we know it has drastically changed.

At Deel, we see a world without hiring borders, but we needed to find a solution to make it happen.
A 30-mile hiring radius should no longer limit how companies hire because great talent lives everywhere.

Deel exists to stay on top (and ahead) of the accelerating global talent market by offering global teams all the tools needed to hire, manage, pay, and scale at rocket speed.

And speaking of scale, Deel has officially raised $425 million in Series D funding, bringing our valuation to $5.5 billion.
There's never been a more exciting time to join Deel - the market leader in international payroll and compliance.

Our growing Revenue, Operations and Strategy team is seeking a Pricing & Promotions Manager to join our team.

In this role you will work with leaders in Product, Legal, Sales and Finance to solve some of our most complex commercialization and pricing problems we face today.

You will be evaluating complex business issues, developing both short term fixes and long term strategic plans, and driving those proposals from ideation to implementation.

Main Tasks:
• Design, implement, and iterate a valuemaximizing pricing strategy for Deel
• Manage and own pricing strategy and develop methods to monitor the progress of pricing effectiveness across industry sectors and sales regions.
• Build out and manage a global team to lead and drive pricing strategy supporting a rapidly growing sales organization.
• Liaise with commercial and finance stakeholders to create insightful management information that drives the commercial agenda, tracks progress to KPI's
• Identify opportunities to streamline processes, improve systems, gather data, enable and train; all with the overall purpose of building up profitable and efficient growth
• Work crossfunctionally across Product, Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, Finance and Revenue Operations groups, on implementing large scale projects to help Deel grow

You will be successful if you have:
• Experience defining, structuring, and framing complex pricing problems and decisions in a simple, actionable way; performing disciplined and rigorous analysis resulting in actionable insights
• 6+ years working in a Marketing / Pricing function with highgrowth startup or tech company
• 3+ years managing a Pricing team
• Excellent judgment, mature personality, and experience dealing with executives
• Highly goal oriented, assertive and a handson problem solver, with excellent organizational and time management skills.
• Excellent communication skills, with experience working with sales leadership, and ability to work crossfunctionally, build relationships and influence in a fully remote organization
• Independent problemsolver and selfstarter able to manage complex projects endtoend from design to execution to delivering outsized impact
• Excellent data modeling, presentation skills and demonstrated experience providing datadriven business insights.
• Proficiency in CRM tools (Salesforce) and Visualization Tools (Looker) required

Total Rewards
At Deel, our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are, no matter their location. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all. Because a good life brings great innovation.

At Deel, you'll enjoy:
• Flexible Paid Time Off
• Parental leave
• The option to be paid in digital currency or the currency of your choice
- $100 per person per month Health and Wellness budget
- $30 per person per month Learning and Development budget
• FlexWork you choose where you work from your home, the beach, a Deel office, or through our WeWork global membership program
Perks are nice, but perks don't make a company or individual successful - the work does.

At Deel, we're building technology and products to engage the ever-changing global workforce and to ensure businesses may hire anyone anywhere.
While you're building for our customers, we're building for you.
• *At Deel, we're an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job_description:
We are in search of a discerning Design Director whose primary responsibility will be to critically evaluate and ensure the highest standards of design quality for our brand. The ideal candidate will possess a sharp eye for modern and minimalistic designs and will play a pivotal role in upholding our reputation for outstanding design aesthetics.

Key Responsibilities:

Design Evaluation:
• Critically review and assess all designs across various departments, ensuring they meet the company's high standards for quality, modernity, and minimalism.
• Provide actionable feedback and recommendations for design improvements.

Design Quality Assurance:
• Establish and maintain design benchmarks and standards that align with the company's brand identity and vision.
• Collaborate with design teams to ensure all outputs are consistent with these established standards.

Trend Analysis:
• Stay updated with the latest design trends, techniques, and tools.
• Conduct regular reviews of competitor and market design trends, ensuring our designs remain ahead of the curve.
• Work closely with design teams, providing mentorship and guidance to elevate their work.
• Foster a culture of continuous improvement, encouraging designers to challenge and elevate their craft.

Reporting & Documentation:
• Document feedback and critiques for all reviewed designs.
• Present regular updates to senior leadership on the state of design quality and areas of improvement.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Design, Fine Arts, or a related field.
• Minimum of 7 years of professional design experience, with at least 3 years in a senior or directorial role.
• A strong portfolio showcasing a keen eye for modern and minimalistic design.
• Exceptional communication skills with the ability to articulate design decisions and feedback constructively.
• Familiarity with a wide range of design tools and software.
• Proven track record of leading design initiatives and elevating design quality.

¿Qué desafíos encontrarás en esta posición?

1. Liderarás la operatividad y funcionamiento de Mallplaza Los Dominicos, entregando a la comunidad y a sus visitantes experiencias de valor que incrementen los niveles de recomendación y de lealtad.

2. Serás responsable de aumentar las ventas y el relacionamiento con retailers.

3. Generarás iniciativas para aumentar indicadores de gestión y de satisfacción.

4. Gestionarás indicadores de negocio, clientes y retailers; con foco en la venta y comunicación al operador a través de la omnicanalidad del negocio, desde un punto de vista digital, de modo de obtener el cumplimiento de indicadores proyectados.

5. Articularás todas las iniciativas y requerimientos del centro comercial, hacia los equipos de Casa Matriz, velando por los resultados de negocio del mall.

Si te sumas al desafío disfrutarás de:
• 5 días libres para que disfrutes de la vida
• Bono de desempeño anual
• Acceso a cursos a través de nuestra plataforma de aprendizaje
• Programas de estudios y becas
• Beneficios de salud para ti y tu familia

En Mallplaza valoramos lo que diferencia a cada una de las personas y sus talentos, movilizando nuestra cultura hacia equipos diversos e inclusivos. Todas nuestras vacantes invitan a participar a todos/as de manera inclusiva. ¡Te invitamos a sumarte a este gran equipo!

Requisitos:

Estar titulado/a de Ingeniería Comercial, Ingeniería Civil Industria o carrera afín

Tener al menos 5 años de experiencia laboral

Deseable que tengas experiencia anterior en empresas del rubro

Experiencia anterior manejando equipos

Condiciones oferta:

Mision del cargo:
Desarrollar e implementar el departamento de tecnología, asegurando una base tecnológica que permita escalar el negocio a través de nuevos desarrollos, integraciones y migraciones futuras. Desarrollar y consolidar el área de retail digital y transformación digital de la empresa.
Responsabilidades
Definir y desarrollar la estrategia y arquitectura de tecnología de la compañía con una visión estratégica
Supervisar el funcionamiento y mantenimiento de los sistemas de TI de la empresa, lo que incluye infraestructura, aplicaciones y sistemas en general
Confeccionar y gestionar el presupuesto anual de TI de la compañía.
Desarrollar e implementar políticas y procedimientos de seguridad de la información
Gestionar la integración de sistemas y datos entre empresas y proveedores u otros socios comerciales
Velar por mantener estándares de calidad TI, digitalización e innovación.
Desarrollar el presupuesto y control de gastos de CAPEX y OPEX
Responsable de la mantención, diseño y desarrollo de la plataforma SAP a través del partner tecnologico
Evaluar la totalidad de los Partners actuales de la empresa, velando por el cumplimiento de los contratos vigentes
Construir bases de licitación para aquellos nuevos servicios y/o servicios actuales donde el proveedor tenga que ser cambiado o incorporado.Requisitos
Formación Ingeniería Civil Informática, Ingeniería Civil Industrial o Ing. en informática
Alto conocimiento en tecnologías de información empresarial, incluyendo hardware, software, sistemas de seguridad y comunicaciones.
Experiencia demostrada de al menos 3 años en liderar equipos de TI
Experiencia en la gestión de proyectos de TI, incluyendo la implementación de nuevos sistemas y la integración de sistemas y datos.
Experiencia en el sector automotriz o retail es deseable
Manejo de SAP avanzado
Manejo de CRMs.
Arquitectura empresarial
Manejo de visualizadores de datos nivel avanzado.

-Requerimientos- Educación mínima: Técnico
3 años de experiencia

job_description:
En HRGROWIN consultora de Recursos Humanos, buscamos al próximo Subgerente Comercial para nuestro cliente, importante notaría a nivel nacional.

Si tienes al menos 2 años de experiencia liderando equipos comerciales del canal B2B esta oportunidad es para ti.

Buscamos un líder estratégico que garantice, supervise y guíe las actividades de ventas de la empresa, trabajando para alcanzar los objetivos de venta, aumentar la rentabilidad y desarrollar relaciones comerciales sólidas.

Principales funciones:

-Diseño e implementación del plan comercial de la compañía, para lograr crecimiento en ventas, rentabilidad y cobertura.

-Crear y administrar al equipo de ventas.

-Generar estrategia y plan de marketing para los productos y servicios.

-Apoyar la definición de la estrategia de posicionamiento y branding de la empresa.

-Realizar la gestión comercial, desde el inicio del proceso de ventas, hasta la concreción de esta, contactando nuevos clientes para así incrementar la base de prospectos calificados y cumplir con las metas establecidas para su equipo a cargo.

-Analizar el mercado de potenciales clientes para identificar oportunidades de negocio.

-Asegurar el cumplimiento de las metas de venta, presupuestos de gastos y políticas comerciales, incluyendo KPI´s, rentabilidad y acciones comerciales.

-Asegurar el cumplimiento de los servicios acordados y que estos se den según lo estándares de calidad establecidos.

Requisitos:

-Será un plus contar con título de Abogado, Ingeniería Comercial o Civil Industrial.

-Indispensable contar con al menos 2 años de trayectoria laboral liderando equipos comerciales y captación de clientes en empresas, oficinas de abogados, inmobiliarias o corredoras de propiedades, idealmente en el área de trámites notariales o documentación regulatoria.

-Experiencia en gestión de ventas canal B2B.

-Contar con manejo de estrategias de gestión de presupuesto y análisis de mercado.

-Disponibilidad para trabajo bajo sistema híbrido (terreno, presencial y home office)

¿Qué ofrecemos?

-Ser parte de una compañía altamente innovadora en su segmento.

-Incentivo variable por cumplimientos de metas.

-Seguro complementario de salud.

job_description:
About VERITAS

Veritas solves what no one else can. With an industry-leading product portfolio, we offer proven, modern, and integrated technology that brings together availability, protection, and insights.

Our Veritas Enterprise Data Services Platform addresses current and future data issues end-to-end - keeping mission-critical workloads highly available, protecting data everywhere, and providing insights to optimize costs and maintain regulatory readiness.
Veritas supports 500+ data sources, 150+ storage targets, 50+ clouds, and any deployment model imaginable.

We serve 99% of the Fortune 100, 90% of the Fortune 500, and are the market leader in Software-defined Storage, Data Protection, and Archiving.

Veritas Customer Success is responsible for ensuring that Veritas' customers are successfully exceeding the value of their investment in Veritas solutions and coordinating the company focus on the end-to-end customer relationship.
Customer Success includes customer support and care, professional and business critical services, and renewal sales.

Job Description:

The Technical Account Manager (TAM) will be a dedicated point of contact for TAM eligible customers who subscribe to select Veritas SaaS products.

The TAM will have detailed knowledge of the Veritas SaaS suite of products and be a trusted advisor for their customers.
The TAM will have experience in technical, account and project management. The TAM will have the ability to collaborate across the Veritas organization to be an advocate for their customers.

Responsibilities:
• Develop relationships with key business and stakeholders and become an expert on a customer's Veritas SaaS environment.
• Help customers achieve their business goals and outcomes by providing timely, proactive recommendations based on usages.
• Attain Trusted Advisor status with both key business and technical decision makers.
• Advocate for innovation and early adoption of new feature releases by working with stakeholders through Veritas SaaS release cycles.
• Uncover area of opportunity to bring additional Veritas products into a customer's environment.
• Lead Technical Health Reviews and provide relevant technical recommendations on solutions based on customer's business needs.
• In support of the customer work as a liaison, including escalation point, between the customer and the various Veritas teams (Technical Support, Engineering, Product Management, Provisioning & Account Teams).
• Participate in issues and act as an advocate for customers during the triage and resolution of high severity issues, driving business reliability and customer satisfaction
• Be an expert in the Veritas SaaS suite of products to provide customers with a technical resource who can solve issues and provide customer training
• Provide proactive communications in the event of a service degradation or disruption.
• Identify and collaborate with internal teams to identify renewal risks
• Demo existing unused Veritas SaaS capabilities/functionality.
• Provide a pathway for customers to be involved in the evolution of the Veritas SaaS suite of products.
Minimum Qualifications
• BA/BS Degree (or equivalent)
• Minimum of 2 years' experience in Enterprise level technical and/or account support preferably in a SaaS environment.
• Excellent verbal or written communication skills and interpersonal skills, as well as welldeveloped relationship management skills
• Ability to prioritize, multitask, and perform effectively under pressure.
• Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization, including executive and Clevel.

job_description:
Es la televisión Pública de Chile. Una empresa autónoma del Estado, con personalidad jurídica de derecho público y patrimonio propio, que es administrada por un directorio pluralista, en cuya designación intervienen el Presidente de la República y el Senado. A sus siete miembros se agrega un representante de los trabajadores de la empresa. El canal fue fundado en 1969 bajo la ley 17.377, sustituida en 1992 por la ley 19.132 que lo rige actualmente. A partir de ella, cuenta con un modelo autofinanciado y competitivo, y mantiene una total independencia editorial en la definición de sus contenidos. En su señal abierta, que se extiende por todo el territorio nacional de Arica a Punta Arenas, TVN ofrece una parrilla programática generalista que incluye información, ficción, entretención y cultura. TVN tiene además una señal internacional llamada TV Chile, el canal de noticias 24 Horas en la TV de Pago, una sólida Red Regional a lo largo de Chile , una señal 2 dedicada al público infantil-familiar y dos plataformas web: www.tvn.cl y www.24horas.cl. Puedes postular a nuestras ofertas laborales en http://empleos.tvn.cl/

Televisión Nacional de Chile se encuentra en búsqueda de un/a Subgerente de Tecnologías de Información, capaz de liderar, implementar y mantener el desarrollo de iniciativas en materias de tecnologías de la información y comunicaciones, velando que todos los servicios sean otorgados a las diferentes áreas en tiempo y forma, de acuerdo con los estándares de calidad definidos por la empresa.

Entre sus funciones destacan:
• Diseñar, planificar y monitorear la estrategia de Informática Corporativa, a fin de garantizar el alineamiento de sus proyectos con la estrategia del negocio y la continuidad operacional.
• Liderar el desarrollo, mejora y optimización continua de los sistemas de información y estándares de calidad, asegurando la disponibilidad de los recursos tecnológicos en óptimas condiciones para la operación de TVN.
• Gestionar conocimiento y asesorar en las materias vinculadas a tecnología de la información, comunicaciones y gobierno electrónico según las necesidades de la empresa, entregando información veraz y oportuna para la actualización de procedimientos y para la toma de decisiones de los cargos directivos.
• Definir las especificaciones técnicas para la adquisición de plataformas y servicios de Tecnología de la Información, garantizando la incorporación de la mejor solución para los requerimientos de la organización.

Requisitos:
• Formación: Ingeniero/a Civil Informático/a, Ingeniero/a Civil Industrial o carrera afín
• Conocimientos:Gestión de Proyectos, Herramientas de Ofimática, Gestión de procesos TI, Gestión de personas, en Redes y seguridad informática, Metodologías de Desarrollo de Software.
• Deseable conocimiento relacionado con procesos de Televisión.
• Experiencia de al menos 5 años en empresas de similar magnitud como Subgerente de Departamento de TI.

job_description:
Buscamos a aquellos profesionales referentes dentro de las industrias de Retail, cuya pasión está en la generación de nuevos negocios a través de diferentes canales y estrategias y que creen profundamente las nuevas oportunidades que trae consigo la industria TI. Buscamos a los protagonistas que hay detrás de los grandes acuerdos que mueven la industria ¿Eres tu quizás? Contamos con el agrado de ofrecer una oportunidad única de pertenecer a una organización de gran presencia internacional, ejecutando el rol de Gerente de Negocios de Tecnología (Segmento Retail), cuya responsabilidad principal será la de gerenciar la generación de negocios y entrega de servicios para cuentas estratégicas. Sus principales funciones serán: Generar nuevos negocios con cuentas actuales y nuevos portafolios Desarrollar estrategias para incrementar el ingreso de los negocios Establecer alianzas y relaciones de largo plazo con los clientes Liderar los equipos a su cargo con foco en desarrollo y mejora, estableciendo objetivos claros y entregando feedback oportuno. Asegurar la rentabilidad de los servicios proporcionados, con alto nível de satisfacción del cliente Alinear los requerimientos y expectativas del negocio y las capacidades del proveedor de servicio, siendo capaz de articular las capacidades de distintos actores para agregar valor al cliente. Incluye la gestión de capacidad internas provenientes de diferentes geografías. Asegurar cabal cumplimiento de los aspectos regulatorios de los servicios entregados Monitorear y gestionar de manera selectiva los indicadores críticos de los servicios, asegurando calidad de los procesos de desarrollo a su cargo. Monitorear y optimizar los aspectos financieros de los proyectos de su cartera. Conocer las implicaciones del negocio y de ser un enlace estratégico de la relación entre negocio y proveedor. Identificar oportunidades de mejora y crecimiento para agregar valor de manera continua.

Puente Digital se encuentra realizando la búsqueda de diferentes perfiles para una Importante empresa dedicada a la prestación de soluciones informáticas de servicios a nível internacional.
• *Requisitos**:
Más de 10 años de experiência en venta de proyectos tecnológicos de servicios, con foco en servicios de desarrollo o mantenimiento de aplicaciones y/o servicios relacionados. Al menos 3/5 años en roles similares con cumplimientos de objetivos probado de ventas de cuotas superiores a +10M USD anuales. Experiência en la industria del Retail. Experiência en gestión de grandes clientes y grandes negocios. Experiência en proyectos de transformación digital, desarrollo, testing, automatización o infraestructura híbrida liderando equipos multidisciplinarios (Preventas, equipos de proyecto, etc). Profundos conocimientos de metodologías de value selling. Contar con nível de inglés avanzado. Habilidad y experiência cerrando negocios.

Beneficios

Incentivos anuales ligados a resultados y desempeño. Aguinaldos fiestas patrias y navidad Seguro de salud complementario y salud con aporte del colaborador Día de cumpleaños Premio de antigüedad Incrementos salariales por IPC Beneficios legales: Seguro de cesantía, Mutual de Seguridad, Cajas de Compensación. Programa de prevención de riesgos Bonos complementarios por nacimiento, defunción de familiares y otros.

job_description:
Job Category:
Products and Technology

Job Details:

Associate Release Manager:
Location: Remote EST or CST - Indianapolis, IN preferred
• *Team Overview

Role Overview

Your Impact - Responsibilities

A multiplier, and constantly look for ways to make other teams successful who understands that the success and efficiency of the hundreds of scrum teams you interact with is critical to enabling continuous change.

Combine customer empathy and passion for moving fast to deliver frequent, high quality releases that benefit our customers and partners and empower our engineers.

An ambitious leader who is visionary, makes data-informed decisions, takes calculated risks and is effective at influencing all levels of customers with the ability to communicate clearly to everyone from Executives to individual contributors.
You love working with customers and partners; every decision you make is with Customer Trust in mind.

Seek opportunities to be mentored and to mentor others.

With a beginners attitude and an insatiable desire to learn, you demonstrate the analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skills that you learned through your education and experience in Computer Science, Business, or another exciting field to lead cross-functional teams and deliver [r]evolutionary solutions.

Minimum Requirements:
• Technical program or engineering management experience at an enterprise technology company
• Experience leading cross functional teams
• Solid understanding of the SaaS business model and its product development lifecycle
• Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with a history of handson, detail orientation
• Ability to establish credibility and rapport with senior executives, technical, and nontechnical team members
• Outstanding organizational, communication, and relationship building skills conducive to driving consensus; able to work well in a crossfunctional, matrix management environment
• Strong project management, analysis, and communication skills
• Ability to successfully partner with all functions across the entire company
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience

Preferred Requirements:
• Familiar with Service Ownership and DevOps standard methodologies
• Experience handling SaaS Cloud Application releases
• Salesforce Platform and products experience
• Familiarity with compliance and security standards, policies, and risk management
• Public cloud infrastructure knowledge
• Comfortable bending between the tactical and strategic
• Ability to handle/balance priorities without loss of efficiency
• *Accommodations

Posting Statement:
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces.

We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more.
Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Salesforce welcomes all.

As a federal contractor, Salesforce is required to verify that all US-based employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

If you receive an offer and are unable to get vaccinated for religious or medical reasons, you may request a reasonable accommodation.

job_description:
Nuestros clientes y colaboradores cambiaron y obviamente queremos seguir ofreciéndoles lo mejor. Súmate a esta gran misión y tendrás la oportunidad de explotar todo tu potencial y ser protagonista de grandes transformaciones.

El team de Gerencia Omnichannel Supply Chain está buscando a su próximo Cargo Subgerente/a Operaciones Inbound para marcar la diferencia en nuestro equipo. Si te consideras disruptivo y valiente, Prepárate porque esto se pone bueno.
• *Misión**: Planificar y controlar el correcto manejo de los activos de la compañía y de terceros utilizados en la distribución de las mercancías centralizadas. Proveer el abastecimiento de activos de la compañía, asegurando una fluidez continua en el movimiento de las mercancías encaminando la operación al punto de equilibrio financiero. Coordinar las operaciones de traslado de mercancías de proveedores externos hacia nuestros centros de distribución (flujo Backhaul) maximizando los ingresos por este concepto.
• *Tus desafíos serán**:

- Planificar, coordinar y controlar los procesos de traslado de mercancías de proveedores externos hacia nuestros centros de distribución.
- Analizar, actualizar y evaluar permanentemente las tarifas del servicio hacia proveedores de productos y costos de los proveedores de transporte.
- Coordinar y controlar retiro de activos de locales y entregas a CD.
- Ejecutar contacto con los clientes del servicio backhaul, de manera remota y presencial.

job_description:
Location: Santiago Intl Apt (SCL-TRML)

Requisition ID: 69216

Intro

Are you ready to explore a world of possibilities, both at work and during your time off? Join our American Airlines family, and you’ll travel the world, grow your expertise and become the best version of you. As you embark on a new journey, you’ll tackle challenges with flexibility and grace, learning new skills and advancing your career while having the time of your life. Feel free to enrich both your personal and work life and hop on board!

Why you'll love this job
• This role manages our partnership operations within our country including but not limited to ground operations coordination, ramp operations planning, customer experience and seamless partnerships
• The role is part of the MCLA Operations team within our International Division.

What you'll do
• Develop processes and tools required to build a strong relationship with our partners in our city/country/region.
• Analyze business decisions and strategies to provide better negotiation tactics, seeking potential benefits and prevent conflict.
• Identify and develop new opportunities to drive value to the company through partnerships
• Establishes and develops contacts within our partners and maintain periodic contact with them to mitigate challenges and to look for opportunities to improve our operations
• Work directly with Senior Management to help develop our business strategy and to achieve the best possible results.
• Maintain close contacts with other Managers in the region to share best practices

All you'll need for success

Minimum Qualifications- Education & Prior Job Experience
• Bachelor’s degree
• Experience in strategy or relationship management role
• Strong analytical skills, able to look at look at various reports, understand changing trends and the implications that has on our partners and customers.
• Project management skills, able to plan, track and execute complex initiatives across multiple teams/stakeholders
• Self-motivated, detail oriented and able to deliver results with minimal supervision. Able to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. Able to communicate effectively with senior leadership.
• Ability to adapt quickly, manage priorities and expectations of multiple stakeholders at different levels in the organization.
• Ability to influence and motivate others at all levels of the organization, successfully build and manage relationships with stakeholders and colleagues, and work in a matrix environment across functional areas.

Preferred Qualifications- Education & Prior Job Experience
• Experience in strategy or relationship management role

Feel free to be yourself at American

From the team members we hire to the customers we serve, inclusion and diversity are the foundation of the dynamic workforce at American Airlines. Our 20+ Employee Business Resource Groups are focused on connecting our team members to our customers, suppliers, communities and shareholders, helping team members reach their full potential and creating an inclusive work environment to meet and exceed the needs of our diverse world.

Are you ready to feel a tremendous sense of pride and satisfaction as you do your part to keep the largest airline in the world running smoothly as we care for people on life’s journey? Feel free to be yourself at American.

All applicants must have the legal right to work and live in the country.

job_description:
Sales Managerneeded immediately in the Valparaiso, Indiana market We are the fastest growing acrylic bath remodeling company and we need someone who can recruit, hire and train a team of Sales Reps. Jacksons Home Improvement / Luxury Bath Technologies is a multi-million dollar bath remodeling company.
• *Based on current volume and pay structure aSales Manager has the ability to make $100,000and up per year.**

You will be working with individuals who have a passion for exceeding the customer's expectation. We're not just another Home Improvement Contractor,we are known in the community as a company with the highest standards of work and an undisputed reputation for Customer Service.

THE "PROFILE" OF THE IDEAL CANDIDATE

The individual we are looking for is NOT the typical salesperson most people think of. We have found that our customers want to buy our products and services but don't like being "sold." So, rather than a "pushy" salesperson, we need someone who asks questions, listens to the homeowner, determines their needs, offers options for them to choose from and closes the deal.

ABOUT YOUR MANAGER

You will be working directly with the owner of the company, an individual who is committed to your success. She/he is responsible for your training and ongoing development. She/he is not a micro-manager; she/he expects that you will work independently on your own but is always available to provide backup and support when needed.

SCHEDULE

We will schedule sales calls based upon your availability whenever possible. If you want appointments at night so you can take care of your needs during the day, we will work with you as much as we can. Sometimes you may need to meet with a homeowner on a Saturday morning.

ATTRIBUTES NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL
• Customer focused.
• Coachable -- trainable.
• Persistent and tenacious.
• Results oriented -- goal driven.
• Able to relate to different personality styles.
• Responsible and accountable for personal results.
• Capable of handling multiple tasks simultaneously.
• Works successfully without requiring close supervision.

REQUIREMENTS
• 3 years sales experience in remodeling industry.
• Bath remodeling experience a plus.
• Professional appearance and demeanor.
• Excellent computer skills -- MS Office, database management, etc.
• Be willing to undergo a background check and drug screen, in accordance with local law/regulations.

Benefits:
• Medial Insurance
• Paid Vacation
• 401 (k)
