job_description:
Assistant Director Of Sales - Urgent - With Growth Opportunities Assistant Director Of Sales - Urgent - With Growth Opportunities

We are on the lookout for a persistent Assistant Director Of Sales - Urgent to join our elite team at Hotel Mandarine Regency in Santiago.
Growing your career as a Full Time Assistant Director Of Sales - Urgent is an exceptional opportunity to develop valuable skills.
If you are strong in cooperation, critical thinking and have the right talent for the job, then apply for the position of Assistant Director Of Sales - Urgent at Hotel Mandarine Regency today
We are looking to hire a strategic Assistant Director of Sales to join our passionate team at Hotel Mandarine Regency in Santiago.
Growing your career as a Full Time Assistant Director of Sales is an incredible opportunity to develop fundamental skills.
If you are strong in time management, decision-making and have the right aptitude for the job, then apply for the position of Assistant Director of Sales at Hotel Mandarine Regency today
Position: Assistant Director of Sales (Full time #535807)
Property / Office: Mandarin Oriental, Santiago
Location: Santiago, Chile
As an Assistant Director of Sales at Mandarin Oriental, your role would involve supporting the Director of Sales in managing and driving the hotel's sales efforts to achieve revenue targets.
Sales Strategy: Collaborate with the Director of Sales to develop and implement sales strategies to maximize revenue generation. Analyze market trends, customer demands, and competitor activities to identify sales opportunities and ensure the hotel remains competitive.
Business Development: Identify new business opportunities and cultivate relationships with corporate clients, travel agencies, event planners, and other potential revenue sources. Attend industry events, trade shows, and networking functions to expand the hotel's customer base.
Sales Team Management: Support the Director of Sales in managing the sales team, including setting sales targets, conducting performance evaluations, and providing training and coaching. Foster a high-performance culture, promote teamwork, and motivate the sales team to achieve their goals.
Key Account Management: Develop and maintain relationships with key accounts and manage their contractual agreements. Collaborate with the sales team to ensure excellent customer service and meet clients' needs and expectations.
Sales Collateral and Presentations: Assist in creating sales collateral, including brochures, presentations, and sales kits. Support the sales team in preparing and delivering persuasive sales presentations to potential clients.
Revenue Optimization: Work closely with revenue management and reservations teams to optimize room inventory, pricing strategies, and revenue potential. Monitor booking patterns, occupancy levels, and market demand to make data-driven decisions and maximize revenue opportunities.
Sales Reporting and Analysis: Prepare regular sales reports, including sales performance, market analysis, and revenue forecasts. Analyze sales data to identify trends, assess the effectiveness of sales strategies, and recommend improvements.
Cross-Departmental Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments, such as marketing, operations, and finance, to ensure alignment and integration of sales efforts. Coordinate with operational teams to ensure seamless execution of group bookings and events.
Client Relationship Management: Maintain excellent relationships with existing clients, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and repeat business. Address client feedback and concerns promptly and effectively, working towards solutions that enhance guest experiences.
Market Research: Stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and market developments. Conduct market research to identify emerging market segments, customer preferences, and sales opportunities.
Please note that the specific responsibilities may vary depending on the size of the property, location, and organizational structure.

Applications close: 17 Aug 2023 Pacific SA Standard Time

We create possibilities that move life and commerce forward. Welcome to Manhattan Associates. Our supply chain commerce technology positively affects how people on six continents work, shop and live. job_description:
Descripción empresa:

Somos más de 90 mil personas que, día a día, dedicamos nuestra pasión y energía a cumplir nuestro Propósito de “Simplificar y Disfrutar Más la Vida”. Propósito que hoy vive a través de nuestro ecosistema físico y digital en todas nuestras empresas (Falabella Retail, Sodimac, IKEA, Tottus, Mallplaza, Falabella Inmobiliario, Falabella.com, Linio, Falabella Financiero, Banco Falabella, Falabella Soriana, Seguros Falabella, Fazil, Fpay y Falabella Corporativo) y países (Argentina, Brasil, Chile, China, Colombia, India, México, Perú y Uruguay).

Valoramos las distintas miradas porque entendemos que la diversidad es la clave de nuestra innovación. Queremos ir más allá de cualquier límite, desafiarnos constantemente, divertirnos haciendo lo que nos gusta y dejar huella en lo que hacemos. Y sabemos que existe una forma de hacerlo: como UN SOLO EQUIPO.

Conoce más oportunidades para vivir la #ExperienciaFalabella en https://muevete.falabella.com/

Misión del cargo:

Tu misión será convertir el mall en la mejor propuesta de la zona de influencia, generando valor a los clientes y tiendas.

Funciones del cargo:

En Mallplaza buscamos a nuestro/a próximo/a Subgerente de Mall para sumarse a la Gerencia División Chile.

¿Qué desafíos encontrarás en esta posición?

1. Liderarás la operatividad y funcionamiento de Mallplaza Bío Bío, entregando a la comunidad y a sus visitantes experiencias de valor que incrementen los niveles de recomendación y de lealtad.

2. Serás responsable de aumentar las ventas y el relacionamiento con retailers.

3. Generarás iniciativas para aumentar indicadores de gestión y de satisfacción.

4. Gestionarás indicadores de negocio, clientes y retailers; con foco en la venta y comunicación al operador a través de la omnicanalidad del negocio, desde un punto de vista digital, de modo de obtener el cumplimiento de indicadores proyectados.

5. Articularás todas las iniciativas y requerimientos del centro comercial, hacia los equipos de Casa Matriz, velando por los resultados de negocio del mall.

Si te sumas al desafío disfrutarás de:
• 5 días libres para que disfrutes de la vida
• Bono de desempeño anual
• Acceso a cursos a través de nuestra plataforma de aprendizaje
• Programas de estudios y becas
• Beneficios de salud para ti y tu familia

En Mallplaza valoramos lo que diferencia a cada una de las personas y sus talentos, movilizando nuestra cultura hacia equipos diversos e inclusivos. Todas nuestras vacantes invitan a participar a todos/as de manera inclusiva. ¡Te invitamos a sumarte a este gran equipo!

Requisitos:

Estar titulado/a de Ingeniería Comercial, Ingeniería Civil Industria o carrera afín

Tener entre 3 y 5 años de experiencia laboral

Deseable que tengas experiencia anterior en empresas del rubro

Experiencia anterior manejando equipos

Condiciones oferta:

Axity, Somos una compañía con más de 35 años de trayectoria nuestro portafolio de servicios es uno de los más grandes en la industria: Estrategia Digital, Desarrollo de Software, Bussiness Intelligence, Big Data, Analítica Avanzada, Seguridad, IOT.

Buscamos un Jefe de Proyectos TI

Funciones:
El profesional en este cargo será levantar información sobre requerimientos de desarrollo de software dentro de la Institución, liderar el desarrollo e implementar aplicativos de software, cumplir rol de contraparte técnico en proyectos de software externo y llevar a cabo todo el ciclo de vida de un proyecto (Inicio, análisis, Desarrollo, Pruebas, Puesta en producción), además de coordinación con el usuario final, ser un puente comunicacional entre el negocio y el equipo técnico, diseño del solución requerida, levantamiento de backlog, controlar los tiempos y cumplimiento de los objetivos del equipo de trabajo, reportar a través de presentaciones de avance de proyectos, conocimiento para el control y gestión de riegos y problemas, velar por el control y cumplimiento de alcance y calidad.

Requisitos:
Ingeniería Civil informática / Ingeniería en ejecución informática, con al menos 4 años de experiencia laboral
Conocimientos en modelamiento de procesos.
Experiencia en metodología ágil con células de trabajo
Certificación Scrum (Deseable)
Conocimientos Javascript Angular (Deseable)

Se ofrece:
Modalidad presencial Santiago
Contrato fijo 7 meses
.

-Requerimientos- Educación mínima: Técnico
2 años de experiencia
Palabras clave: lider, jefe, gerente, manager, director, chief, lead, jefatura, regente, project

job_details.experience: 4 years of work experience, experience in process modeling, experience in agile methodology with work cells, certification in Scrum, knowledge of Javascript Angular.

job_description:
Community Management Director page is loadedCommunity Management Director
Apply locations FL -
West Florida Division Office: 551 N. Cattlemen Rd. Suite 200 Sarasota, FL 34232 time type Full time posted on Posted 3 Days Ago job requisition id R0010992Job Description Summary

As a Community Management Director working for Taylor Morrison you will manage and engage the HOA and homeowners in a way that builds brand awareness and loyalty.
Job Details
We trust that as a Community Management Director you will: (responsibilities)
Supervise all interaction with customers and all on-site and offsite management companies, association managers, activities directors, gate attendants, arc boards, vendors and suppliers personnel
Ensure proper staff training, supervision and follow through is being executed by management companies
Supervise management companies with all staff evaluations and development programs
Supervise facilities access and security protocol for residents and homebuilding sales agents
Supervise community customer program and facilities surveys
Manage 6 HOA communities (Active Adult and the other 3 are highly amenitized)
Manage the different lakes and parks within the communities
Manage budget for all communities
Manage Direct Reports (Community Management Admins)
Respond to all customer complaints and coordinate with TM Corporate customer service department to resolve outstanding concerns
Facilitate specific customer service seminars for residents
Supervise customer complaint log to ensure proper resolution to all complaints are resolved in the timeframe expectations set by the division
Manage the creation and supervision of community structures including master and sub homeowner associations, maintenance free designations, community development districts and condominium and common associations
Assist with the operation of Community Development Districts and act as a liaison and board member
Supervise and develop the processes that will improve consistent communication flow to our customers and management companies including but not limited to community news letters, event calendars and web-sites
Meeting facilitator and speaker for all association meetings including quarterly meetings, budget meetings, committee meetings, public presentation meetings, annual meetings and turnover
Manage the preparation, establishment and operation of Homeowner, condominium and commercial associations and act as a liaison and board member
Supervise the establishment and execution of association guidelines and agreements
Supervise management companies to ensure a focus is kept on trouble shooting in areas such as rental properties, for sale signs, poor lawn maintenance, fining committees for deed restriction compliance, and past due assessment collection
Ensure proper maintenance, housekeeping and service standards are being executed by management companies including golf courses, restaurants, pools, club and fitness facilities
Assist with facility remodel and/or expansions
Coordination with appropriate homebuilding field, administration and sales associates on community needs or requests
Attend weekly homebuilding customer service meetings
Responsible for maintaining all necessary community management schedules to ensure timely service in collaboration with the Division goals
Responsible for providing direction to Division and management companies in developing and managing community budgets
Responsible for providing direction to Division to develop additional purchasing controls to improve on the quality of our association funding including management company approval limits, clumping of services and material purchasing
Monthly analysis and review of community homeowner/condominium associations and CDD financial statements
Provide recommendations to senior management with regards to improving financial conditions
Coordinate with Acquisition, Purchasing and Accounting department on development Performa's and forecasts
Coordinate with Acquisition Department on due diligence reports for potential acquisitions
Coordinate with Finance and Accounting Department with bank financing, bond issuance, loans and partner funding
Assist in preparation and execution with Finance, Accounting and Acquisition Department with Division and community Asset Management Plan
Assist with researching market competition and conditions specifically for association/CDD fees and assessments
Help coordinate with bond underwriters and Real Estate Marketing Consultants
You are willing to perform other duties as assigned What you will need: (competencies, behaviors & attributes)
Business Acumen
Customer Focus
Developing Direct Reports and Others
Drive for Results
Priority Setting

Self-Knowledge About you:
Bachelor's degree in Business or related field or meet the minimum requirement for number of years direct experience
Minimum five years of experience in homebuilding
Ability to anticipate possible obstacles and propose favorable solutions
Strong work ethic and commitment to implementation and execution
Concise writing and public speaking/presentation skills are desirable
Strong computer skills
Strong negotiating skills
Attention to detail
Proven track record of leadership FLSA Status: Exempt
Will have responsibilities such as:
Interviewing, selecting, and training employees;
Setting rates of pay and hours of work;
Appraising productivity; handling employee grievances or complaints, or disciplining employees;
Determining work techniques;
Planning the work;
Apportioning work among employees;
Determining the types of equipment to be used in performing work, or materials needed;
Planning budgets for work;
Monitoring work for legal or regulatory compliance;
Providing for safety and security of the workplace

Essential Functions:
Successful job applicants will be able to perform these functions. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Report to Division/Corporate Office/Community daily and adhere to schedule
Ability to oversee direct reports daily and provide guidance as needed
Ability to access, input, and retrieve information from a computer and/or electronic device
Ability to have face to face conversations with customers, co-workers and higher level manager
Ability to sit or stand for long periods of time and move around work environment as needed
Ability to operate a motor vehicle
Comply with company policies and procedure

Physical Demands:
Must be able to able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time

The ability to frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds *Taylor Morrison experience and/or successful completion of training program may override required education and/or experience requirement.

Job descriptions are not intended as, nor should be construed to be, exhaustive lists of all responsibilities, skills, efforts, or working conditions associated with a job.

They are intended to be accurate reflections of those principal job duties and responsibilities essential for making fair pay decisions about the job.
Benefits of Working With Taylor Morrison

We are looking for dedicated professionals that share our values of putting the customer - and their needs - first.
In addition to a great team atmosphere, career development and advancement opportunities, we offer full-time employees an extensive benefits package, to include:

Competitive Compensation
Health Care - Medical/Dental/Vision/Prescription Drug Coverage
401(k) with Company Matching Contributions
Flexible Spending Accounts
Disability Programs
Employee & Dependent Life Insurance
Vacation & Company Holidays
Tuition Reimbursement
Employee Home Purchase Rebate Program
Home Mortgage Program
Employee Assistance Program (EAP) About Us Welcome to the Taylor Morrison, Inc. Career Portal
In order to be the best in the industry, you have to surround yourself with the best people.

At Taylor Morrison, Inc., we are committed to being the best North American homebuilder as measured by our employees, customers, shareholders, and business partners.
Headquartered in Scottsdale, Arizona, Taylor Morrison Home Corporation operates in the U.S. under the Taylor Morrison and Darling Homes brands.

Taylor Morrison is a builder and developer of single-family detached and attached homes serving a wide array of customers including first-time, move-up, luxury, and active adult customers.
Taylor Morrison divisions operate in Arizona, California, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, North Carolina and Texas. Darling Homes serves move-up and luxury homebuyers in Texas.

In addition, Taylor Morrison also offers home financing though Taylor Morrison Home Funding, providing professional and knowledgeable home mortgage options.
Taylor Morrison, Inc. is always looking for dedicated professionals who share our values. Please use our Career Portal to view current job openings and apply for positions online.
Thank you for considering a career with Taylor Morrison, Inc.

job_description:
Importante grupo multinacional dedicado a la fabricación y comercialización de calzado en todo el mundo, se encuentra en la búsqueda de de un SubGerente de Operaciones TI que se encuentre motivado para aprender y desarrollar sus habilidades laborales.

¿Cuál será tu misión?
- Liderar el área de operaciones y tecnología para el correcto desarrollo y funcionamiento del negocio de la empresa, así como el soporte a la operación en matriz y los diferentes canales.
- Gestionar el correcto funcionamiento de la infraestructura y telecomunicaciones de la compañía.

Responsable de realizar levantamiento y optimización de los procesos del negocio TI.
- Generar iniciativas innovadoras en el área de tecnología, velando al mismo tiempo por mantener los sistemas de las áreas de la organización.
- Administrar el presupuesto operacional y tecnológico de la compañía velando por seguir principios de austeridad.

¿Qué funciones harás?
1. Velar por el correcto funcionamiento de las diferentes plataformas tecnológicas en sus diferentes capas de infraestructura y telecomunicaciones.

2. Ser responsable del buen funcionamiento de los mecanismos de backup en todos los níveles de la infraestructura, sean estos servidores inhouse o datacenters externos.

3. Proponer, planificar y ejecutar proyectos de mejora en la infraestructura de la compañía.

4. Llevar registro de los activos tecnológicos de la compañía.

5. Definir el catálogo de servicios TI junto con los SLA y velar por su cumplimiento, sean estos SLA por servicios internos o externos.

6. Definir políticas de seguridad que permitan resguardar la compañía de riesgos informáticos, sean estas políticas, parches o planes de actualización, actividades de mantención preventivas, ejercicios de DRP, actividades de PenTesting, etc.

7. Proponer, implementar y revisar herramientas de monitoreo, que permitan tomar medidas preventivas o work-arround de recuperación de servicios en forma temprana.

8. Establecer y liderar el CAB (committee advisory board) para los pasos a producción de los distintos aplicativos de la empresa.

9. Gestionar la operación en tienda y matriz en actividades como, habilitación/reparación de enlaces de las nuevas tiendas, remodelaciones y la desinstalación de equipamiento cuando corresponda.

10. Gestionar los accesos y cuentas a los servicios e infraestructura tecnológica de la compañía resguardando el riesgo y los níveles de acceso de acuerdo a las buenas prácticas de seguridad informática.

11. Deber estar en constante capacitación, tanto formal como informal, del equipamiento y herramientas que tiene a cargo y de las tecnologías que se están liberando en el mercado.

12. Administrar políticas de seguridad informática de la compañía.

13. Implantar Planes de Recuperación ante Desastres y de alta disponibilidad.

14. Desempeñar otras funciones encomendadas por la jefatura dentro de su ámbito de especialidad.

¿Qué necesitas?
- Ser Universitario, licenciado/titulado del área de Informática, ingeniero industrial con mención en informática.
- Entre 7 a 10 años de experiência en el área de TI o consultoría, con liderazgo de áreas tecnológicas, infraestructura TI y Gestión de equipos.
- Tener conocimiento en algunos de los siguientes sistemas o herramientas: ERP Financiero / Supply Chain / Cadena de Producción/ CRM / RRHH / Call Centers / Loyalty / Business Intelligence / Merchandising / eCommerce.
- Inglés medio/avanzado, oral y escrito, No Excluyente.

job_description:
Destacada multinacional del rubro ingeniería y consultoría, con presencia en 70 países alrededor del mundo y varios proyectos funcionando a nivel nacional, se encuentra en búsqueda de personas que quieran formar parte de nuestro equipo.

Ofrecemos un grato ambiente laboral, donde podrás desarrollarte y crecer de forma permanente, y además un espacio de cercanía y colaboración.

En esta oportunidad nos encontramos en la búsqueda de Gerente para el área de Infraestructura con titulo de Ingeniero Civil o Ingeniero Civil Industrial, debe contar con 4 años en cargos como administrador de contratos o 2 años como gerente de contratos o similar.

• Responsable de la definición e implementación de la planificación estratégica, junto al Gerente General, para lograr el crecimiento sustentable y diversificación del área de Gestión de Contratos.
• Definir junto al Gerente General la estrategia de la Compañía en el área de Gestión de Contratos.
• Responsable de la gestión comercial y financiera, como de la calidad de los servicios técnicos producidos por el área de Gestión de Contratos, tanto en el sector público como en el sector privado y de las relaciones con los clientes correspondientes.

job_description:
Site Manager
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

Lead all on-site activities of medium to large project to assure cost-effective execution of project deliverables in accordance with contract specifications, quality standards, schedule, and safety requirements during the start-up, construction and/or erection, commissioning, maintenance phases in accordance with the established processes. Ensures compliance with relevant cyber security regulations, standards, and contractual requirements.
This position reports to

Service Operations Manager
Your responsibilities
• Direct all on-site activities of a project or service to ensure execution in accordance with contract specifications, quality standards, schedule and safety requirements during maintenance.
• On-site planning.
• Manages the sub-contractors on site hired by ABB to ensure necessary quality and progress achieved to meet delivery date and agreed standards and to the required HSE requirements.
• Coordination and supervision of works.
• Stakeholder relations.
• Ensures continuous and detailed update about progress is provided to Planning and Control function for schedule update and tracking of progress, cost, and resources.
• Health, Safety and Environment (HSE) and project safety.
• Coordination and handling of materials on site.
• Documentation and subcontractor management.
• Leadership and people development.

Your background
• Bachelor´s Degree in Executive or Civil engineering.
• 5 or more years of experience in field project management, engineering, commissioning and start-up of specialized systems and maintenance.
• Knowledge of MS Project/Primavera and ERP SAP
• Availability to travel within Chile.
• Good communication skills. Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical people.
• Intermediate level of English and native Spanish.

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

job_description:
To deliver on its long-term vision, Flix will invest in both its train and bus services to continue the strong growth journey.
The next milestone of FlixBus' global expansion will be the launch of operations in Chile in 2023.

After Brazil, Chile will be the second FlixBus market in South America and the world's 41st country with green long-distance buses on the roads.

For the upcoming years, we expect further growth which is why we want to expand our strong, dynamic and ambitious international teams.
To support our ambitious growth, we are now looking for an enthusiastic Operations Manager. This position will be based in Santiago and starts as soon as possible.

Your Tasks - Paint the world green
• You build and nurture a strong and positive working relationship with our operators
• You manage the daytoday interaction with our operators to ensure there is no disruption
• You monitor our operators' quality performance and work to continuously be improving it
• You work cooperatively with our operators to ensure that their information on our platform is updated
• You track that our operators have trained all their drivers
• You will monitor that operators adhere to our processes and standards and you will carry out audits with operators to ensure they follow safety standards
• You support our operators to familiarise with our training content for drivers
• You build and nurture a strong relationship with the bus stations we serve
• You align and implement changes to our timetables with the bus stations
• You are responsible for an external mystery shopping provider doing checks at our stations
• You are responsible for our station agents team providing excellent service on a daytoday basis. This includes making sure they have all the tools and training required
• You identify risks that can disrupt our operations and find solutions to them
• You work closely with the rest of the team in analysing our data and processes. We will constantly be challenging the status quo and strive to improve
• You will gather feedback from our external stakeholders (operators, stations, agents) and propose improvements based on this
Your Profile - Ready to hop on board
• Proven experience from a top strategy consulting firm, hyper growth startup or top local mobility related companies in a similar role
• Degree in business, engineering or a related field
• Passion for building businesses
• Team player who enjoys succeeding together
• Adaptable and creative problem solver
• Seeks challenges and loves learning
• High attention to details
• Relentless strive for excellence
• Occasional travelling
• Fluent in English
Our Perks - More than just a job

job_description:
About the Role

This is an opportunity to work with a stellar operations team on strategic projects that are at the core of Uber operations. The ideal candidate should have a combination of creative problem solving, detail orientation, and interpersonal ability to manage internal stakeholders. Are you ready to launch your career? Keep reading.

What You'll Do
• Be the operational glue that holds together major team efforts for large and strategic projects, initiatives and product deployments, helping Operations Team to meet profitability goals
• Support the Uber team through defining precise actions on the city and region-wide projects with an expansion and implementation focus - You'll see the immediate impact of your decisions in the market
• Develop Strategic Insights - Take big picture ideas and break them into actionable steps to understand the marketplace the company is in and develop insights that will help us deliver our main projects
• Work closely with the operations teams to streamline processes by managing and working with different stakeholders in order to set initiatives, campaigns, budgets, and projects along the region
• Be Resourceful and Take Initiative. Take ownership of Uber's growth in your city and do everything you can to support and enhance the quality of our services and products

What You'll Need
• Data-driven & analytical approach
• Hands-on orientation

• Problem Solving ability to solve business contingencies
• Bachelor's degree with 3+ years of experience in Finance, Consulting, Investment Banking, Business Intelligence or related fields.
• Professional proficiency in English and Spanish
• Experience with SQL or any other programming language it's strongly preferred but not exclusively required

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.

job_description:
Position: Group Sales Manager (Full time #532363)

Property / Office: Mandarin Oriental, Santiago

Location: Santiago, Chile

The Groups Sales Manager is responsible to quote for the Groups of assigned territory/ market/ industry. Group Sales Manager is responsible to execute segment strategy applicable to his/her responsibility. Furthermore, negotiation and maximization of all group business opportunities from respective market/ segments to meet objectives and contribute to overall hotel sales performance and strategy.

The Group Sales Manager reports directly to the Director of Sales.

Duties and responsibilities
• To evaluate, respond and negotiate all group leads within specified time limits (maximum of 24hrs response time) and to company best practices, to make sure all client needs are met, and the hotel is presented in the best possible terms to materialize group business.
• To establish and maintain effective working relations both within the department and with other departments.
• To attend selected functions and events indicated by Director of Commerce.
• Organize and conduct sales appointments / sales calls.
• Organize and conduct training sessions and presentations for clients.
• To be informed of any market information including changing market conditions and trends in competition. To review, analyze, adapt, and implement these findings with the Director of Commerce, potentially taking action to implement counteractions / programs together with the Sales team stay relevant in a very competitive market.
• To maintain and develop relationships with all key industry decision-makers such as DMCs/Corporate Events Manager/Travel Advisors, agencies and any party with Group potential.
• To organize, coordinate and conduct familiarization trips and hotel site inspections for the Group segment.
• To maximize sales activities to ensure occupancy, rate and yield objectives are achieved in accordance with group sales plan and goals.
• To achieve budgeted room nights and average group rate targets in keeping with the annual budget and sales plan for groups, tour series and incentive business.
• To effectively administrate and co-ordinate all group bedroom bookings until handover is made to the coordinator.
• To maximize sales for other hotel revenue generating departments (Food and Beverage, SPA, transportation, etc.).
• To effectively manage a portfolio of key accounts through planned sales activities, maximizing account potential in terms of rate and/or room-nights in accordance with overall and specific Group Sales strategies.
• To work in conjunction with Group Sales Coordinator to load in Delphi-SF (account profiles, new contacts, group quotations, group status, contract details, billing arrangements and deposit requirements, etc.) and make sure all data is accurate and updated.
• To maintain a high level of exposure for the hotel in the major marketing areas through direct sales solicitation, telephone, and written communications. Prospecting, focusing on new business developmet.
• To have full knowledge of overall hotel product and hotel’s primary competition.
• To work closely with MO Sales offices to be updated on market changes, share best practices, market intelligence, reports and revision of pipeline, follow up on existing and potential group business and ensure goals are achieved.
• To be informed of any upcoming projects or developments (estimated opening dates) of Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group.

Communication

Coordinate quarterly (or when needed) Group and hotel updates (news, offers, packages, etc.) to clients and partners.

To participate in partner’s and RSOs marketing activities such us; targeted newsletters and any other opportunities to penetrate your market.

Ensure all Group presentations, directories, capacity sheets, Cvent and other possible online RFP portals, are up to date.

Industry partners relationships
• Drive and build relationships with commercial related partners such as industry associations and other key industry players.
• Co-host events, exposure actions, and collaborations with the above organizations ensuring no preference is given to any supplier.

Reporting, Systems and Automated related activities
• To fully utilize Delphi - Salesforce and other MOHG standard computer software that is applicable, or systems that are applicable.
• To strictly follow Delphi Best practices.
• To ensure applicable reports are supplied, supervised and correct.
• To ensure all meetings with clients are logged in Salesforce (or applicable system in place) and accounts, contacts, bookings, and any client related activities are tracked and kept up to date.
• To run and keep Delphi reports up to date (lost business report, Account production, market segment, territory, and other relevant analysis).
• Work closely with team to ensure the Sales assigned target is met monthly, quarterly, and annually.
• Analyze and follow-up your market productions, current or future, decrease or potential based on reports.

Health and Safety

To be aware of, and comply with, safe working practices as laid down under the Health and Safety legislation and Company H & S Manual, as applicable to your place of work. This will include your awareness of any specific hazards at your workplace.
• To wear any appropriate protective clothing provided by or recommended by the Hotel.
• To report any defects in the building, plant, or equipment according to the Hotel procedures.
• To ensure any accidents to colleagues, guests or visitors are reported in accordance with hotel procedures.
• To attend any training deemed appropriate by the Company concerning Health & Safety.

Advertised: 04 Sep 2023 Pacific SA Daylight Time
Applications close: 04 Oct 2023 Pacific SA Daylight Time

del cumplimiento de los márgenes de acuerdo a los presupuestos de negocio;

de cumplir con el mix de venta de las diferentes unidades de negocio, de
acuerdo con el Budget;

de la generación, identificación, validación y calificación del pipeline que alimenta el ciclo comercial;

ejecutar los planes de negocio, planes de cuenta, manteniendo los indicadores de gestión comercial actualizados
en el CRM que corresponda;
• Liderar la
estrategia de negocios, implementando las políticas y prácticas de la compañía;
• Representar y
posicionar la empresa y sus soluciones; asegurando la calidad de la propuesta
de valor y la relación con los clientes finales;
• Elaborar plan de
negocios nacional, considerando los requerimientos de la operación, objetivos
estratégicos, indicadores clave para los clientes y el presupuesto;
• Desarrollar
relaciones con clientes clave y otros tomadores de decisiones;
• Asegurar el logro
de la rentabilidad, volumen de ventas y objetivos del mix de servicios;

procesos de venta de la empresa;

job_description:
En LATAM cuidamos que los sueños lleguen a su destino. ¿Quieres trabajar por este propósito?   

  Estamos en búsqueda de nuestro próxim@ LÍDER NEGOCIACIONES TI para la Gerencia Finanzas en Santiago de Chile, quién será el responsable principalmente del entendimiento de las oportunidades de mercado e internalización de estas oportunidades a través de nuevos socios, productos y condiciones comerciales.

En LATAM estamos comprometidos en brindar un lugar de trabajo en donde se respete la individualidad y se promueva la igualdad de oportunidades y el desarrollo de carrera. Este cargo admite postulaciones para personas en situación de discapacidad de acuerdo al marco de la Ley de Inclusión Laboral en Chile.

✍️¿Cuáles serían tus principales desafíos?
• Alinear con los equipos internos los procesos de negociación, entendiendo el servicio, su impacto en el ecosistema y la potencial optimización de estos y su estrategia comercial.
• Garantizar el debido proceso, cumpliendo las normativas de compliance en los RFPs y ser capaz de generar benchmarks entre los participantes.
• Alinear con legal los contratos.
• Definición de los indicadores de excelencia operacional en las dos principales actividades (disponibilidad y competitividad precio).
• Construcción y Cumplimiento de los calendarios de negociación.
• Cumplimiento de las SLAs de negociación y firma de contratos.

  ¿Qué necesitas para ser nuestro próxim@ Jefe?
• Ser profesional de las carreras de Ingeniero Civil Industrial, Ingeniero Comercial.
• Es indispensable que cuentes con al menos 3 años o más de experiencia en funciones similares.
• Si te manejas al derecho y al revés con Excel, ARIBA, conocimiento de TI ya estás un paso más adelante porque para esta posición ¡Es muy necesario!
• We need you to have an advanced level of English. If you understood this, we are on the right track.

  ¿Qué vas a encontrar cuando formes parte de LATAM?
• Serás parte de una industria atractiva, global y multicultural.
• Podrás conocer el mundo con nuestros beneficios de pasajes, Staff Travel.
• Te integrarás a un ambiente dinámico, con constantes cambios y desafíos.
• Tendrás amplias y múltiples opciones de desarrollo de carrera.
• Programa de Bienestar que incluye Club de Descuentos con diferentes proveedores, con precios especiales para trabajadores LATAM en varios productos y servicios, en distintas partes del mundo.

  ¿Dónde y cómo trabajarás?
• Lugar de trabajo: Santiago de Chile. Las Condes.
• Jornada: Completa.
• Tipo de contrato: Plazo fijo de 3 meses con posibilidad de renovación.
• Modalidad: Híbrida.

En caso de encontrarte en una situación de discapacidad, indica si necesitas algún requerimiento para presentarte.

¿Estás listo para sumarte y ayudarnos a cuidar que los sueños lleguen a su destino?

¡Postula!

job_description:
Technical Manager

Join an encouraging leadership group committed to your growth and development. Permanent role, based in Santiago de Chile, Chile. Please submit your resume in English.
About the role

Finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs. We are looking for a Technical Manager who will be accountable to deliver best practice technical leadership and deliver superior value. This is achieved through establishing and continuously improving technical systems, standards, processes, tools, and technologies, focused on managing risk, realizing improvement opportunities, and maximizing operational performance and, ultimately value of the business. The Technical Manager is a key role in influencing our JV partner to deliver superior value at the Escondida operation.

Our open, connected global team includes some of the industry's best and brightest minds. We offer competitive, performance-focused remuneration and many benefits to reward your contribution. With a global reach, the opportunities to develop and grow your career are broad and exciting. This role is an exceptional opportunity for a highly motivated, driven, and dynamic individual.

Reporting to the General Manager, Asset Technical and working in a challenging and exciting environment within the Copper Technical team, you will:
• Provide leadership and management of technical functions, Manager-level accountabilities within Copper Technical in terms of approvals, expenditures and budgets
• Identify, establish, and drive consistent and highly visible KPIs. Ensure robust review of capital projects.
• Identify high-value opportunities at the business.
• Identify and drive leading practice transfer.
• Establish collaboration engagements with owners' technical teams.
• Provide expert technical and operational advice and direction in the management of key strategic and technical risks and opportunities.
• Coordinate appropriate involvement and contribution with the business unit of technical discipline expertise from within copper and the broader Rio Tinto.
What you'll bring
• A commitment to the safety of yourself and your team.
• Bachelor's Degree in a relevant technical discipline. Postgraduate qualifications in economics, finance, or business would be well regarded.
• Minimum of 15 years' experience in mining operations and technical roles.
• English and Spanish language skills are required for this role.
• In-depth understanding of engineering and a track record of generating practical and innovative solutions to multi-faceted technical and/or operational problems.
• Experience in corporate improvement /business improvement programs and processes.
• Demonstrated capacity in setting strategy and operation at the strategic level.
• Understanding of mining business value drivers and operating plan evaluation.
• A track record of successfully managing challenging operations and technical project work.
• Broad experience covering:
• Planning processes, systems, and tools across all time horizons.
• Technical studies, concept to feasibility level.
• Thorough understanding and practical experience of mine economics and evaluation techniques.
• Good understanding of the mine value chain and interactions, including trade-off decisions and value creation.
• Promoting and driving the understanding of the interdependent relationships between geology, mining, and processing in terms of overall process and financial efficiency.

What we offer
• Be recognized for your contribution, your thinking, and your hard work, and go home knowing you've helped the world progress.
• A work environment where safety is always the number one priority.
• A competitive salary package with annual incentive awards for eligible employees.
• Career development & education assistance to further your ambitions.
• Access top tier family-friendly health and medical programs and pension plan.
• Wellbeing benefits.
• Generous Rio Tinto employee share program.
• Employee Assistance Program.
• Ongoing individual well-being support for you and your family for personal and professional matters.
• Leave for all of life's reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave).
About Rio Tinto

Rio Tinto is a leading global mining and materials company. We operate in 35 countries where we produce iron ore, copper, aluminum, critical minerals, and other materials needed for the global energy transition and for people, communities, and nations to thrive. We have been mining for 150 years and operate with knowledge built up across generations and continents. Our purpose is finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs – striving for innovation and continuous improvement to produce materials with low emissions and the right environmental, social, and governance standards. But we can't do it alone, so we're focused on creating partnerships to solve problems, create win-win and meet opportunities.
Every Voice Matters

At Rio Tinto, we welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, women, the LGBTQIA2 community, mature workers, people with disabilities, and people from different cultural backgrounds. We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable being themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, or anything else that makes us different.

¿Eres una persona apasionada por las ventas y los desafíos comerciales? ¿Te gustaría formar parte de una empresa líder en servicios de calidad de vida?

Esta oportunidad es para ti, buscamos Subgerente(a) Comercial.

¿Quiénes somos? Una multinacional francesa que está presente en más de 53 países. Somos lideres en Servicios de Calidad de Vida, atendemos a más de 100 millones de consumidores todos los días a través de nuestra combinación única de servicios, alimentación, facility management entre otros.

¿Cuál será tu rol?

Responsable de desarrollar y ejecutar estrategias de ventas para alcanzar los objetivos comerciales. Buscando nuevas oportunidades de negocio, con el fin de aumentar los ingresos y maximizar la rentabilidad

¿Qué harás en esta posición?

-Prospectar y captar nuevos clientes, identificando oportunidades de negocio en el mercado.

-Analizar de manera continua el mercado y las tendencias para adaptar las estrategias comerciales.

-Trabajar colaborativamente con otros departamentos de la compañía, como legal, compras, RRHH, para ofrecer una experiencia integral al cliente.

-Asegurar una venta efectiva y rentable, presentando y negociando propuestas comerciales de manera exitosa.

-Cumplir con la política comercial establecida por la empresa.

-Mantener actualizadas las herramientas del pipeline de ventas y utilizarlas de manera efectiva.

Modalidad de trabajo híbrido, en Región metropolitana

Si te gustan los desafíos y quieres continuar tu desarrollo profesional en el área comercial, esta es tu oportunidad

Buscamos a los mejores talentos para incorporarse a nuestra compañía independiente del género, orientación sexual, situación de discapacidad, nacionalidad, edad, cultura y origen.

Requisitos:

Requisitos:

-Experiencia previa en roles comerciales, especialmente en la prospección de nuevos clientes.

-Habilidades analíticas para analizar el mercado y adaptar las estrategias comerciales

-Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y colaborar efectivamente con otros departamentos de la compañía.

-Habilidades sólidas de negociación y capacidad para cerrar acuerdos comerciales rentables.

-Orientación al logro de resultados y capacidad para trabajar bajo presión.

-Conocimiento actualizado de las mejores prácticas en ventas y herramientas de pipeline.

Title:
Program Manager

Location:
Merritt Island, FL

Term:
Full Time

Program:

KSC

Job Summary:

Centuria is seeking a qualified individual skilled in planning and managing the technical design, development, construction and delivery of information technology solutions for the NASA ITSS-III program.
We are seeking an individual who is extremely knowledgeable and experienced in leading information technology operations programs.

This individual will be responsible for all programmatic, personnel and contractual executions in direct support of the effort and should have demonstrated experience in managing IT services contracts (annual value of $5M per year) for the Federal government.
Facilitates technical and contractual implementation issues with customers to ensure conformance to customer requirements.

Provide expert leadership, guidance, and supervision to less experienced personnel in regards to forecasting, tracking, and executing project - related tasks, budgets, and resource allocations.
Manages all sub-contractor organizations in the execution of their taskings and efforts.

As a Program Manager, your focus will be defining and delivering quality project approaches, plans and results and facilitating technical and contractual implementation issues with customers to ensure conformance to customer expectations.

You will serve as the primary customer business and technical point of contact and work proactively to resolve business and technical issues.
You will demonstrate excellent oral and written communications skills and be skilled at customer presentations

Responsibilities:

Develop budgets and scheduling staff across multiple, simultaneous efforts
Ensures that program execution properly meets the requirements of the contract and develops policies and procedures to adjust program activities for customer satisfaction
Manage large scale projects as a Prime within the Government space that involves over 100+ staff and multiple sub-contractors
Have the ability to take highly technical information and translate it to understandable terms and examples.
Empower team to be fully functional and productive by working in close cooperation across roles and functions, internal and external to the technology team
Review and recommend solutions to remove barriers to incremental progress and shield the team from external interference
Promote continuous improvement by frequent operational interactions and assessments
Responsible for on-time development and delivery of all Program related deliverables
Strong verbal and written communications skills
Develop new business within the existing program
Manage shared resources, budgets, time estimates and scheduling
Perform project quality reviews
Resolve conflicts between government clients, Centuria team and sub-contractors
Report status to customers and sponsors
Develop and deliver proposals in response to US Government Task Orders
Excellent leadership, communication and interpersonal skills

Job Requirments:

At least fifteen years of progressively responsible IT consulting experience including costing, planning, and execution.
In addition, individual should have eight years managing medium professional IT services engagements, including Federal program management experience.
Demonstrable experience in writing business/project plans, technical documents, presentations and proposals required.
Individual must have high degree of skills with the MS Office toolsets.
A high degree of interpersonal skill in working with various levels of technical and business-oriented individuals is required.
Prior experience in a government consulting services environment is preferred.

Education:

Bachelor's degree is required. Degree in a Business Management or MIS related field is preferred.

Certifications:

PMP certification is preferred.

Security Clearance:

Must be able to maintain a NASA public trust clearance

Director, IT Strategy Consulting,

About the role:
Gartner's Consulting business is anextensionof Gartner's industry-leading IT Research.

From CIOs, to leaders in business and government, we help Gartner clients across enterprises translate insights into transformational actions and achieve their mission-critical priorities.
Leveraging the breadth of Gartner's resources, Consulting is growing rapidly, with unlimited potential to continue expanding our client base.
Technology Strategy Consulting. We help the C-suite make the right decisions based on how technology can transform their businesses.

In today's world, a consulting firm that is "born digital", (with the ability to directly leverage the full power of Gartner's research and insights) has relevance to the most important strategic decisions any business will make.
We deliver value to clients in areas such as IT Strategy Consulting, Benchmarking, Analytics and Optimization.

Typically, this helps Gartner's clients to execute on their strategic priorities, across all sectors, including:

Digital Acceleration and Transformation
Enterprise Enablement Big Data and Analytics Applications Rationalization Cloud Strategy Sourcing and Ecosystem Optimization Contract and Cost Optimization Security and Risk Management What you'll do:
Our Consulting Associate Directors are responsible for high-level project delivery and oversight along with client relationship management.

You will manage teams and advise clients at the highest strategic level on both big-picture and tactical matters, focusing on how technology enables a wide range of business outcomes.

What you'll need:

Experience within a well-regarded management consultancy in a project delivery and sales capacity Prior experience in a problem-solving capacity such as a solution/technical architect or analyst preferred Experience working with multiple IT solutions Experience working with State and Local Government clients in Florida, role will be based in Tallahassee A consistent track record of leading people and building high-performing teams that leverage technology to drive the mission-critical priorities of commercial or government entities An ability to inspire and motivate professionals from both technical and non-technical backgrounds towards a common goal An unwavering commitment to the success of your team, and willingness to provide constructive/ corrective action when needed Demonstrated intellectual curiosity and the creative development of solutions and strategies to solve client problems.
Must adapt Gartner frameworks and methodologies to strike at the heart of a client's most pressing business challenges An ability to be hands-on and to manage multiple client priorities simultaneously MBA or other advanced degree preferred Comfortable influencing and building trust-based, value-added relationships with senior executives Coachable and embracing of best practices and feedback as a means of continuous improvement A consistently high achiever marked by perseverance, humility and a positive outlook in the face of challenges #LI-CW6
Who are we?
Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization's mission-critical priorities.

We've grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger—as individuals, as communities and as an organization. That's why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year.

We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World's Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index.

Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1.

When you join our team, you'll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well.
These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities.

Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.

Compañía multinacional del sector de servicios busca contratar a Subgerente de Nuevos negocios, para liderar nueva área, la cual se enfocará en el desarrollo de nuevas estrategias y proyectos para el crecimiento y sostenibilidad de la compañía en el mercado.

Algunas de las funciones de este profesional serán:
• Evaluación del negocio actual de la compañía en Chile, y su posicionamiento a mediano y largo plazo.
• Identificación continua de oportunidades de negocio en el mercado con foco en el desarrollo de nuevas estrategias y posicionamiento de la marca a través de canales físicos y online.
• Coordinación transversal de las diferentes áreas de la compañía, para la evaluación (factibilidad, rentabilidad, etc.), desarrollo e implementación de los proyectos de negocio.
• Definición de estrategias y plan comercial para los proyectos a desarrollar, basándose en un enfoque de transformación hacia el mundo digital.

Requisitos para esta posición:
• Entre 8 y 10 años de experiencia laboral en áreas comerciales
• Experiencia en cargos de desarrollo de nuevos negocios (Nuevas unidades, líneas de producto, etc.)
• Liderazgo o participación en proyectos de transformación digital, relacionándose de manera transversal con las diferentes áreas de la compañía

job_description:
Sobre nuestro cliente

Importante empresa de servicios.

Descripción
• Controlar y gestionar las políticas de la compañía con foco en la gestión eficiente de los recursos
• Administrar, gestionar y controlar de manera óptima los recursos físicos, contables de la organización, con foco en la disminución de costos y/o gastos, a modo de dar cumplimiento con la estrategia y presupuesto de la compañía.
• Asesorar a los Gerentes de líneas de negocios en materias de gestión administrativa, como seguros, contratos, tributarios, contables u otros según se requiera; a modo de entregar información de calidad y confiable que facilite la toma de decisiones por parte de los involucrados.
• Velar por el óptimo funcionamiento de las oficinas a nivel nacional en materia de infraestructura, fin garantizar que se cumplan con los estándares y necesidades higiénicas de los establecimientos.
• Hacer cumplir sus políticas, normas y procedimientos, con fuerte foco en la minimización de costos, control, negociación con proveedores, gestión de pagos, oportunidad y rentabilidad, a modo de garantizar un óptimo funcionamiento de las líneas de negocios y áreas de soporte.
• Dirigir y controlar los activos asociados a seguros, verificando el funcionamiento de siniestros del grupo de empresas, pólizas, coberturas, aseguramiento de contratos u otros; con foco en la búsqueda de mejores opciones en coberturas y costos.
• Dirigir, controlar y garantizar que los estados financieros mensuales de la sociedad se encuentren al día en los plazos establecidos y de acuerdo con la normas contables y laborales vigentes.
• Liderar la gestión presupuestaria del área de administración, verificando que el presupuesto se cumpla de manera óptima, identificando a tiempo los cambios necesarios para no afectar la liquidez de la empresa.
• Liderar los procesos de facturación, llevando un exhaustivo control que permita identificar oportunamente incobrables y así materializar las acciones necesarias para su pronto pago.
• Entregar los reportes solicitados por Gerencia Corporativa de Administración, en tiempo y forma, mediante las herramientas y plataformas disponibles, a modo se puedan tomar decisiones de calidad y en forma oportuna.
• Dirigir, supervisar, controlar la calidad e integridad de los procesos contables de las unidades bajo su responsabilidad
• Comprobar y velar por la correcta aplicación de los principios y normas contables establecidas. Dando cuenta y participando activamente de las auditorías.
• Debe preparar las cuentas anuales, Balance, Estado de Resultados y Anexo o Memoria

Perfil buscado (Hombre / Mujer)

Formación Académica:
• Contador Auditor deseable Ingeniero Comercial.
• Deseable experiencia previa en empresas auditoras y/o consultoría.
• Experiencia de al menos 8 años en áreas de contabilidad y administración.
• Experiencia en herramientas de gestión de calidad y auditoría
• Manejo de normativa IFRS y/o GAAP, matrices de riesgo.
• Conocimiento de programas ERP, deseable SAP.

Conocimientos Técnicos:
• Conocimiento en Legislación Laboral vigente local.
• Conocimiento en normativa contable local.
• Conocimiento en Normas Internacionales de Información Financiera IFRS
• Conocimiento en procesos de auditoría.
• Experiencia práctica en elaboración de presupuestos.
• Dominio de software contable.

Qué ofrecemos

Trabajo 100% presencial, comuna de Valparaíso

Bono desempeño

Estabilidad laboral

Empresa Multinacional

job_description:
Overview

M365 Core builds the infrastructure, platforms, AI, and communications backbone for Microsoft 365. Our mission is to develop a modern, trusted platform that enables us and our partners to create performant productivity experiences centered on the individual or group.

As a Technical Program Manager within the M365 Core Engineering Organization, your role will be instrumental in driving service modernization improvements across the M365 Core platform and partner team services.

This role requires a high level of organizational agility with a focus on building relationships, unblocking teams, and creating measurable results as you drive program execution across multiple teams and organizations for several well-defined, high-impact technical initiatives.

Qualifications

Required Skills / Abilities :

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
- 5 to 7 years of experience in this role or an equivalent job function.
- Able to rapidly gain practical understanding of new complex technical areas.
- Able to quickly form trust relationships with many engineering and PM stakeholders tasked with delivering the engineering results for each initiative.
- Agile in collaborating and coordinating across many teams and partners at once.
- Patience and an ability to celebrate progress while constantly pushing for more.
- Skilled in data analysis using structured query languages like Kusto Query language (KQL) or SQL.
- Skilled in data preparation, presentation, and dashboards to track progress.

Responsibilities

Duties / Responsibilities :

- Apply the right amount process to help each project advance and to achieve clarity and alignment with stakeholders.
- Communicate the useful and pertinent program status, risks, and issues to stakeholders on a regular basis ensuring those teams are aligned with the latest engineering approach, objectives, and delivery deadlines.
- Drive resolution of blocking issues with stakeholders.
- Understand and be able to present current results, progress, and blockers on all initiatives in preparation for Monthly Engineering Reviews.
- Automate and reduce manual processes in tracking and reporting.

Benefits / perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Industry leading healthcareEducational resourcesDiscounts on products and servicesSavings and investmentsMaternity and paternity leaveGenerous time awayGiving programsOpportunities to network and connect

Somos más de 100 mil personas en 9 países distintos que cada día trabajamos como un equipo por simplificar y disfrutar más la vida. job_description:
Subgerente de Servicio a Clientes para empresa líder de servicios logísticos

Funciones a Realizar
• Definir e implementar el modelo de fidelización y satisfacción de clientes.
• Gestionar el relacionamiento con clientes, construyendo relaciones cercana y de confianza.
• Liderar proyectos de incorporación de nuevos clientes, hasta la estabilización del servicio.
• Liderar reuniones con clientes, para evaluar el servicio e identificar oportunidades de mejora.
• Definir junto a áreas internas planes para corregir desviaciones, monitoreando su implementación.
• Liderar proyectos cuya necesidad provengan de clientes: servicios, sistemas, interfaces, procesos.
• Diseñar e implementar soluciones para generar eficiencia y automatización de procesos a su cargo
• Supervisar los procesos y equipo a su cargo, implementando mecanismos para corregir desviaciones.
• Gestionar el desarrollo colaboradores con el fin de formar un equipo de alto desempeño.

Requisitos
• Ingeniero(a) Civil Industrial, comercial o equivalente con formación en habilidades directivas y negociación.
• 10 años de experiência, en empresas de servicios B2B, como Subgerente o Gerente (comercial, operaciones, procesos o servicio al cliente).
• Experiência en negociación: licitaciones, contratos, sindicatos u otros de gran envergadura.
• Experiência en dirección e implementación de proyectos: cambios de procesos, sistemas y cultura.
• Dominio inglés intermedio.

Tipo de puesto:
Tiempo completo

Salario:
$3.400.000 - $3.800.000 al mes

Pregunta(s) de postulación:
• Indica pretensiones de renta
• Indica tu experiência en el manejo de grandes contratos o licitaciones

Experiência:
• Operaciones o Servicio a Clientes: 10 años (Obligatorio)
- empresas B2B: 10 años (Obligatorio)

Sobre nuestro cliente

Nuestro cliente es una importante empresa Inmobiliaria con sólida trayectoria en el mercado nacional, con foco a desarrollo habitacional.

Descripción

Reportando directamente al Gerente Comercial sus principales responsabilidades son:
• Manejar los precios de venta UF/MT2 acorde a la oferta y demanda del sector donde se ubica el proyecto y a la situación de mercado.
• Manejar velocidad de venta y otros factores de cada proyecto e idear estrategias acordes para optimizar la ventas.
• Manejar estudios de mercado, indicadores e información analítica para determinar precios y otras variables relevantes respecto de la venta inmobiliaria.
• Manejar el área de ventas, los equipos de profesionales a su cargo y los puntos de ventas con los equipos asociadas.
• Cumplir con las metas comerciales y posicionamiento de marca en el mercado.
• Desarrollar informes semanales, quincenales o según sea requerido, con la información de mercado, ventas y otros, para la toma de decisiones acorde a cada proyecto en desarrollo.
• Manejar sistemas de CRM, sistemas de Venta y Programas Gráficos.
• Tener un foco proactivo y propositivo en relación a las problemáticas que se presenten en el cumplimiento de las metas comerciales, apuntando a cumplir con los objetivos mes/trimestrales y anuales.
• Tener un foco estratégico al desarrollo del rol y gestión del área.

Perfil buscado (Hombre / Mujer)

Ingeniero Comercial con al menos 7 años de experiencia en áreas comerciales inmobiliarias y con conocimientos generales en marketing, gestión comercial y venta inmobiliaria. Profesional proactivo, dinámico, con fuerte orientación al cumplimiento de metas, experiencia en venta inmobiliaria y en estrategias comerciales. Y con experinecia comprobada en manejo de equipos de fuerzas de venta en inmobiliarias relevantes de mercado.

Qué ofrecemos

Sumarse a empresa Inmobiliaria líder en su sector, para liderar el desarrollo del área comercial y equipo a su cargo.

Job Details:
Tableau's Core Services organization needs a talented Senior Technical Program Manager (individual contributor) who shares our passion to deliver scalable services and great features that securely and seamlessly integrate into any environment - so end users can see and understand their data, of course

This TPM position plays a key role in driving strategic initiatives, that enable more users to easily discover and use the power of Tableau.
Our team goal is to enable and accelerate platform emergence.

In this role, you'll be working with exceptional engineers and working across the Tableau and Salesforce organizations to deliver serious value-add to our customers and business.
You'll drive programs and projects that take our service platforms to the next level.

Who you are:

Driver . You have a natural bias for action and you can handle challenges that cross boundaries; you're a self-starter; you bring clarity, focus and structure to ambiguous situations.

Engager . You have outstanding organizational, communication, and relationship building skills conducive to driving alignment; able to work well in a cross-functional environment.

Team Player . At Salesforce, our number one value is Trust. This position requires cross-team and even cross-company collaboration to be successful. Trust in this role means personal reliability and credibility - you can be counted on

Experienced . This is a Senior TPM role, which means you have hands-on experience as a TPM. It means you understand how software development works in large organizations. You can define sensible milestones, influence without authority, and know when to escalate

Performer . You have a track record of success and delivering value. You have a passion for the TPM discipline

Technical. You have a solid understanding of cloud based technologies and software development, are comfortable working with highly technical teams, and leverage that technical know-how to optimize delivery

You're a Recruiter Salesforce hires company builders and you'll be asked to stay on the lookout for the best talent we can find, so we can continue this journey of helping people see and understand their data.

Preferred Skills:
• 5+ years software industry experience as a TPM or a similar role delivering value to customers
• 3+ of those years of successfully implementing or managing SaaS development programs; strong knowledge of the SaaS business model and its development lifecycle
• Top notch written and oral communication skills, including experience presenting to leadership, participating in the sales cycles, evangelizing project/program status, and handling escalations
• Exceptional time management skills to effectively juggle multiple demanding priorities
• Welldeveloped sense of ownership, along with structure, and strategicthinking skills, with the ability to excite and lead others.

Desired Skills and Experience:
• Technical Degree, e.g. BS Computer Science or other STEMrelated degree
• Experience with cloudbased technologies, preferably AWS
• *Accommodations

We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more.
Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Salesforce welcomes all.

job_description:
Se parte de una de las compañías de telecomunicaciones más grandes del país. En ClaroVTR buscamos un Subgerente de Data Engineer para la Gerencia de Estrategia Comercial y Advanced Analytics. El área será responsable de entregar valor a todas las áreas de la VP Mercado Personas a través de la disponibilización de datos y operación de plataformas para equipos de científicos de datos o analistas de negocio. Los productos que generan valor pueden ser una combinación de modelos ML/AI y datos procesados, con su respectivo esquema de operación.

Para lograr esto, se requieren capacidades fuertes en diseño e implementación de ETL/ELT, manejo de plataformas en la nube y conocimiento de sistemas de información (bases de datos, servidores, etc). por lo que buscamos un profesional con background en ingeniería de datos que tenga mentalidad orientada al negocio, y que sea capaz de liderar un equipo de alto rendimiento.

Funciones y objetivos:
• Trabajar en conjunto con los equipos de BI y Datawarehouse del área TI para asegurar que las herramientas y decisiones que afecten a los equipos de Advanced Analytics cumplan con las mejores prácticas y estén alineadas a las necesidades requeridas.
• Analizar procesos de negocio y sistemas existentes con el objetivo de descubrir nuevos datos para incluir en las plataformas de Advanced Analytics.
• Alinear esfuerzos con el equipo de científicos de datos para cumplir con la planificación de productos a desarrollar.
• Realizar análisis de calidad de datos en las plataformas utilizadas por Advanced Analytics.

Conocimientos Específicos:
• Conocimiento avanzado en diseño e implementación de ETL/ELT tanto en ambientes cloud como on-premise.
• Conocimiento avanzado en uno a más lenguajes de programación (Python, R, Scala, Java, C/C++ o similar).
• Conocimiento avanzado en tecnologías Big Data y Data Warehouse (Hadoop, Spark, MS SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, etc).
• Deseable conocimiento en uso de consola/terminal para scripting en Linux y Windows.
• Deseable conocimiento en una o más plataformas Cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure, otros).
• Deseable conocimiento en una o más herramientas Cloud ML/AI (AWS SageMaker, GCP Vertex AI o similar).

Otros requisitos:
• Título de Ingeniería Civil en Computación o afín.
• 5 o más años de experiencia en Telecomunicaciones o industrias similares, y/o experiencia en consultoría tecnológica.

job_description:
Job Requirements

KEY OBJECTIVE

La posición es responsable de lograr los objetivos comerciales de la línea de negocios Travel, se enfoca en el desarrollo y mejora de negocios rentables, cumplimiento de presupuestos y comercialización de seguros a través de los distintos canales de comercialización. Visualiza las nuevas necesidades de los clientes actualmente vigentes, a través del análisis de la cartera, estrategias de venta e implementación de mejores prácticas buscando en gran medida, un análisis específico y permanente.

MAJOR DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

· Es responsable de desarrollar, ejecutar y controlar las actividades necesarias para el logro de las metas comerciales estipuladas en el plan anual de sus negocios.

· Desarrolla y promueve nuevos negocios.

· Monitorear y promover estrategias de retención y persistencia para mejorar los niveles de cancelación y permanencia del cliente con el producto.

· Importante foco en el servicio al cliente.

· Supervisa y promueve el desarrollo de los negocios:

a. LATAM Airlines:

i. Oficina de LATAM Chile: dar atención y soporte a más de 120 ejecutivas (os) distribuidos desde Arica a Punta Arenas de acuerdo a las siguientes funciones:

1. Problemas con ventas desarrolladas entre CRS de Chubb y Allegro de LATAM.

2. Solicitud de facturas

3. Ayuda a FFVV con Ventas especiales

4. Consultas por coberturas y planes vigentes

5. Soporte en emisión en caso de contingencias

6. Dar soporte en accesos al sistema de CRS en caso de problemas con Allegro de LATAM.

7. Apoyo en capacitaciones a FFVV y Contact Center.

ii. Velar por la atención directa de Asegurados: Dar soporte a los asegurados (comercializamos 6.000 pólizas por mes aprox.) que se contacten con Chubb por consultas en sus pólizas y solicitudes variadas como las siguientes:

1. Solicitud de devolución de dinero

2. Solicitud de facturación de clientes

3. Soporte frente a duda o inquietudes de los clientes con respecto al producto de seguros.

b. JetSMART:

i. Supervisar el soporte a los asegurados que compren su seguro en el sitio web de SKY Airline.

ii. Superviosar la gestión y validar la producción mensual entre la aerolínea y Chubb, de tal forma de poder enviar a emisión.

2. Trabajo integrado con áreas de Soporte de Chubb:

a. Siniestros: Trabajo coordinado con el área de tal forma de poder resolver duda o inquietudes que puedan tener sobre los productos de Travel que se comercializan.

b. Operaciones: Coordinación con el área para emisión de producción con sponsors vigentes.

c. Finanzas: Supervisar la realización de los siguientes puntos:

i. Conciliaciones de producción de LATAM, SKY y JetSMART.

ii. Pago de facturas de comisiones.

e. Digital: implementación de estrategias en conjunto con el equipo regional

Capacitaciones a FFVV sobre productos de Travel vigentes con sponsors.

Reuniones con clientes sobre negocios vigentes.

Requisitos:

- Ingeniero Comercial o afines.

- 4 años en áreas de trabajo de Seguros Travel.

- Conocimiento del mercado asegurador local.

- Excelente actitud de servicio, pro actividad, responsabilidad, dinamismo y autogestión.

- Muy buen nivel de redacción y ortografía.

- Habilidades interpersonales para relacionarse con todos los niveles de la organización.

- Capacidad de asesoría a clientes internos.

- Capacidad de análisis para toma de decisiones.

- Excelente organización y administración.

- Responsable e íntegro.

- Habilidades de gestión de tiempo y priorizar.

- Inglés Avanzado.

- Excel Avanzado.
