job_description:
We expect leaders in product management at Canonical to be experts in the business of software - from ideation, to investment, promotion, advocacy, marketing and sales.

As the global platform company behind Ubuntu, with the mission to deliver all of open source wherever it is the critical ingredient, we offer a wide range of software opportunities.

If you agree that open source is the future of most software, then you'll enjoy being part of the team that aims to deliver it.

If you have a strong business head and a passion for software, with interests anywhere from IoT and the edge to the heart of public cloud, we can likely find a very interesting product for you to drive.
We are hiring product management in the following areas:
• Cloud native development and operations (Docker, Kubernetes, CAAS, PAAS)
• Web services and online services REST APIs and databasedriven sites
• Web services and online services REST APIs and databasedriven sites
• IoT embedded Linux technologies and capabilities
• Systems management for IoT devices, desktops, servers and VMs
• Containerisation and virtualization technologies
• Devsecops tooling, practices and services
• Commercial business systems for Canonical itself
• AI/ML ops and technologies
• Robotics and embedded Linux in a wide variety of industries
• Security offerings, practices and services
• Storage from raw disk to filesystem to network block and object storage
• Networking from bare metal to SDN and overlays
• Distributed systems design and implementation
• Linux, the kernel and Ubuntu itself
Product managers at Canonical must have software engineering experience in order to work effectively with their product engineering counterparts. They should drive product choices and priorities in partnership with those engineers.

They should also be forceful presenters, speakers and writers, capable of generating interest and excitement in their innovation and their products.
Product managers are particularly focused on the marketing and go-to-market strategy for their products.

They need to be comfortable with a requirement of content strategy and execution - building a following, optimising for search traffic, driving the narrative and generating leads that turn into business for the company around their ideas and their products.

We think of product managers as "startup founders", which comes with the bottom line expectation that you know where you want to drive your product, how you're going to beat the competition, and how to sell that story to the world.

In return, you get the brand of Ubuntu and Canonical behind you, and access to the machinery that powers the most widely used open source platform on the planet.
What could you do with that? Let's find out.

About Canonical:

Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu - the world's #1 cloud operating system.
Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company.
With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.

What Canonical offers:
• Work from home
• Learning and development allowances
• Competitive Salary
• Annual compensation review
• Recognition rewards
• Generous annual leave
• Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
• Priority Pass for travel
• Exposure to international business and technology

Misión:
Gestionar el canal de ventas online, asegurando su excelente ejecución y el cumplimento de los objetivos de ventas.

Descripción:
 Dirigir al equipo a su cargo: Ejecutivos de Call Center.

 Apoyar en la definición de la estrategia comercial para el canal de venta online por segmento de cliente y asegurar su correcta ejecución, asumiendo la responsabilidad de las metas de venta, rentabilidad, crecimiento, servicio y sostenibilidad del negocio.

 Mantenerse informado sobre los desafíos y tendencias de la industria local, nacional e internacional, proponiendo ajustes a la estrategia de ser necesario.

 Dirigir estudios y monitorear detalladamente a la competencia en los ámbitos relevantes del negocio para proponer ajustes cuando corresponda.

 Determinar variables relevantes y solicitar / evaluar estudios para proponer acciones comerciales por segmento de clientes, en el canal online.

 Proponer y validar las acciones comerciales para el canal online, garantizando que estén alineados con la estrategia del negocio. Aprobar las acciones de publicidad y promoción para el canal online.

 Buscar nuevas oportunidades de negocio de manera constante y proponer nuevas estrategias de venta por el canal online, según las oportunidades existentes.

 Participar activamente en intercambios de información, experiencia y conocimientos con las otras divisiones de negocio con el objetivo de generar sinergias.

job_description:
Description

Technically lead the development and execution of systems implementation projects in the LAM Region and lead the execution of engineering services in Maintenance contracts in the LAM Region, ensuring that all activities related to the engineering discipline(s) within the project are carried out efficiently and economically, in accordance with contract specifications, quality standards and safety requirements, as well as monitoring and guidance in all stages of execution with the designated teams, managing projects of high complexity and consulting for other engineering functions if needed.

Responsibilities:
• Contribute to the identification, definition and implementation of innovations, through studies and technical research to create value for the company, increasing the efficiency and operational excellence of the teams in the LAM region.
• Technically lead projects in their area of expertise, checking scope, schedule, costs, monitoring their execution and analyzing impacts, ensuring that projects meet all prerequisites, procedures and necessary criteria.
• Technically advise other areas in their area of specialization with regard to the development of projects, processes, new systems and methodologies, evaluating and providing support for problem solving in accordance with the project requirements, taking into account the particularities of each country in the LAM region.
• Develop and obtain approval of technical specifications, documentation, budgets and deadlines, according to the needs of the project, creating methods to evaluate the development of projects, through the definition and implementation of indicators for cost control, efficiency, productivity, flows, among others
• Analysis of opportunities and related risks, generating strategic actions to mitigate these risks and ensuring adherence of projects to customer needs, promoting interaction with team members in the LAM region, including third parties, contractors, suppliers, as well as with engineering on site.
• Ensure alignment with customers regarding the delivery of solutions, seeking feedback and generating innovations to drive and deliver improvements. Participates in project meetings and present all technical aspects of project assignments.
• Ensure the quality and efficiency of services provided by third parties, checking the scope of work to be carried out and the results presented, as well as conditions and costs, including suppliers contracted by other Units in the LAM region.
• Promote excellence in projects by implementing the best market practices, through benchmarking with companies, customers and suppliers. Taking into account the particularities of the different countries in the LAM region.
• Identify and analyze deviations and apply procedures for their resolution, in order to guarantee efficiency and use experience and technical knowledge for the development and implementation of preventive and corrective actions.
• Develop test procedures, as well as monitor and evaluate system tests, providing support, suggesting modifications, new tests until the expected results are achieved.
• Share experiences with engineering teams and training new employees in the LAM region.
• Ensure that the project is in line with and meets the company's health, safety and environment policies, checking the particularities of each country in the LAM region.
• Support the areas of contract management and Project Management, for requests for contractual scope increase in contracts (new scope of work, impact on costs or time, risks involved, etc.)
• Work jointly with the client, and lead the company's efforts, in resolving technical issues of the project. Interact with customers, subcontractors and others. Participate in meetings with the client and sub-suppliers, presenting the specific actions of each engineering task.
• Advising the purchasing areas in the Region, and customers, providing equipment and service requirements and informing potential suppliers. Identify and select potential new suppliers that serve the LAM region. Evaluate and agree on the contracting of suppliers of materials and services.
• Coordinate the levels of regional support (LAM) levels 1 and 2, coordinating the execution of this support, ensuring response times and resolution of support contracts. In addition to triggering and monitoring support levels 3 and 4 with global development centers.
• Define a schedule and monitor the training of the engineering teams in the LAM region and services in systems proprietary tools, in their specialties.
• Ensure that the terms of the support contracts are fulfilled (Reports, Certifications, Case Control and Hours control in each activity).

Your background:
• Professional degree in Computer science or Electronic engineering.
• Experience on electric field, knowledge of High Voltage environment within substations and Network control portfolio such as SCADA, DMS, OMS, ADMS, CLP programming, computational development.
• Creation of designs and solutions to the costumers.
• Experience working as an Engineer leader, coordinating engineering teams or services.
• Advanced English level

¿Eres apasionado por el core de la gerencia de finanzas? ¿Lo tuyo es liderar equipos y el relacionamiento con distintos stakeholders? ¿Te apasiona la mejora continua, la eficiencia en la administración de los recursos financieros y la adecuada gestión de riesgos? ¿Te encanta re-pensar, eficientar y automatizar procesos? Si es así y llamamos tu atención, te invitamos a seguir leyendo porque esta oportunidad puede ser para ti.

Nos encontramos en búsqueda de un Subgerente de Administración y Finanzas para organización del rubro Retail -Healthcare líder en Chile, #1 en su segmento, con presencia a nivel nacional y parte del portafolio de unos de los principales fondos de inversión de la región.

El Subgerente, quien reporta directamente al CFO, tendrá la misión de liderar los equipos de Contabilidad, Tesorería, Administración y Abastecimiento de la compañía, en conjunto a 40 colaboradores. Por la naturaleza del puesto, tendrá exposición constante con el CFO y con los demás gerentes de la compañía, liderando y gestionando los aspectos financieros y administrativos de la compañía, con el objetivo de asegurar la continuidad operacional y contribuir con el logro de las metas estratégicas de la organización.

Para esto, nos encontramos en búsqueda de una persona con un excelente liderazgo de equipos, analítica, proactiva, dinámica y altamente resolutiva, que pueda relacionarse de manera fluida con las diversas áreas del negocio, así como también con asesores externos, auditores, compañías de seguro y entidades financieras.

Principales responsabilidades:

• Liderar los procesos de generación y auditoría de Estados Financieros
• Liderar los procesos de tesorería, la administración de los recursos y obligaciones financieras y la gestión activa del flujo de caja de la compañía
• Liderar los procesos de negociación, administración y pago a proveedores externos
• Liderar los procesos de administración y pago a prestadores de salud
• Gestionar los procesos del área buscando la mejora continua, implementando y monitoreando KPIs de gestión internos, documentando y eficientando procesos, buscando el mejor uso de los sistemas informáticos de la compañía e implementando automatizaciones para reducir el riesgo operacional
• Gestionar la relación con asesores externos, auditores y compañías de seguro y entidades financieras, entre otras contrapartes
• Identificar y gestionar de manera activa los riesgos del negocio
• Asegurar el compliance societario y legal de la compañía
• Articular las iniciativas de ESG de la compañía junto con las demás áreas de negocio

Requirements

• Ingeniero Comercial o Civil Industrial, deseable MBA y/o magíster en Finanzas
• Experiencia de al menos 8 años en gestión financiera y de al menos 5 años en liderazgo de equipos
• Sólidos conocimientos de contabilidad y finanzas, deseable especialización en IFRS
• Sólidos conocimientos de SAP Business One o ERPs similares
• Excel (nivel avanzado), deseable conocimiento de herramientas de automatización

Benefits

• Caja de compensación

• Seguro complementario de salud

• Días administrativos

• Aguinaldos

• Descuentos en atención dental

• Modalidad de trabajo : 4x1, 4 días presencial y 1 día remoto

• Horario Lunes a Jueves de 8:45 a 18:30 hrs, y viernes 8:45 a 17 hrs

• Comuna Providencia

job_description:
This is a technical management role to lead a team thatdevelops Python and Golang micro-services that power our global software distribution engine. The world sees it as the Snap Store and marketplaces, behind the scenes it is a unified system that understands key concepts in software distribution - architectures, releases, betas, release candidates, stable releases, branches and more. We are expanding the range of software we can deliver through this system, and excited that we can transform the experience that people all over the world have with their open source software. If you have a passion for clean APIs, believe that great engineers ship software calmly and regularly against an agile plan, and know that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.

As an Engineering Manager at Canonical, you must be technically strong, but your main responsibility is to run an effective team and develop the colleagues you manage. You will develop and review code as a leader, but know that the best way to improve the product is to ensure that the whole team is focused, productive and unblocked. You are expected to help them grow as engineers, do meaningful work, do it outstandingly well, find professional and personal satisfaction, and work well with colleagues and the community. You will also be expected to be a positive influence on culture, facilitate technical delivery, and regularly reflect with your team on strategy and execution. You will collaborate closely with other Engineering Managers, product managers, and architects, producing an engineering roadmap with ambitious and achievable goals.

We expect Engineering Managers to be fluent in the programming language, architecture, and components that their team uses. Code reviews and architectural leadership are part of the job. The commitment to healthy engineering practices, documentation, quality and performance optimisation is as important, as is the requirement for fair and clear management, and the obligation to ensure a high-performing team.

This is a great opportunity to really learn how to do engineering of a highly-scalable SaaS product (think about the load on our systems when one of our largest Ubuntu Desktop snaps is updated by the publisher, for instance). In addition, you will have the opportunity to learn from Canonical's world-class security team as we work collectively to deliver this capability, safely, to our customers around the world.

Location: This role may be based remotely in the Americas, Europe, Middle East or Africa time zones.
What your day will look like
• Lead a remote team of engineers in your time zone
• Develop talent through coaching, mentoring, feedback, and hands-on career development
• Set and manage expectations with other engineering teams, management, and external stakeholders
• Be an active part of the leadership team and collaborate with other leaders in the organisation
• With your team, build clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang).
• Engage with many other teams at Canonical, as well as the open-source community and commercial partners
What we are looking for in you
• Good experience of leading modern, agile software development practices
• Experience of forming a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
• Demonstrative experience of being a role model for sound engineering principles and directly contribute toward your team's goals
• Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events
• You love to mentor, develop and grow people, and have a track record of doing it
• You are knowledgeable and passionate about software development
• You are focused on success and the timely delivery of high-quality software
• You value and nurture great team culture and spirit
• You have experience and commitment to agile development methodologies
• Software development experience in Python (experience in Golang in addition to that would be a big plus)
• Effective written and verbal communication skills
• Practical experience with Linux system administration
What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
• Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004
• Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
• Annual compensation review
• Recognition rewards
• Annual holiday leave
• Parental Leave
• Employee Assistance Programme
• Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
• Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events
About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Motorola Solutions is there for our customers when everything is on the line. In extreme moments — when a hurricane lands or when a fire breaks out.

And in everyday moments — when a package arrives just in time for the holiday or when a child doesn't miss the school bus home.

We unify voice, data, video and analytics in one integrated ecosystem to enable individuals, businesses and communities to work together in more powerful ways.
To help people make better decisions, act confidently and be their best in the moments that matter. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions and connect with a career that matters.

Motorola Solutions (

Our technology platforms in mission-critical communications, command center software and video security & access, bolstered by managed & support services, make cities safer and help communities and businesses thrive.
At Motorola Solutions, we are ushering in a new era in public safety and security.

Recently Motorola Solutions has expanded our Video portfolio.

It is this portfolio that will house the latest and greatest technologies associated with AI-powered solutions for video security, access control and mission-critical communications.

job_description: En el marco de la ley 21.015 de inclusión laboral, nos encontramos en búsqueda de un SUBGERENTE DE SERVICIOS TI. Dentro de sus principales funciones es : Dirigir la gestión de servicios e infraestructura tecnológica filiales de una empresa con filiales nacionales y extranjeras, a través de la definición, desarrollo, implementación y evaluación de lineamientos y protocolos requeridos para lograr la continuidad operacional de plataformas y soluciones,soporte y servicios al usuario, seguridad y disponibilidad de comunicaciones en proyectos y oficina central, e infraestructura tecnológica y gestión de información, de acuerdo con los níveles de servicios establecidos por TI y velando por la satisfacción de los clientes internos y externos por los servicios entregados por la Gerencia Puesto flexible a ajustes razonables o necesarios.

YOUR ROLE

We need someone like you to help create products that help millions of users reach their personal finance goals. If you’re looking to make an impact while leveraging innovative technologies, this is the place for you. As Senior Product Manager, you will have the opportunity to lead our product strategy for FinanceBuzz and its 3 million (and growing!) visitors who come to our site each month.

Our team has built groundbreaking technology that helps us understand our users and helps them reach their personal goals every day across our portfolio of brands. On any given day you might be leveraging our proprietary platform to create widgets or funnels with flawless user experiences. Or you might be focusing on SEO or improving the CMS used by our team. Ultimately you will be making an impact while working with key business stakeholders to define the vision, strategy, and roadmap for FinanceBuzz.

You will be working cross-functionally with passionate, extremely smart individuals with tons of opportunities for learning, growth, and mentorship. We are an extremely fun and tight-knit team (our company retreats are fabulous), so we are very selective about who we hire to ensure our company values remain high.

SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE
• Collaborate with stakeholders, designers, analysts, and engineers to create product requirements and KPIs

• Work with engineering and design resources on sprint planning, daily standup meetings, retrospectives, resource allocation, and project management against roadmap execution
• Analyze qualitative and quantitative data to develop new ideas and tests to improve the user experience
• Use market and competitive analysis, business goals, and technology capabilities to assess new opportunities
• Effectively communicate to a wider business audience project status and post-launch measurement of progress

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED
• 5+ years of product management experience with recent ownership of internal facing products (Content Management Systems, AdTech, etc.)

• Experience with multivariate (A/B) testing and revenue optimization
• Data-driven decision making and quantitative analysis skills with data analysis tools
• Strong leadership and communication skills
• Ability to handle shifting priorities and showing strong judgment in prioritization when working in a fast-paced environment
• Fluent in Agile

NICE TO HAVES
• Experience working on highly trafficked consumer-facing applications
• Experience in the personal finance industry
• Experience in building affiliate/partner widgets

En Negocio Financiero estamos en búsqueda de los mejores talentos para la posición de Subgerente/a de Desarrollos Digitales. Buscamos personas capaces de ejecutar la evolución Digital del negocio financiero. El rol es responsable de implementar nuevas iniciativas basadas en desarrollos digitales para aumentar el uso en el mundo físico y digital los productos financieros, con foco en la innovación tecnológica y con una alta sinergia con los otros negocios de la división Salud.

The Opportunity:

In collaboration with Sales, Market Access and Medical Affairs, accountable for overall sales, market share and management of the product portfolio in Chile.
Responsible for definition and implementation of marketing strategies for existing and new products within all therapeutic areas. Develops new business opportunities for each therapeutic area and ensures timely and effective implementation.

Liaises with Medical Affairs, Sales, Market Access leaders and other key senior cross-functional stakeholders to ensure that customer opportunities are efficiently translated into effective initiatives.

Must be able to work independently with minimum guidance from the General Manager while being able to influence senior management.

Responsible for leading the creation of the annual marketing plan and 5 year Strategy Plan to encompass the development, execution, and evaluation of strategies and tactics for all customer targets with input from cross-functional teams, external partners, and customers according to defined KPIs (key performance indicators).
Responsible for leading new product launches.

Accountable for production and sales forecasts, product life cycle, Advertising and Promotion budget and, in collaboration with Medical Affairs and Market Access, for the development of relationships with external consultants (e.g., publication planning agencies, medical education agencies, public relations agencies) and advertising agencies.

The Role:
• Under general direction, develops and implements marketing plans and strategies for assigned portfolio/product
• Implements Global Business Team (GBT) defined tactical priority initiatives
• Monitors, analyzes and evaluates product performance and customer feedback to generate new product ideas
• Provides recommendations for brandportfolio life cycle management and identifies new product opportunities
• Cooperates with relevant internal parties to ensure alignment of sales and marketing strategies
• Develops and maintains relationship with opinion leaders, customers, research institutions, patient organizations etc.
• Prepares and presents to the General manager and the Chilean Management Team, the Vision and Long-Term Marketing Strategy to ensure that sales, profit, and market shares are achieved for the whole portfolio.

The Marketing Manager CL will be involved in the execution of the tactical plans and the followup of all marketing expenses.
• Monitors local market activities and trends to get better insights and take the right decisions
• Analyses at least annually the Return of Investment of every action concerning scientific promotion, advertisement (digital campaigns, brochures, publications), to improve Company success and ROI.
• Develops and maintains strong relationships with key opinion leaders including clinicians, hospital pharmacists, hospital financial direction, purchasers, patient associations and other policy formers to optimally develop the product portfolio.
• Inspires and motivates the whole team, especially the MA and KAMs about the vision, the strategy, and the marketing action plan. The Marketing Manager CL will work in close collaboration with the General Manager CL, he will assign project responsibilities for the implementation and execution of the Marketing Plan.
• Works closely together with Medical Manager (remote), Sales Manager, Market Access Manager (remote).
• Works on KOL Management to develop advocacy among opinion leader through the different departments
• Prepares and proposes the positioning and strategy for price and reimbursement of newly registered and existing products. Provides support in the Market Access process, including market analysis, cost analysis, patient segmentation

• Product management, international and sales representative experience advantageous

• Business acumen and sense for business analysis.
• Business Strategy skills, organization of product launches, evaluation of the unstable market situation, sense for business opportunities.
• Good knowledge of Scientific Communication and promotion.
• Ability to create collaborative relationships and networking, both inside and outside the company.

Our Benefits:

Job Details:

Marketing Transformation Director plays a critical role in setting our Top Tier Financial Services clients up for success by prescriptively shaping and then leading the execution of large and transformational engagements at our most strategic customers.

The Marketing Transformation Director serves as a trusted advisor to Salesforce customers, providing guidance to Sales & Professional Services teams, ensuring synergies across each customer's projects, and ensuring the highest levels of customer satisfaction.

They are Salesforce Marketing Cloud delivery experts who are accountable for ensuring customer success, business value and leading the Salesforce Services team assigned to their account(s) to deliver the expected outcomes of the engagement and are internally and externally recognized as a business contributor, industry and product specialist.

Partnering closely with Client Partners and Engagement Directors, the Marketing Transformation Director leads both pre and post-sales activities, acting as the Delivery expert across the portfolio of products, marketing business process and engaging other SMEs across the organization to develop and articulate comprehensive implementation proposals.

The Marketing Transformation Director will then maintain the executive relationships and act as an escalation point within these engagements in a billable capacity, ensuring tight stakeholder alignment, offering proactive and prescriptive advice resulting in outstanding Customer Success.

This may include the following:
• Pre-Sales alignment
• Project kickoff
• Managing portfolio of projects & accounts
• Bringing industry expertise and perspective
• Drive better outcomes through extensive platform expertise
• Deep understanding of Salesforce solutions
• Engagement planning and alignment to customer objectives
• Regular customer sponsor checkins
• Services Renewal management
• Executive Relationship building

Responsibilities:
• Deliver high client satisfaction (CSAT) by consistently meeting/exceeding goals and metrics
• Ensure business value is realized (directly and indirectly) for each customer engagement that concludes with fully satisfied clients that are willing to be referenced for new potential clients
• Bring best practices to each engagement through your deep platform expertise by providing the Professional Services team with Subject Matter Expertise related to the proposed solution and client needs in order to ensure successful project delivery
• Positively impact client Services renewals (when applicable) by aligning customer success with professional services roadmap
• Align closely with Account and Services Sales team by leading presales activities such as the development of clientspecific proposals, SOWs, staffing plans, engaging with SMEs across the organization to gain consensus on an acceptable proposal
• Where appropriate and required for Customer Success, providing direct oversight to the project team during the full lifecycle of the engagement, acting as the escalation point for both the customer and Salesforce delivery teams
• Recognized as a valuable and trusted advisor by our customers and other members of Salesforce and continue to build a reputation for excellence in professional services Inspire people to do the best work of their careers, being a multiplier, amplifying the knowledge and capability of the people around you while continuing to provide an inclusive workplace as one of Best Places to Work
• Partner with the GotoMarket Team (Services Sellers) to drive continued growth of services Proactively mitigate and manage critical escalations and atrisk accounts; communicate effectively and appropriately with internal and external leaders and executives
• Ensure delivery of targeted margin percentages and project / program profitability
• A successful track record of working effectively in a highly matrixed and fastgrowing organization
• A passion and belief in the unique value of professional services in a cloud software company
• A deep understanding of the Financial Services industry and digital transformation, especially with large national and international Banks and Financial Services organizations
• The proven ability to develop customer relationships, understand their businesses, and develop a shared vision for accelerating their business success with Salesforce
• The ability to mobilize and inspire a diverse and geographically dispersed professional services team to drive successful business outcomes for the customer
• The capability to recognize complicated customer and internal relationships and navigate win/win outcomes for multiple stakeholders
• Experience in developing and executing project governance methodologies
• Demonstrated success engaging at CxO level and representing on Project Steering Committee Executive Boards

Must Have Qualifications & Skills:
• 5+ years of direct experience delivering a

ATENCIÓN
Maihue, la empresa chilena de dispensadores de agua premiada por su sabor y su compromiso con la sustentabilidad, está en busca de un nuevo
Subgerente de Marketing para unirse a su equipo.
¿Sabías que Maihue fue fundada en 2013 por un grupo de amigos preocupados por el impacto de las bebidas azucaradas y las botellas de plástico en el medio ambiente?

Desde entonces, han trabajado arduamente para ofrecer una alternativa saludable y ecológica con su agua con sabor y dispensadores de alta calidad.

Además, Maihue se enorgullece de haber sido reconocida por su compromiso con la sostenibilidad, recibiendo el Sello de Empresa B en 2021 y convirtiéndose en la primera empresa de dispensadores de agua en Chile en obtener esta certificación.

¿Te preocupa la crisis climática y la contaminación del plástico?
Maihue también.

Es por eso que se han comprometido a utilizar materiales reciclables en sus dispensadores, reducir su huella de carbono y fomentar prácticas sostenibles en toda su cadena de suministro.
Si eres una persona apasionada por el marketing, te gustaría trabajar en una empresa con un fuerte compromiso social y ambiental, y te sientes identificado con los valores de Maihue, no dudes en postular a esta increíble oportunidad

¿Te unes a nuestro equipo?
Postula ya y ayúdanos a seguir impulsando un cambio positivo en nuestro planeta

job_description:
Job Category:
Products and Technology

Job Details:
We are hiring a Senior Engineering Manager to build and lead our first ever GovSlack Site Reliability team

GovSlack is a compliant version of Slack that runs on dedicated, isolated infrastructure in AWS GovCloud leveraging modern cloud technologies.
GovSlack is an exciting new offering at Slack that is currently in beta phase and has a significant revenue potential once it is generally available

The team will be responsible for the reliability, operation, and uptime of GovSlack. They will architect and drive technical roadmaps, and operational and service ownership philosophy for GovSlack.

If you are an Engineering leader passionate about reliability, have a consistent track record of building healthy, highly performant teams, have experience leading large scale fault-tolerant systems, care about metrics and developer experience then this role may be for you.

What you will do:
• Lead, hire and grow a highcalibre team of Site Reliability Engineers.
• Develop strategic direction for the team and foster a culture of growth and learning
• Identify, prioritize and execute against opportunities to support and enable engineering teams with availability, performance, efficiency, resiliency, and incident response.
• Build and execute a reliability and resiliency roadmap that delivers on tooling and overarching systemic projects that will make GovSlack more resilient and enable every engineering team to ship more reliably, safely, securely and efficiently.
• Collaborate with Infrastructure Engineering and Product Engineering teams to find gaps and identify patterns
• Communicate effectively upwards, sideways, and downwards.

What you should have:
• 3+ years engineering management experience. Prior management of SRE teams is a strong plus
• Technical depth that allows you to develop and mentor others as well as build credibility with your team
• Experience establishing and measuring OKRs or team goals
• Critical thinking, excellent written and verbal communication skills
• 7+ years in software engineering of distributed systems or site reliability engineering position with a history of handson contribution
• Experience operating SaaS software systems in a production environment
• Experience with AWS or other major cloud providers
• Experience with CI/CD, observability
Infrastructure is a diverse and inclusive team that treats their colleagues exceptionally well.

We are happy to help you learn what you need to know; we encourage and support each other's growth and thus it's not expected that you would have expertise across all of these areas.
We look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative.

Come join us
• *Accommodations

Posting Statement:
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces.

We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more.
Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Salesforce welcomes all.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

job_description:
Job Description Summary
GE Healthcare is a leading global innovator in medical technology and digital solutions with more than 100 years of experience in the healthcare industry and approximately 50,000 employees worldwide.

We enable physicians to make faster, more informed decisions through smart devices, data analytics, applications, and services, powered by our Edison intelligence platform. We operate at the center of an ecosystem that works toward precision healthcare digitization, helping drive productivity and improving outcomes for patients, providers, healthcare systems, and researchers around the world.

Customer facing staff responsible for winning WHCXR business. Owns/influences commercial business operating guidelines and has ownership/influence over budgets. Guided by functional policy. There is autonomy within the role to enter into/execute Commercial arrangements. High levels of Commercial judgment are required to achieve outcomes required.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities
• Responsible for selling WHCXR product(s), services, parts, solutions, or projects across Latin America. Formulates strategies to counter competitors.
• Analyzes wins & losses to form actionable plans with S&GE.
• Prioritize plant shipments.
• Determine and define pricing.
• Interprets internal and external business challenges and recommends best practices to improve products, processes or services. Utilizes understanding of industry trends to inform decision making process. Propose campaigns for new products or product repositioning.
• Collaboratively set and lead budget targets (MS% and CM) with S&GE.
• Spearhead initiatives to boost investments and resources for improving market share.
• Champion recurring SBU events such as Signa Master.
• Develop and monitor Key Opinion Leaders.
• Educate PSSs and Sales force via S&GE’s GE Academy.
• Increase efficiency within Clinical application team to ensure providing world-class education to our customers
• Leads others to find creative solutions to address complex projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, or customers. Has the ability to evaluate quality of information received and questions conflicting data for analysis. Uses multiple internal and external resources outside of own function to help arrive at a decision.
• Has ability to attract and retain talent. Manages a team of experts in WHCXR. Leads projects with moderate resource requirements, risk, and/or complexity. Communicates complex messages and negotiates mainly internally with others to adopt a different point of view. Influences peers to take action and may negotiate with external partners, vendors, or customers.

Required Qualifications

job_description:
Why Verifone:

For more than 30 years Verifone has established a remarkable record of leadership in the electronic payment technology industry.

Verifone has one of the leading electronic payment solutions brands and is one of the largest providers of electronic payment systems worldwide.

Verifone has a diverse, dynamic and fast paced work environment in which employees are focused on results and have opportunities to excel.

We take pride in the fact that we work with leading retailers, merchants, banks, and third party partners to invent and deliver innovative payments solution around the world.
We strive for excellence in our products and services, and are obsessed with customer happiness. Across the globe, Verifone employees are leading the payments industry through experience, innovation, and an ambitious spirit.

Whether it's developing the next platform of secure payment systems or searching for new ways to bring electronic payments to new markets, the team at Verifone is dedicated to the success of our customers, partners and investors.
It is this passion for innovation that drives each one of our employees for personal and professional success.

What you'll do:

Develops and implements the company's production control functions including any of the following activities: master scheduling, production planning/coordination, shop scheduling and dispatching, material requirements, planning systems, work-in-process tracking, material and labor variance controls, and manufacturing performance reporting.

What qualifications will you need to be successful?:
• Understand and work technical aspects of the products, support technical functions including but not limited to Deployment (App loading of units) and repair.
• Approves quantities, schedules and parts lists provided to the material control organization to ensure timely and complete ordering, as well as receipt and issuance of production material requirements.
• Responsible for planning, reviewing, and developing production procedures and personnel.
• May coordinate activities with materials function using enterprise resource planning systems.
• Maintains reports to reflect scheduling, methods, support performance and process procedures.
• Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function.
• Regular communications with customers on invoicing, status of projects and repairs through power points and weekly customer communications.

Required skills:
• Experience with some type of production line either manufacturing or repair
• Knowledge of the logistics chain in Chile (transport, connections, etc.)
• Skilled in Excel, production and logistics planning, forecast
• Intermediateadvanced English (comprehension and writing)
• Management of processes and external suppliers
• Operational reports and detailed analysis to clients
• Ability to work with international teams
• Leadership
• Good control of operation costs
• Knowledge in implementing improvement processes in the production line (SixSigma certification highly valued)
• If you have some knowledge in payment industry it is a plus

Education and Experience:
• 5 years of verifiable manufacturing or repair experience.
• Degree in Administration or Logistics or perhaps in Production Engineering with experience in manufacturing or similar.
• Verifone is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Verifone is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status._

job_description:
Propósito

Lidera, define estrategias de trabajo y supervisa las actividades del área de auditoria de Operaciones y Sucursales, y a nivel regional a través del apoyo proporcionado a los proyectos en que participa, y garantiza que las estrategias de negocios, planes e iniciativas se lleven a cabo o se cumplan de conformidad con las normas, políticas y procedimientos internos vigentes.

Responsabilidades

• • Define estrategias de control de trabajo, para apoyar en el liderazgo y conducción de una cultura centrada en el cliente para todo su equipo a fin de profundizar las relaciones con los clientes y aprovechar las amplias relaciones del Banco, así como sus sistemas y conocimientos.

• • Establece una estrategia de trabajo basado en la mejora continua para asegurar que los trabajos de auditoria son realizados de acuerdo a la metodología establecida y los objetivos y alcances esperados. Además se generar información que permita mejorar continuamente.

• • Actúa como el Back Up del Director del Área en caso de ausencias, ya sea por motivos de viajes, licencias y asignaciones temporales.

• • Se asegura de definir herramientas de auditoria y estrategias para asegurar una evaluación objetiva e independiente sobre las áreas auditadas. Planifica, organiza, dirige y controla auditorias de áreas o procesos integrales con énfasis en aspectos relacionados con el proceso crediticio, considerando los riesgos y procesos asociados, con el objeto de asegurar el cumplimiento de políticas y procedimientos internos y externos, la efectividad de los controles, la identificación de riesgos potenciales, la generación de recomendaciones y el seguimiento de su cumplimiento. Planifica las auditorias asegurando el que el alcance se encuentre alineado con el plan de auditoria y con el presupuesto de recursos. Apoya al Director y al Gerente del Área en el cumplimiento de los objetivos definidos en la planeación anual para Chile y Latinoamérica y los proyectos BNS que se asignen. Posee una adecuada comprensión del negocio, sus riesgos y procesos.

• • Apoya en la definición de actividades de supervisión, la capacitación del equipo y la coordinación de alto nivel, para el cumplimiento de los estándares, asegurando la calidad e integridad de la documentación y soporte de los hallazgos, como la adecuada revisión de las observaciones con los clientes de auditoria. Supervisa las actividades de su grupo de trabajo, asegurando el apego al mandato de Auditoría y el cumplimiento de los estándares del Departamento de Auditoria, incluyendo la actualización de Team Mate, DAP’s, ITDB (Issue Tracking Database) y RAD (Risk Assessment Database).

• • Identifica y evalúa la materialidad de las debilidades de control, asegurando que se recaban los hechos y que se entiende su significado en forma completa. Identifica las causas subyacentes de las debilidades de control y proporciona recomendaciones prácticas sobre cómo pueden ser mitigadas. Identifica indicadores susceptibles de ser utilizados bajo la metodología de monitoreo continuo. Promueve el uso de data analytics en los proyectos de auditoria.

• • Realiza las actividades de auditoría asignadas, revisa observaciones y hallazgos de auditoría, asegurando que señalen claramente la extensión, costo y riesgo de error, incluyendo su impacto para lograr los objetivos de control, procesamiento de operaciones, reportes financieros y cumplimiento regulatorio. Realiza el seguimiento y propone el cierre de observaciones de auditorías, de acuerdo a los compromisos asumidos por la administración y las pruebas definidas para el cierre de las mismas, asegurando que el riesgo identificado se encuentre adecuadamente mitigado.

Requisitos:

• Título profesional universitario de carreras de Contador Público y Auditor, Ingeniero Comercial

o afines.

• Experiencia más de 3-5 años en cargo similares

• Experiencia liderando equipos de trabajo de auditoría

• Amplios conocimientos y experiencia en los siguientes temas:

➢ Auditoria de procesos y sucursales Bancarias

➢ Control Interno y Gestión de Riesgo

➢ Diagramación de procesos

➢ Metodología Coso/Control Interno

➢ Normativa interna y externa (SBIF, SVS, Leyes y regulaciones)

➢ MS Word, Excel, Power Point

➢ Herramientas de auditoría (Autoaudit, Team Mate, Lotus Notes, ACL, otros )

➢ Deseable inglés intermedio escrito y hablado

• Deseable certificación internacional de auditor interno (CIA) o Certificación auditoria ágil o

relacionados

Principales funciones:

Proponer y generar proyectos que favorezcan nuevas oportunidades de negocio en forma transversal a la compañía mediante la utilización y aprovechamiento de la tecnología.
Gestión del portafolio de proyectos e iniciativas de la compañía, incluyendo el gobierno, administración y control de los procesos.
Requisitos Ingeniería Civil o Informática, Industrial o similar. Al menos 4 años de experiência en gestión de proyectos. Experiência en manejo de equipos por sobre 15 profesionales. Conocimiento profundo de metodologías y herramientas tradicionales y ágiles. Conocimiento en SAP. Deseable Inglés de al menos B1. Disposición de viajar a EE.UU. y Brasil.

Modalidad de trabajo de trabajo:
Hibrido - 2 días en la oficina y 3 remoto.

¿Quieres asumir nuevos desafíos profesionales?
Únete al grupo automotriz más grande de Chile, AMERICAR El Distribuidor más grande de Chile

Vendemos alrededor de 5000 vehículos al mes.

Contamos con operaciones en todo Chile y en el extranjero.

Facilitamos servicios automotrices a la medida de nuestros clientes.

Somos lideres en colocación de financiamiento automotriz

En Americar queremos integrar a los mejores talentos, buscamos a nuestro/a próximo/a Subgerente de Proyectos de Transformación para Gerencia Comercial -Usados en Santiago

Tu desafío principal será colaborar en el diseño e implementación la estrategia de negocio que permita capturar las oportunidades del mercado de negocios autos usados del grupo.

Para esto, deberá hacer un seguimiento comercial y sistemático de las estrategias de negocios, analizar datos e información de mercado, y de implementar el "road map" tecnológico en conjunto con TI de Grupo Americar, y diseñar e implementar proyectos de mejora continua con foco en la implementación de tecnología para simplificar y eficientar procesos, desarrollar ventajas competitivas en conjunto con las áreas de ventas Retail, Desarrollo Comercial y Pricing e Inteligencia.

Funciones:
• Liderar proyectos de Trasformación de procesos digitales o basados en tecnología y él tiene que llevar a cabo estos proyectos que hoy están basados en soluciones externas y por otro lado están desarrollados a través de procesos manuales. 34 proyectos de transformación de procesos internos tanto de pricing, VPP, procesos de inteligencia, de reportería e inteligencia de data que se tiene que automatizar.
• Colaborar en el desarrollo e implementación de la estrategia del negocio de autos usados del grupo, alineado a los objetivos comerciales y financieros definidos, buscando oportunidades en mejoras de procesos comerciales y modelos de negocios.
• Desarrollar e implementar proyectos de mejora continua de la compañía con foco en el uso de tecnología para lograr eficiencia de procesos y desarrollar ventajas competitivas.
• Dirigir e implementar el road map de la compañía, trabajando en colaboración con TI del grupo Grupo Americar.
• Administrar el presupuesto del área.
• Evaluar permanentemente y sugerir la incorporación del uso de nuevas tecnologías, aplicaciones y medios de comunicación necesarios para mantener el liderazgo en el uso de estas herramientas en el desarrollo del negocio.
• Liderar evaluaciones de potenciales soluciones o business partners y liderar las relaciones con las principales áreas de negocio que el área mantenga.
• Trabajar de forma colaborativa y muy estrecha con las áreas comerciales de las empresas del grupo apoyando la definición de objetivos del negocio y en la obtención de los resultados esperados.
• Desarrollar el governance de la función general de cada una de las áreas de su gerencia, métricas adecuadas, capacidad de análisis y toma de decisiones.
• Reclutar, gestionar y motivar a un equipo altamente calificado bajo su responsabilidad.
• Mantener al grupo permanentemente actualizado en tendencias de mercado, herramientas, desarrollos y mejores prácticas.

REQUISITOS Estudios mínimos:

Universitaria Carreras:
Ingeniería, Ingeniería Civil, Ingeniería Civil Industrial, Ingeniería de Sistemas de Información Empresarial y Control de Gestión

• Ingeniero Civil Industrial o Ingeniero en Sistemas.
• Experiência de al menos cinco años en funciones similares (marketing, CRM, clientes).

• Habilidades en gestión de proyectos.

Misión:

Descripción:
Nuestros clientes y colaboradores cambiaron y obviamente queremos seguir ofreciéndoles lo mejor. Súmate a esta gran misión y tendrás la oportunidad de explotar todo tu potencial y ser protagonista de grandes transformaciones.

El team de Gerencia Omnichannel Supply Chain está buscando a su próximo Cargo Subgerente/a Operaciones Inbound para marcar la diferencia en nuestro equipo. Si te consideras disruptivo y valiente, ¡Prepárate! porque esto se pone bueno.

Misión: Planificar y controlar el correcto manejo de los activos de la compañía y de terceros utilizados en la distribución de las mercancías centralizadas. Proveer el abastecimiento de activos de la compañía, asegurando una fluidez continua en el movimiento de las mercancías encaminando la operación al punto de equilibrio financiero. Coordinar las operaciones de traslado de mercancías de proveedores externos hacia nuestros centros de distribución (flujo Backhaul) maximizando los ingresos por este concepto. Responsable de las importaciones y relacionamiento con proveedores.

Tus desafíos serán:

• Planificar, coordinar y controlar los procesos de traslado de mercancías de proveedores externos hacia nuestros centros de distribución.

• Analizar, actualizar y evaluar permanentemente las tarifas del servicio hacia proveedores de productos y costos de los proveedores de transporte.

• Coordinar y controlar retiro de activos de locales y entregas a CD.

• Ejecutar contacto con los clientes del servicio backhaul, de manera remota y presencial.

• Programar y controlar entrega de activos a proveedores y propietarios.

• Responsabilidad del flujo de las importaciones de toda la compañía.

job_description: Nuestro cliente, empresa perteneciente a la industria del desarrollo de soluciones tecnológicas, requiere un SUBGERENTE DE TECNOLOGÍA para apoyar su proceso de crecimiento. Objetivo del cargo: Responsable de planificar, diseñar y ejecutar la estrategia TI y garantizar un óptimo funcionamiento de los sistemas informáticos de los clientes dentro de los límites de requisitos, especificaciones, plazos y de manera de reducir los costos y riesgos asociados. Es responsable de la relación con el Cliente en los aspectos operativos y técnicos y de supervisar a los equipos encargados de la implementación y operación con foco en aumentar la calidad de servicio e implementar las mejores prácticas, en todos los níveles, que permitan llevar a cabo la mejora continua de los sistemas con tecnologías que aporten valor a nuestros clientes. I.Funciones principales: Visión integral del negocio -Entender muy bien las necesidades del negocio. -Liderar activamente la ejecución del plan estratégico. -Generar las estrategias y los ajustes necesarios que permitan alcanzar los objetivos propuestos. Gestión eficiente y eficaz de proyectos -Participar en la toma de decisiones para que el equipo del proyecto cumpla con el objetivo planteado. -Liderar el proyecto moviendo a los equipos en la dirección deseada, con impactos medibles y alineados a los resultados del negocio. -Analizar adecuadamente el universo de factores como el costo, licencias software, disponibilidad de proveedores, la estrategia de la tecnología, la compatibilidad e interoperabilidad, política de actualizaciones, etc. -Asegurarse de no sobrepasar el presupuesto y el tiempo de desarrollo. Resolución de problemas ytoma de decisiones -Negociar con el cliente respecto a las funcionalidades y el diseño de alto nível. -Manejar adecuadamente la ? gestión del cambio? y comunicar con transparencia y eficacia los avances, haciendo partícipe al cliente en cada momento. -En escenarios de contingencia, comunicar adecuadamente al cliente el plan de acción y estrategia implementada, junto con realizar la adecuada coordinación del equipo de trabajo, con el objetivo de mitigar el impacto restableciendo el servicio lo antes posible. -Debe apoyar y contribuir, en base a su experiência, a crear estrategias que facilite la determinación y resolución de problemas en el futuro. Liderar e implementar procesos de control de calidad y de protección de datos. -Garantizar el complimiento de la estrategia definida. -Documentar y comunicar adecuadamente la estrategia, con el objetivo que sea conocida y entendida no solo por el equipo directo, sino que por toda la empresa. -Mentoría al equipo de trabajo, proporcionando orientación y apoyo. -Debe estar preparado para entrenar al equipo en las tecnologías seleccionadas. -Realizar un seguimiento de los proyectos para asegurarse que sus instrucciones se implementen en forma adecuada, junto con registrar los cambios que se produzcan. -Asumir la dirección, para asegurar que todos los aspectos del proyecto se estén implementando de manera correcta. -Analizar los informes de cumplimiento proporcionados por el equipo. -Generar una adecuada política de protección de datos, junto con promover medidas preventivas y reactivas que permiten resguardar y proteger la información buscando mantener la confidencialidad, la disponibilidad e integridad de datos.

job_description:
En SKY queremos seguir creciendo y trabajando para ser la aerolínea preferida de Latinoamérica, y para esta importante misión nos encontramos en búsqueda de nuestro(a) próximo(a) Duty Manager - CL, ese SKYER tendrá la importante misión de supervisar y controlar todos los procesos operaciones de cara a pasajeros en aeropuerto de todos los aeropuertos de Chile, asegurando la calidad de servicio, puntualidad y seguridad en los proceso de check-in, embarque, desembarque y entrega de equipajes, siguiendo los procedimientos establecidos por la compañía, atendiendo siempre al cumplimiento de nromas y procedimientos de control interno.
¿Estás listo(a) para embarcarte en este nuevo desafío? ¡Te invitamos a formar parte de uno de los mejores equipos!
Somos una aerolínea de personas correctas, cercanas, valientes y comprometidas que comparten un propósito común: Poner el cielo al alcance de todos, entregando un servicio confiable y simple.
Estos serán tus focos:
- Velar y asegurar, desde el frente de aeropuertos, por la continuidad operacional de forma presencial y H24, cumpliendo con los estándares operaciones y seguridad definidos por la compañía.
- Supervisar el cumplimiento de los procesos y tiempos en check-in, embarque, desembarque y equipajes de la operación SKY Chile doméstica e internacional.
- Tomar decisiones ante una contigencia desde el frente de aeropuertos, así como ser responsable de autorizaciones de excepciones y soluciones de viaje en representación de la aerolínea de cara a los pasajeros.
- Supervisar y controlar SLAs establecidos con el proveedor de Servicio al Pasajero.
- Administrar y controlar caja chica asignada a los aeropuertos de Chile.
- Supervisar Puntos de Ventas, Lost&Found y Control de pasajeros durante el turno.
¿Qué esperamos de ti?
- Carreras técnicas de Turismo o Aviación Comercial y carreras universitarias de Adminsitración, Ingeniería Industrial, Civil Industrial y otras afine nos hacen sentido, pero no nos cerramos a otras opciones.
- Que cuentes con al menos 3 años de experiencia en posiciones similares en aviación comercial.
- Dominio de inglés anivel intermedio-avanzado (excluyente).
- Sería ideal que contaras con dominio de Ms Excel a nivel intermedio.
Con qué te vas a encontrar…

100% remote job

Ubuntu Security Technology Manager | Canonical | Chile

The role of a Ubuntu Security Technology Manager

This is an exciting opportunity to work on making Ubuntu the most secure out-of-the-box operating system in the world. You will work alongside fantastic security professionals already onboard at Canonical, and share your time between contributing technically, and managing team members and projects.

The technologies worked on by the security technology team include secureboot, disk encryption, confidential computing, kernel access control, and code integrity. These are developed alongside our partners in other Canonical Engineering teams (Kernel, Snapd, Foundations), the upstream open source community, and our business partners.

As an engineering manager at Canonical your primary responsibility is to the people you support: ensuring that they are growing as engineers, doing valuable work, and generally having a great time at Canonical. As a lead for strong engineers, technical leadership and a solid background in software security is a must, so that you're able to challenge and grow your team members. You will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.

Location: This is a Globally remote role

Key responsibilities
• Build and lead a globally distributed team of engineers through hiring, coaching, mentoring, feedback and hands-on career development
• Support timely delivery of technical solutions to address business needs
• Provide technical thought leadership for your team and others around Canonical
• Advocate and advance modern, agile software development practices
• Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values

What we are looking for
• Exceptional software engineering skills – design, document, plan, execute
• Demonstrated experience in managing or leading software engineering teams
• Demonstrated understanding in one or more of the following areas:
• Secureboot or other UEFI capabilities
• Code integrity primitives such as dm-verity
• AppArmor, SELinux or other MAC modules
• Confidential computing TEEs (Intel SGX, AMD SEV, arm TrustZone or similar)
• WIllingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events

What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.
• Fully remote working environment – we've been working remotely since 2004
• Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
• Annual compensation review
• Recognition rewards
• Annual holiday leave
• Parental Leave
• Employee Assistance Programme
• Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
• Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis

and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence – in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

job_description:
About Hazel

Hazel Technologies Inc., founded in 2015, is a USDA-funded company that develops new technologies to improve the quality and extend the shelf life of fresh produce throughout the global supply chain. The early-stage agricultural technology company based in Chicago is on a mission to reduce food waste. Shippers, growers, and retailers are constantly on the lookout for new ways to ship food further, enter new markets, extend the growing season, and have less food rejected at retail. The products of Hazel Technologies meet these needs by adding significant and measurable value throughout our customers' food supply chains.

Job Overview:

A Territory Manager at Hazel Technologies focuses primarily on customer acquisition and retention based on deep product and industry knowledge. Hazel Tech TM’s maintain consistent communication with customers, stay apprised of industry trends, and have a strong ability to gauge customer needs, provide the right product solution, and drive sales based on the added value the customer will realize. Hazel Account Executives are also skilled at routine technical customer support, including executing customer demonstrations, customer implementation support, and presenting key data points.

PLEASE SUBMIT ENGLISH RESUME ONLY

Responsibilities:
• Partner with customers to share the unique Hazel Technologies value proposition and fluently speak to the technical side of Hazel’s products.
• Meet quarterly sales goals and numbers.
• Appropriately engage Postharvest Specialists to support customer technical trials outside of routine demonstrations.
• Appropriately engage Product Specialists for logistic support such as customer training and product installation.
• Appropriately engage colleagues in Operations, Marketing, Sales and other departments as necessary.
• Achieve individual goals and organizational revenue goals.
• Understand regulatory requirements by region.
• Provide appropriate labelling support to ensure product is used as directed.
• Identify and interact with prospective customers to define value proposition and timelines for product adoption.
• Assist new customers by traveling to customer facilities and provide routine technical support for product implementation.
• Organize regular client meetings to ensure excellent customer service.
• Commitment and understanding of regulatory compliance with a specific focus on external regulations related to sales and shipments both domestically and internationally.
• Report and record all sales activities in a web-based CRM system (Salesforce).
• Negotiate terms and conditions with customers that reflect the value add.
• Collaborate with key decision makers with the intent to identify opportunities and develop ideas that deliver strong sales results.
• Attend trade shows and host customer events.
• Commitment to commercial team training manuals, training guides, training exercises, with the purpose of providing Hazel Tech customers with the best possible experience.
• Engage in all related, related and/or complementary activities necessary for the full development of the position.

Abilities:
• Ability to value sell by clearly communicating the economic value added by Hazel’s products at a high level and the crop specific technical benefits at a detailed level.
• Ability to prospect for new clients and sell services to them while continuing the sales process with existing clients.
• Ability to analyze industry data and trends to increase pipeline and inform existing customers.
• Ability to manage and keep multiple projects moving through a successful sales process.
• Ability to work cross functionally with Hazel’s R&D, Supply Chain, and Business Management teams.
• Ability to travel 70% of the time within region (Chile)
• Ability to travel 10% International. (APAC, EMEA, LATAM)

Requirements:
• 5+ years’ experience in outside sales as an account executive.
• Proven track-record meeting sales goals.
• Degree from accredited 4-year university.
• Familiarity with fresh produce supply chain / food retail.
• Experience with outbound sales, inbound sales (prospecting and new lead generation)
• Team player
• Strong communication skills.
• Professional working proficiency level English required.
• Possess strong interpersonal and creative problem-solving skills.

You'll Love Working at Hazel Because
• We've come to transform the food system. You'll be able to make a big contribution to our work at the nexus of technology, farming, and the global food industry - and we're only getting started.
• Our team is motivated by a set of shared values. These keep us on track and remind us how to be present every day in the midst of change and ambiguity. Collaboration, respect, positivity, and humility are all valued, whether in the office, at home, or on the fields, and we strive to empower individuals at every stage.
• Benefits and perks, of course!

Equal Opportunity Employer

Hazel Technologies is an equal opportunity employer. At Hazel, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at careers@hazeltechnologies.com

job_description:
Job Description

LA EMPRESA:

Reconocido Holding que agrupa negocios del sector marítimo/turístico y que opera en la zona Sur y Sur Austral de Chile, con oficinas comerciales en Barcelona y Miami, está en búsqueda de un Subgerente de Control de Gestión y Negocios para incorporarse a su equipo corporativo.

Se busca a un líder con un alto nivel de motivación, gran capacidad analítica y mirada estratégica del negocio y nuevos proyectos de sus filiales.

La empresa ofrece la posibilidad de formar parte de un equipo de excelencia y con grandes oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo dentro de ésta y sus filiales.

EL PROPÓSITO DEL CARGO ES:

Asegurar y dar soporte a los negocios en que participa el Holding para un adecuado seguimiento de la performance económica de los mismos e identificar oportunidades de mejora y crecimiento. Además. deberá relacionarse con los protocolos de administración y control del holding y sus filiales, tanto en los aspectos de control interno, legal y tributario.

LA POSICIÓN INVOLUCRA:
• Estructurar el presupuesto anual, con objetivos y plazos de acuerdo con directrices de la Gerencia y Directorio, así como coordinar su seguimiento y reportes mensuales a nivel de holding y filiales.
• Mantener actualizada la proyección de los flujos de caja consolidado del holding y la revisión de los flujos de caja de las filiales.
• Analizar en conjunto con la Gerencia General del holding los balances y estados financieros de la empresa y sus filiales.
• Identificar y evaluar oportunidades de negocio en holding y filiales.
• Proponer e implementar las políticas y estrategias para las actividades financieras del holding en materias de colocaciones, endeudamientos y derivados. Para esto deberá conducir progresivamente las relaciones con bancos e instituciones financieras.
• Participar y ejecutar continuamente las operaciones financieras de colocación, traspasos de fondos, liquidación de divisas y derivados.
• Participar en el seguimiento de coberturas de seguros para la flota y activos del holding.
• Buscar la incorporación de tecnologías de digitalización en el manejo de la información y al análisis de los negocios.

SE ESPERA DE TI:

a) Estudios: Ingeniería Comercial, Ingeniería Civil Industrial o carrera afín.

b) Requisitos técnicos: Conocimientos financieros, contables y técnicas de evaluación económica.

Deseable:
• Manejo de herramientas de Data Analytics.
• Experiencia usuario FICO/SAP
• Inglés intermedio/avanzado.

c) Experiencia: Al menos 3 años de experiencia en cargos relacionados.

d) Competencias:
• Trabajo en equipo
• Comunicación eficaz
• Orientación a resultados
• Proactividad
• Pensamiento estratégico

job_description:
1. Operations Management_
• Manages the Operations area and secures timely delivery within the quality parameters. Defines procedures and action plans to improve the service in order to meet the needs of the customers, according to internal policies and strategies.
• 2. Technical Services_
• Controls open orders, secures their fulfillment and the quality of the services from the time the order is closed to the product delivery.
• Supervises and makes sure that all orders entered in the system follow the appropriate procedures, and that the orders are received.
• Manages the consignment and lending with customers.
• 3. Inventory_
• Manages operations to ensure efficient inventory management, as well as forecasting demand.
• Ensures the control and effectiveness of the documentation process.
• 4. Training_
• Acts as a guide for the coordination of the logistics with the distributors, so that they can learn about our products and operations.
• 5. Quality Assurance_
• Responsible for following the process associated with service (OWL) and quality (SUPER) complaint systems, including communication with representatives of the factory in question, customers and customer service team in order to identify and implement corrective actions.
• Helping distributors and sales team to meet the quality requirements of the company, and reviewing complaint handling processes, and internal and quality audits.
• 6. CER Preparation_
• Timely reviewing, drafting and justifying CER for the country with the correct documentation.
• 7. Open Orders_
• Responsible for keeping open orders at the minimum level required while ensures effective delivery of the products.
• 8. Conformity_
• He or she should conduct all business and affairs in accordance with the laws and regulations, including the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) and Stryker's Code of Conduct, pursuant to the highest ethical values.

About Stryker:

Stryker is one of the world's leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better.

The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes.
Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually.
